loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, is aged 41, is married to a motorcycle driver and they're blessed with two children. She is in this transportation business for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 400 daily. Her net income from the business is spent on the school allowances for their children.

Due to insufficient capital in her business Liza would like to borrow a loan to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to repair & maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 46-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with five dependents; the youngest is ten years old.

She and her husband work hard on their farm growing rice. They have farmed for 21 years. When she is not occupied with farming, Elizabeth also spends her time selling tinabal (fish in brine) and ginamos (salted fish). These kinds of foods are very common to people living in the remote areas, far from the city. These foods are preserved in salt, which means that they can store them for many days for consumption.

Elizabeth is applying for a loan through CEVI to buy fertilizer, fish in brine and salted fish. The loan will help her continue her farming while also supporting the basic needs of her family. She will use all her farming income to pay for healthy food for her family and school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fish in brine and salted fish.

loans.name: Avenida 2 Group

texts.es:
Sobre las aguas de una presa sobresalen las cimas de lo que anteriormente fueron grandes cerros y ahora se han convertido en las islas de San Miguel Soyaltepec e Isabel María en Oaxaca. Dicho lugar es el mayor atractivo de la región y la fuente de empleo para los pescadores quienes además de su jornada diaria ofrecen recorridos a los visitantes sobre las tranquilas aguas de la presa.
   En dicha comunidad se integró un grupo llamado Avenida 2 integrado por personas responsables y trabajadoras. Ellos son: María y Andrea quienes venden comida típica; Fabiola, ropa; Zoila, abarrotes; Salvador, golosinas; Juana, abarrotes y tacos y Anahí, cosméticos.
   Fabiola es mejor conocida como Fabi por su carácter alegre quien fácilmente se gana la confianza de los demás. Es madre soltera de un joven el cual estudia en una escuela de la comunidad y es su mayor orgullo. Su espíritu emprendedor la motivó a vender ropa desde hace más de quince años, “no depender de nadie para lograr salir adelante” expresa de manera enérgica. Tras todos sus años de experiencia y gracias a las ganancias obtenidas pudo establecerse en un local ubicado en el centro de su comunidad donde, además de su producto habitual, implementó la venta de calzado y artículos de belleza.  Su éxito se debe al trato amable que brinda a cada cliente, los precios accesibles y las facilidades de pago.
   Por otro lado, al referirse a VFMéxico comenta, “los prestamos marcaron un cambio importante en mi actividad, me han permitido invertir en mayor cantidad y poder salir adelante en la temporada baja”. En esta ocasión invertirá el apoyo en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas, pants, sudaderas, playeras y sandalias  para toda la familia, de esta manera seguirá brindando un extenso surtido. Los planes a futuro son ampliar el local e incluir la venta de artículos de plata con el propósito de que su hijo no abandone los estudios.
*En la fotografía están todos los integrantes del grupo, Fabi viste blusa a rayas color blanco y negro.
texts.en:
Above the waters of a reservoir emerge the peaks of what were once great mountains and have now become the islands of San Miguel Soyaltepec and Isabel María in Oaxaca.  This place is the biggest attraction in the region and the source of employment for the fisherman who, in addition to their work day, also offer trips to visitors on the calm waters of the reservoir.  

A group called Avenida 2, made up of responsible and hard-working members, also formed in this community.  They are:  María and Andrea, who sell local food, Fabiola, clothing, Zoila, groceries, Salvador, sweets, Juana, and tacos, and Anahí, cosmetics.

Fabiola is better known as Fabi for her happy nature that easily gains the trust of others.  She is the single mother of a young man who is studying in a school in the community and is her biggest pride.  Her entrepreneurial spirit has motivated her to sell clothing for more that 15 years.  "I don't depend on anyone to succeed in moving forwards," she expresses energetically.  Through years of experience and the the profits gained from her work, she was able to establish herself in a store located in the center of the community where, in addition to her usual products, she started selling footwear and beauty items.  Her success is due to the friendly way that she treats every customer, accessible prices, and the ease of payment.  

Referring to VFMéxico, she comments that "the loans marked an important change in by business, as they have allowed me to invest in a larger quantity of merchandise and to be able to move ahead during the low season."  This time, she will use the support to buy pants, shirts, blouses, sweatpants, sweatshirts, T-shirts, and sandals for the whole family, so that she can continue to provide an extensive stock.  Her plans for the future are to expand the store and include the sale of silver items, with the intention that her son will not give up his studies.  

*All of the group member are pictured in the photo.  Fabi is wearing a black and white striped shirt.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, sweatpants, sweatshirts, T-shirts, and sandals.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 57 years old, married, and is from Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Evangeline runs a small sari-sari store, selling a variety of food and household products to members of the local community.  Her husband is engaged in farming activities. Evangeline has been in her business for many years and earns PHP 5,000 a month from these activities.  Evangeline is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Evangeline joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Dan Azumi

texts.en:
Dan Azumi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dan Azumi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Dan Azumi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Dan Azumi can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Dan Azumi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Dan Azumi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Three years ago, Sami, a 29-year-old married man, opened his school. The school is providing education to 116 students, 41% of whom are female. He explains that private schools that charge high fees are able to deliver better education as compared to schools of the same scale as his. Increasing school fees is not an option, as that will simply exclude many deserving children from gaining access to education. 

He believes that the learning environment is more important than anything else. He is planning to renovate his school and get it painted, so he has requested a loan of Rs 150,000. He also wants to buy some furniture. It will help him to grow his school and to make his school more child friendly.

loans.use: to renovate his school and get it painted and to also  buy some furniture.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a farmer and he needs a loan to buy cattle because he wants to sell those animals commercially. He is 21 years old. Currently, he only sells lettuce and he hopes you can help him expand because it's the only activity in which he has experience.  He lives with his grandfather and he helps him a lot because the old man is sick and he doesn't work.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Dúo La Lluvia Group

texts.es: Dúo la lluvia Doña Astrid dueña de la venta de licuados de fruta la única ella es casada tiene un hijo de 1 año ella empezó trabajando junto a sus abuelos y mama desde que ella era pequeña la la venta de licuados de frutas tiene 40 años de existir y es herencia de sus abuelitos ella trabaja junto a su mama sus clientes son del mercado nuevo de villa nueva y vecinos, sus metas son : mejorar la calidad de vida , comprar otra casa, ofrecer una vida mejor a su hijo, fortalecer el negocio ella quiere invertir en remodelar su negocio, y comprar fruta por mayor en el primer crédito que solicita a fape y kiva pago puntual mente.
texts.en:
Duo La Lluvia" (The Duo of the Rain Group)

Astrid is the owner of the fruit smoothie store. She is married and has a 1-year-old child. She started working with her grandparents and her mother when she was young. The fruit smoothie store has been around for 40 years and she inherited it from her grandparents. She works with her mother. Her clients are from the new market in Villa Nueva as well as neighbors.

Her goals are: to improve her quality of life, to buy another house, to offer a better life for her child, and to strengthen her business. She wants to invest in remodeling her store and to buy fruit in bulk. With the first loan she received from FAPE and Kiva, she paid back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fruit to make fruit smoothies to sell.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es: Milagro de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y mariscos desde hace 5 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economcios.
texts.en:
Milagro is 49 and lives in her own home with her family. She has sold fruit and seafood for the last 5 years and her business is located in the local market. She has many customers because of her good prices and with the profits obtained from sales she manages to meet some of the household expenses.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy more merchandise so she can maintain sales and therefore have a better income.

loans.use: to buy fruit and seafood.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
For 21 years Cecilia has been farming rice to help her husband earn a living. They reside in the community of San Miguel in the province of Bohol. Aside from farming, Cecilia also spends time cooking snacks and meal dishes that she sell to her neighbors to add to their family income.

She is asking for a loan to buy flour, yeast, cooking oil, vegetables and noodles so that she can improve the volume of what she can cook to sell. Her profit will provide school fees for her three children and afford them healthy meals. Cecilia aspires to make her businesses more successful for her family's better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, cooking oil, vegetables and noodles

loans.name: Katrina Marie

texts.en: Katrina Marie has been teaching in a private school to earn a living. Her parents earn their income from farming. Katrina helps her parents by supporting tuition fees. Katrina Marie's income now just covers her living expenses. She can't afford more expenditures. Katrina has borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative with the amount of 10,000.00 for her brother's tuition fees. She hopes that her siblings will be successful someday.

loans.use: to pay her brother's school tuition fee.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel, tiene 53 años de edad, está soltero, vive con 1 de sus hijos en el municipio de San Marcos, Ocotepeque, que colinda con el municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Anteriormente él se dedicaba a la construcción, pero viendo la oportunidad de obtener mejores ingresos decidió hace 5 años cultivar café, el cual vende en la misma zona. Actualmente solicita 10,000 Lempiras de préstamo para invertir en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes y brindarle buena asistencia a su finca de café. De esa manera el espera conseguir mejores cosechas y mejorar sus ganancias. Su sueño es crecer como productor de café y mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Daniel is 53 years old, single, and lives with one of his children in the municipality of San Marcos, Ocotepeque, which boarders municipality of Gracias. Previously, he worked in construction, but, seeing an opportunity to make better income, he decided five years ago to cultivate coffee instead, which he now sells in the area.

He's currently requesting a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to invest in the purchase of compost and fertilizers, in order to provide the best care for his coffee farm. In this way, he hopes to obtain better harvests and improve his earnings. His dream is to grow as a coffee producer and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers to support his coffee farm.

loans.name: Luz Clara

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  21 De Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Luz, tiene  46 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tiene siete hijos, tres ya mayores y los otros de 16, 12, 10, 8 y 3 años de edad, uno de los mayores estudia en universidad y los otros en colegio y escuela y son los que aun viven con ella.
Luz es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro y así sacar adelante sola a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días  a vender y cobrar sus productos ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, ella  también vende  en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando desean alguna prenda de las que ella vende, lleva más de 16 años con esta actividad la cual puede salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar, camisas, pantalones y ropa de niños. Lleva seis años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella surte más su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank 21 De Julio meet biweekly in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has long been known as the City of Royal Tamarinds.

Luz is one of them. She is 46 years old, divorced, and has seven children from her marriage. Two of them are adults, and the others are ages sixteen, twelve, ten, eight, and three. One of her older children is in college, and all the younger kids are in school.

Luz has had to work hard in order to provide for her children on her own. She works selling all kinds of clothing as a street vendor, making door-to-door sales. She goes out almost every day to offer her products as well as to retrieve payments, since she delivers her merchandise on credit and charges her customers weekly payments. She also makes sales at home, which is where her customers come when they want one of her clothing items. She has been in business for over sixteen years, and this work has allowed her to get ahead.

She will use this loan to buy shirts, pants, and children's clothing. She has been with her communal bank for six years and enjoys it because the loans they receive allow her to keep her business well-stocked. Her goal is to continue to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Hipolito es un hombre trabajador que proclama con todos sus actos el amor a sus tierras, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frutas y al cuido de  ganado. Con su esfuerzo y el sudor de su frente logro adquirir cuatro vacas que utiliza para la producción de leche y para el arado de sus tierras.
Hipolito tiene 54 años de edad y lleva 25 años dedicado a esta profesión que ha respaldado su economía familiar, pues tiene a cargo a tres niños con las edades de 13, 6 y 4 años. 
Actualmente solicitó un préstamo a Mi crédito y Kiva para poder cultivar tres manzanas de tierra que tiene desocupadas por la falta de capital para la siembra, tiene planeado vender una vaca para poder cultivar esas tres manzanas, pero ahora que recibió el apoyo de MiCredito y Kiva, ya no le es necesario. 
Sus planes a corto plazo son arrancar la cosecha y esperar a que el precio se eleve para poder sacar más de lo que invirtió y responder responsablemente a MiCredito y Kiva para poder seguir contando con su apoyo económicamente.
En un futuro no muy lejano, desea vender sus cultivos en Boaco, ya que es el pueblo más cercano, el gasto en transporte seria más bajo y no afectaría sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Hipolito is a hard-working man that proclaims his love for his land in everything he does. He works in the cultivation of corn and fruits and caring for livestock. With his sacrifice and the sweat of his brow, he has managed to acquire four cows that he uses for the production of milk and to plow his land. Hipolito is 54 years old and has been working in this profession that supports his household economy for 25 years. He is responsible for three children aged 13, 6 and 4. 

These days, he requested a loan from MiCredito and Kiva to cultivate 5.22 acres of land that are unoccupied due to the lack of financial resources needed for sowing. He had planned to sell a cow in order to be able to farm these 5.22 acres, but as he now received the support of MiCredito and Kiva, it is not necessary. His short-term plans are to start the harvest and wait for the price to rise so he can earn more than he invested and responsibly respond to MiCredito and Kiva so he can continue having their economic support.

In the not-so-distant future, he hopes to sell his crops in Boaco, as it is the closest town, the transportation expenses would be the lowest and it wouldn't affect his earnings.

loans.use: to be able to farm 5.22 acres of land

loans.name: Sokchet's Group

texts.en: Sokchet’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Sokchet makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Jean Philippe

texts.fr: Jean Philippe a 46 ans. Il a trois enfants dont deux sont majeurs. Sa boutique, très variée, est située dans un bidonville. Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, Jean Philippe demande un microcrédit pour augmenter ses stocks. A l’avenir, Jean Philippe espère augmenter ses revenus et ainsi pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Jean Philippe is 46 years old. He has three children, two of whom are adults. His shop, quite varied, is located in a slum. In order to meet his client's needs, Jean Philippe asks for a microcredit to increase his stock. In the future, Jean Philippe hopes to increase his income and thus be able to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy boxes of milk and candy.

loans.name: Flora Adela

texts.es:
Flora es una mujer de 44 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 16 años y una hija de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de vidrio y muebles de aluminio.

Ella es confiada en sí misma, conversadora y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘carretera a viacha’ caracterizada por encontrarse en medio del camino que conecta a la ciudad con poblaciones vecinas del altiplano, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura máxima de 10 grados centígrados.

Flora es de tez morena, físico robusto y vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la fabricación de muebles de aluminio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de vidrios, sencillos, dobles, triples, espejos catedrales, reflectivos, enmarcados, esmerilados y vidrio templado, “realizo la venta de vidrio y mi esposo fabrica armazones para ventanas, muebles, vitrinas o puertas, ofrecemos garantía en nuestro trabajo…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque brinda el servicio completo. La ventaja de su negocio es que los hijos ayudan en la venta y el esposo en la fabricación de muebles, la desventaja es transportar los vidrios grandes. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y sus ventas, ella desea comprar vidrios y aluminio por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.

Es por esos motivos que Flora solicita un préstamo para comprar vidrios y aluminio por mayor para fabricar muebles.
texts.en:
Flora is a 44 year old woman, is married, and has 2 sons who are 14 and 16 years old and a 12-year-old daughter. Her business is selling glass and aluminum household furnishings. 

She is self confident, talkative, and very hardworking. Her business runs in the "road to viacha" zone, characterized by being in the middle of the road connecting the neighbouring populations of the highlands to the city. It has a cold and dry climate, with a maximum temperature of 10 degrees celsius. 

Flora has a brown complexion, a robust physique and dresses traditionally (hat, shawl, and skirt). She shares her life with her husband, who makes a living from the manufacture of aluminium furnishings, and with her children who study in school. They live in a rented room made of bricks with a corrugated iron roof and a wood floor. They have potable water, electrical energy, and a sewer system.

Her business is the sale of glass, single, double, triple, cathedral mirrors, reflective, framed, frosted and tempered glass. She runs the selling of glass and her husband makes frames for windows, cabinets and doors. They offer warranty for their work. Her business is successful because it gives the complete service. The advantage of her business is that her children help her with her selling and her husband with the fabrication of furnishings. The disadvantage is in transporting large glass. Her dream is to improve her business and her sales; she wishes to buy wholesale glass and aluminum. This is the first sequence of loan with the institution, in one year of running this business. 

For these reason Flora requests a loan to buy glass and aluminum wholesale to make aluminium cabinets.

loans.use: para comprar vidrios y aluminio por mayor para fabricar muebles.

loans.name: Sridevi

texts.en:
Sridevi is a resident of Muniguda village in the Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 40 years old. She has a small family with her husband and three children. Her husband is running a cosmetic shop. Sridevi makes leaf plates and sells them in the nearest market. No doubt she has everything required for the basic necessities of life like a small but permanent income, a two-wheeler and other related items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not happy due to the unavailability of a Pakka (well-built) house.

It doesn’t mean that they are staying in an open place or a thatched house. But they are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent charged by the house owner. The rented house is made of mud and roofed with asbestos, which creates a very critical situation during the rainy season. The most important thing is the house is not completely secure and safe.

In this situation, she decided to construct a good standard RCC (Reinforced Cement Concrete) house. She has already started to construct the house. But the funds that are available are not sufficient to complete it. So she decided to borrow a loan from a bank or other financial institution. At this point, Sridevi came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn details about a house loan.

Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan for her house construction. With the loan, Sridevi will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and coloring of the concrete on the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection. She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few months and she will be proud to be a house owner in society.

loans.use: to complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and coloring of her the house as well as complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en: Aliyu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. He anticipates a good harvest this season, and has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Aliyu would have to sell his maize at harvest,  when prices are at their lowest, to meet immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. He will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Aliyu is thankful for the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Arychel Group

texts.es:
En algunas comunidades de Oaxaca la economía se ve claramente beneficiada durante la temporada de zafra (proceso donde se refina la caña de azúcar) pues la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a esta actividad. Al recorrer el camino que lleva a dicha región se puede apreciar a los campesinos cortar la caña  y subirla hasta los carros que la transporta hasta los ingenios donde finalmente se lleva el trabajo final de extracción. 
   En uno de los municipios se ha integrado el grupo llamado Arychel nombre que refiere a la hija de una de las integrantes. Ellas son: María Trinidad quien vende pasteles y tacos; Mayra, ropa y mariscos; Erika, ropa; Guadalupe y Encarnación, abarrotes y Arely quien maneja una refaccionaria.
   Doña María Trinidad es una mujer muy noble, trabajadora y responsable; todos la conocen como  Trini por la confianza que genera. En su actividad ha encontrado un refugio tras la pérdida de su esposo ya que ésta la mantiene activa y en contacto con personas amigables. Así pues, desde hace 33 años inició con la elaboración y venta de pasteles motivada por la necesidad de ofrecer lo mejor a sus dos hijos. “Aprendí junto a mi esposo, nos guiábamos con las recetas de libros de cocina que comprábamos, pero poco a poco las personalicé y les di mi toque especial" expresó contenta.
   Como pareja lograron hacer realidad sus sueños, pues él soñaba con tener una taquería y ella, una pastelería, "con esfuerzo, dedicación, empeño y la bendición de Dios todo es posible" mencionó. Gracias a ello hoy en día cuenta con un lugar en condiciones para elaborar los ricos pasteles que son tan solicitados en su comunidad. El éxito ha sido notable, sobre todo, por ser la principal encargada de realizar los pasteles para las bodas, bautizos y xv años de los lugareños.
   Para continuar su crecimiento invertirá el préstamo en la compra de granillo, domos, platos, pintura, gel, huevos, leche, azúcar, mermelada, mantequilla y harina. Finalmente menciona con mucho sentimiento, “antes mi esposo era quien me ayudaba, ahora es mi hija y mi pequeña nieta la cual dice que de grande quiere ser como yo".
*La fotografía fue tomada donde prepara los pasteles, detrás se puede apreciar parte de su material de trabajo  y sobre la mesa un pastel ; ella viste una blusa color blanco.
texts.en:
In some communities of Oaxaca, the economy is clearly boosted during the time of the sugar cane harvest (a process where sugarcane is refined), since the majority of the residents make a living in the sugarcane business.  On the way the region, you can appreciate the sight of farmers cutting sugarcane and loading it onto the carts that transport it to the factories where the final process of extraction takes place. 

In one of the towns in the area, a group called Arychel was formed, named after the daughter of one of the members.  The members are: María Trinidad, who sells cakes and tacos, Mayra, clothing and seafood, Erika, clothing, Guadalupe and Encarnación, groceries, and Arely who manages a repair shop.  

María Trinidad is a very noble woman who is hard-working and responsible.  Everyone knows her as Trini because of the trust that she brings out in people.  She has found a refuge in her work from the loss of her husband since it keeps her active and in contact with friendly people.  33 years ago, she started making and selling cakes, motivated by the necessity to give the best to her two children.  "I learned with my husband. We used recipes from cook books that we bought as our guide, but little by little we personalized them and gave them our special touch," she happily adds.

As a pair, they were able to make their dreams a reality, since he dreamed of having a taqueria and she, a bakery.  "Through effort, dedication, resolution, and the grace of God, everything is possible," she says.  Those things have brought her to the point where today she has a proper kitchen where she makes delicious cakes that are much in-demand in her community.  Her success has been notable, above all because hers is main bakery to provide cakes for the weddings, baptisms, and birthdays of the residents.  
 
To continue her growth, she will use the loan to buy sprinkles, cake trays, plates, paint,  gel, eggs, milk, sugar, jam, butter, and flour.  Lastly, she is moved by the thought that "before, it was my husband who helped me, and now it is my daughter and my little granddaughter who says that she wants to grow up to be like me."

*This photo was taken in the place where she makes cakes.  In the background you can see some of her work materials and a cake on the table.  She is wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy sprinkles, cake trays, plates, paint, gel, eggs, milk, sugar, jam, butter, and flour.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Yusuf had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to our support, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yusuf benefits from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. He is grateful to have the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Dopé est une femme âgée de 42 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Dopé est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un petit hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Dopé désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des paniers de tomates fraîches, des tas d’oignons et de légumes en vue de bien revendre puis d’en tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Dopé is a woman of 42 who lives in Baguida. Married and the mother of two children, Dope sells groceries and stocks up three times a month at the market. She sells her wares under a little shed roof at the front of her house.

Dopé wishes to have this loan to finance her purchase of baskets of fresh tomatoes, piles of onions, and vegetables, so as to have a better turnover and make a profit. She wants to earn more income so that she can better contribute to family expenses.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of fresh tomatoes, two piles of onions, and two piles of vegetables.

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es:
La líneas de expresión fuertes que tiene Edgar, da una primera impresión limitada, sin embargo, este analista de crédito de 35 años de edad, es una des personas más sociables en su ramo, pues sus deseos de superación, junto con su hijo de once años de edad, siendo padre soltero, lo han llevado por la vida de la humildad y el esfuerzo. 
Edgar es una persona versátil, no solo trabaja en ello, también es transportista desde hacer tres año e ingeniero agrónomo. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su madre y de sus hermanos, sin embargo, las condiciones de servicios higiénicos deberían de ser mejores debido a su arduo trabajo para una calidad de vida mejor. Por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar azulejo, una ducha y pintura para poder mejorar su baño. Esto le permitirá bañarse sin la preocupación de que salga algún animal o simplemente deje de funcionar. En un futuro, este hombre trabajador planea comprar su propia casa y convertirse en una comerciante.
texts.en:
Edgar's strong features may give a harsh first impression but, in fact, this 35-year-old credit analyst is one of the most sociable people in his trade. He is the single father of an eleven-year-old boy, and his desire to improve himself and provide for his son have lead him down a path of humility and hard work.

Edgar is a versatile person. For the past three years, he has also been working as a delivery driver, and also holds a degree in Agricultural Engineering. He is fortunate to be able to count on his mother and siblings' support. However, Edgar works hard in order to achieve a better quality of life, and sanitary conditions at home need improvement. For this reason, he is requesting a loan. He will use it to buy tile, paint, and a shower, to remodel the bathroom. This will allow him to wash up without worrying that animals might come out or that the shower might just stop working.

In the future, this hardworking man plans on buying his own house and becoming a successful trader.

loans.use: to buy tile, paint, and a shower.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 53 years old. She is married with four children.

She has had a potato-planting business for 10 years.

Susan will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds and manure, and she hopes this will help her to boost business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful and to be a role model to others.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds and manure to help her boost her business.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 33 years old and married, and she is blessed with one child.

Roseline has requested a loan to purchase cosmetics, and she hopes this will generate income.

Her hopes and dreams are to to pay school fees and establish her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Jomaira Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Cristo Rey, esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Jomaira, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, el cual  estudian en una escuela de la localidad. El marido es Ing. Mecánico.
Jomaira  es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo por el bien de su familia, ella tiene un pequeño deposito en su casa  donde vende agua ya sea en funda, botellas, galón o bidones, tiene una persona que le ayuda en las entregas a domicilio y también entrega a ciertas tiendas del lugar al por mayor,  ella lleva 8 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual ha podido mejorar gracias a la ayuda de los créditos razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución y con las personas que le ayudan para que ella y sus compañeros puedan recibir los créditos.
Este crédito es para surtir mas su depósito va  comprar agua en todas las presentaciones que vende. Lleva 4 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the community bank "Grupo De Crédito Cristo Rey" meets every 15 days. This place is known for its traditional culture, and also for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, which are San Jacinto and San Clemente. 

This is where Jomaira lives. She is 25 years old, and she is a common-law marriage through which she has a seven year old son who is attending school in the community. Her husband is a mechanical engineer.

Jomaira is a woman who likes to earn her own, for the welfare of her family. She has a small place in her house where she sells water: in bags, bottles, by the gallon or drums. She has a person that helps her by delivering water to homes, and she also sells water wholesale to some stores. 

She has been working in this for 8 years, which has improved, thanks to small loans. For that reason, she is very grateful for the institution and for the people who have helped her and her colleagues to receive loans.

This loan is to increase her stock. She will be water in all of the forms of packaging.

She has been with the community bank for four years, and she likes it because the loans are very helpful for her. Her dream is to succeed and give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy water.

loans.name: Cristina Maribel

texts.es: Cristina  tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil soltera vive en el campo con sus padres y sus hermanos, hace 3 años atrás se dedica atender su pequeña tienda que fue incrementando poco a poco las ganancias de lo que vende vuelve a comprar nuevos productos. Cristina necesita el dinero para comprar mercadería que todavia no tiene tratando de poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes en el campo ya que por la falta de transporte, el tiempo no pueden salir a la ciudad a comprar,  adquirira  una vitrina para exibir su mercederia, seguir ampliando su negocio ya que esta es su más grande aspiración.
texts.en:
Cristina is 23 years old. She is single and lives in the countryside with her parents and siblings. Three years ago, she began running her own store, which has been growing little by little. She uses the money that she earns to purchase new products.

Cristina needs this loan to purchase new merchandise because she is still trying to be able to satisfy her customers' needs. Due to a lack of transportation in the countryside, she does not have time to go to the city to make purchases. She will also purchase a glass case in which to display her merchandise. She will continue to grow her business, which is her greatest aspiration.

loans.use: purchase new products and a case in which to display them.

loans.name: Maritza Aracely

texts.es: Maritza es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de verduras, actividad que lleva realizando más de dos años, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes. Ella tiene 24 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida, su hija de 4 años de edad y su grupo familiar, con los que vive en casa de su propiedad. Maritza desea surtir su negocio de venta de verduras, para lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: tomates, cebollas, güisquil, papas, zanahorias, entre otros productos que distribuye de forma ambulante.
texts.en:
Maritza is an entrepreneurial woman who makes a living by selling vegetables, which she has done for more than two years, so she has many customers. She is 24 years old and lives with her partner, their 4-year-old daughter, and their families. They live in a home on their own property.

Maritza would like to stock her vegetable sales business, so she has requested a loan from FUSAI to purchase tomatoes, onions, chayote squash, potatoes, carrots, and other products that she will sell on foot.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, chayote squash, potatoes, carrots, and other products that she will sell on foot.

loans.name: Marcia Jannet

texts.es: Marcia tiene 27 años de edad de estado civil casada, tiene 3 hijos Erick de 5 años estudia en una escuela gratuita del sector, Nicol de 3 y John permanecen junto a sus padres que hace tres años de dedican a la producción de mora gracias a  su trabajo y sacrificio obtienen su sustento diario. Marcia necesita el dinero para invertir en más cultivos comprara calcio y abono para iniciar  , poder incrementar sus ganancias para continuar cubriendo sus necesidades de esta humilde familia que a futuro desea poder tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Marcia is 27 years old, married, and has three sons. Erick, 5 years old, attends a local free school. Sons Nicol, 3, and John are still with their parents. For the past three years, they have been growing blackberries.

Thanks to their work and sacrifice, they earn enough to cover their daily needs. 

Marcia needs the money to invest in more cops. She will buy calcium fertilizer and manure to start. She can grow her earnings to continue taking care of the necessities for this humble family, who in the future wishes to have its own house.

loans.use: to buy calcium fertilizer and manure, which she will use to plant more blackberry plants.

loans.name: Lizbeth Fiorella

texts.es:
Lizbeth es una joven estudiante de Redes de Computación y Comunicación de Datos, la cual decidió estudiar porque le gusta todo lo relacionado a la informática, además tiene un tío que se dedica a eso, lo cual le llamó mucho la atención. Además, le gustaría innovar o crear algo que pueda beneficiar a muchas personas.

Le va muy bien en sus estudios, solo le faltan 6 meses para poder culminar su carrera, y obtener su título profesional. Cuando termine su carrera le gustaría trabajar una empresa en la cual pueda ganar mucha experiencia en todo lo referente a la informática, para luego poder cumplir su mayor sueño, que es formar su propia empresa y con esto ayudar a su familia sobretodo a su padre que se encuentra delicado de salud. Otro de los sueños que tiene Lizbeth es poder ayudar a los niños y ancianos sin hogar, que viven en las calles.

El mayor obstáculo por el que está atravesando Lizbeth es que sus padres están separados, ella vivió separada de su hermano hasta hace 4 años que nuevamente están viviendo juntos. Ella vivía con sus tías quienes no la trataban muy bien por el hecho de que su padre no la apoyaba. La enfermedad de su padre le impide trabajar para apoyarla, por ese motivo corre el riesgo de no seguir con sus estudios faltando tan poco para que acabe su carrera.

Debido a todo lo que le sucede, Lizbeth recurre a KIVA para que puedan apoyarla y así logre terminar su carrera que tanto le gusta. Con ese crédito, Lizbeth podrá pagar sus mensualidades, dándole menos preocupación a sus abuelos, lo que generará en ella gran motivación y se esforzará más por salir adelante; porque no tendrá que preocuparse mucho por lo económico.

A Lizbeth le gustaría expresarles algunas líneas: "Me siento muy agradecida y feliz por el apoyo que me brindan, sobretodo porque mis abuelos no se preocuparán mucho por lo económico. Con este apoyo me motivan a salir adelante, al saber que existen personas que apoyan a jóvenes como yo, que a pesar de tener problemas económicos, no me rindo y lucho por lograr mis objetivos. Que Dios los bendiga a cada uno de ustedes, muchas gracias KIVA!
texts.en:
Lizbeth is studying Computer Networks and Data Communication. She went into this field because she likes everything that has to do with computer science. She also has an uncle who works in this field, which sparked an interest in her. She also would like to innovate or create something new that could benefit many people.

She is doing very well in school. She has six months left to go to complete her studies and earn her professional degree. When she finishes, she would like to work for a company and gain lots of practical experience in order to achieve her dream one day, which is to start her own company. This would allow her to help her family, particularly her father, who is in delicate health. Another of Lizbeth's dreams is to be able to help homeless children and elderly people who live on the street.

The main hurdle that Lizbeth faces is that her parents are separated. She and her brother lived apart until four years ago, when they started living together again. She was living with her aunts, who didn't treat her very well because her father didn't help support her, but his illness prevented him from working and still does now. For this reason, it is still possible that Lisbeth might have to drop out from school even now that she is so close to finishing.

Because of everything that is going on, Lizbeth has come to KIVA for support, so that she can finish what she was so happy to start. She will use her loan to cover her monthly payments. Her grandparents won't have to worry so much and, without having to worry about finances, she will be even more motivated to work hard in order to get ahead.

Lizbeth would like to say a few words: "I am very happy and grateful for the support you are giving me, especially because my grandparents won't have to worry so much about money. Your help motivates me to get ahead by letting me know that there are people out there who support young people like me in spite of the financial problems we may have. I won't give up and I will work hard to achieve my goals. God bless each and every one of you. Thank you so much, Kiva!"

loans.use: to complete her studies in Computer Networks and Data Communication.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a mother of 11 children, Lolita learned to work hard. While living in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol with her husband, she learned farming vegetables, like string beans. She also raise hogs for supplemental income.

Lolita needs an additional capital to be used to buy fertilizer, feed and seeds. The loan will ensure that her hogs are fattened to be sold in four month's time. The fertilizer will also allow her crops to grow healthy, thus increasing her yield.

She hope that through her business, her two remaining dependents can continue their studies and her family can eat healthy meals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, feed and seeds.

loans.name: Sakara Ngoma Group

texts.en:
Fulgence is 37 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 11 and 18. In the photo, he is the only one who has a paper in his hands. He owns a brick-making business. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. and has been in this business for two years. Fulgence is the leader of this group, which is called Rusakara Ngoma.

Fulgence has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to make more bricks to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, pay school fees for his children, reinvest in his business, and renovate his house.

loans.use: to make more bricks to sell.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty's Group is formed by 16 farmers in Teso District and is being represented by Betty, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 38 years old, married and has three children. Betty has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Betty isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Betty will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase three solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Betty's Group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 9.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase three solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
Félix, es un hombre de cincuenta y tres años de edad, esforzado que inicia día a día su labor de ordenar sus estantes y abrir su pulpería, la cual con mucho entrega ha hecho crecer. Este hombre honesto, ha logrado anexar a su inventario una variedad de productos con los que no contaba.
El confía en los financiamientos que otorgan Kiva y MiCrédito, por eso ha solicitado un credito que planea usar para comprar una gran cantidad de granos básicos, enlatados, embutidos y carnes, dado que en esta temporada eso es lo que más se vende. En un futuro desea poder mejorar los frezeres y estantes con los que cuenta.
texts.en:
Felix is a man of fifty-three years old, hard-working, who begins his work each day putting his shelves in order and opening his small grocery store, which with much effort he has made grow. This honest man has managed to add to his inventory a variety of products that it did not have.

He trusts in the financing that Kiva and MiCrédito award. He has therefore requested a loan that he plans to use to buy a large quantity of staple foods, canned goods, sausages, and meats, since in this season that is what sells the most. In the future he wishes to be able to improve the freezers and shelves that he currently has.

loans.use: buy a large quantity of staple foods, canned goods, sausages, and meats.

loans.name: Ercilia Iveth

texts.es: Ercilia tiene 23 años de edad y cuenta con una tienda de productos básicos desde hace 5 años, la cual es muy visitada por los vecinos, ya que es de las más surtidas de la zona. Ella es madre soltera y vive junto a su hijo de 4 años de edad, al que está sacando adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Ercilia desea surtir su negocio, ya que en época navideña las ventas son mejores, y los clientes gustan de más productos, por lo que ha decidido solicitar a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas, azúcar, pan dulce, entre otros productos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Ercilia is 23 years old and has owned a general store for the past 5 years. Her store is frequented by neighbors since it is one of the most well-stocked stores in the area. She is a single mother and lives with her 4-year-old son, whom she is moving forward with great effort.

Ercilia wishes to stock her business, since sales are better in the holiday season and customers like more products. She decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in staple grains, snacks, beverages, sugar, pastries, and other products for her store.

loans.use: to invest in staple grains, snacks, beverages, sugar, pastries, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina, who is in her mid 30's, is married with three schooling children. She has been dealing with poultry activities for two years. She works from 6 am to 17 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Christina requested her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use the loan to buy chicks, chicken feeds and to buy medicine.

She used the previous loans to reinvest on her business and was able to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay loans, reinvest in her business, and cover household expenses. She dreams of opening a butcher.

Christina will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks, chicken feed, and to buy medicine.

loans.name: Menerva

texts.en:
Menerva , a 40-year-old woman from the town of Ormoc City, Leyte is into making dresses and accepting repairs of clothes. She also sells fashionable clothes to the community of Ormoc.

She likes the business because this is something that she knows best, however, she needs additional capital so that she can maximize her profit and transact consistently with her clients. She is asking a loan to buy more clothes to sell for her neighbors.

With an additional capital, Menerva can then buy all the fashionable and trendy clothes to sell. All her sacrifices are for her three children aged 6, 13 and 15.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane runs her family farm. She is a mother of a son who currently serves in the army.

Gayane used to run their family farm with her husband, but because of the family's growing expenses, her husband works as a constructor in Yerevan town. The farm that Gayane runs includes a cow, calves, an ox, and hens. She also cultivates carrots, potatoes, and beets that are sold in the local markets.

The requested loan is very important for Gayane to purchase forage for feeding the cattle in the winter. This is important for Gayane to sustain her farm in the winter and have products to sell in the spring.

loans.use: to buy forage for feeding the cattle in the winter.

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en:
Khouloud is a 31-year-old make up artist from Chouf, Lebanon. She is married and living with her husband and two children who both attend school.

Since she was a teenager, Khouloud enjoyed creating new looks using make up on her family and friends. In 2011, she decided to turn her hobby into a business by opening a small beauty salon inside her house. She provides her clients with all types of beauty related services such as hairdressing, make up, manicures and pedicures.

Khouloud's clients see her as a very hard working and professional woman. She is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to buy a new set of equipment for hair dressing and make up.

The loan will allow Khouloud to work in better conditions by replacing her old equipment with a more efficient ones.

Her husband works as a security officer and earns a limited income. Therefore, Khouloud's business allows the family to increase the household's income

loans.use: To buy new equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a new sales agent for iSmart Kenya, an organization with a mission to create jobs for youth and women in slums. She has completed iSmart's sales and marketing training and is beginning to work as a door-to-door sales agent in Nairobi's slum communities.

iSmart's best-selling product is the clean cookstoves, which have an efficient design that saves customers money by reducing the amount of charcoal needed by half. These cookstoves also reduce the toxic smoke emissions and are better for the customer's health, as well as the environment.

Please help Jacinta earn a living and bring these beneficial products to others in her community.

loans.use: pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settements in Kenya.

loans.name: Rael's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rael, who, as the group leader, is representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. She is married and is the mother of four children, known by her community as a very experienced farmer.

Initially, Rael joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to save more money. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Rael plans to send her children to school.

Between the 15 farmers in Rael's Group, a total of 9 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Alvaro Josue

texts.es: Álvaro a sus 27 años de edad cuenta con una tienda de productos básicos, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace mucho tiempo, contando con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Él habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su madre de 64 años de edad a la que apoya con mucho esfuerzo, ya que siempre busca la manera que no le falte nada. Álvaro desea invertir en su negocio y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: granos básicos, pan dulce, bebidas, golosinas, entre otros productos que son solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en: Alvaro, at 27 years old, has a general store, an occupation in which he has worked for a long time, having a large number of customers who request his products. He lives in his own home with his mother, 64, whom he supports with much diligence, as he is always making sure she lacks for nothing. Alvaro wishes to invest in his business and for that reason he is applying for a FUSAI loan to invest in: invest in staple foods, pastries, drinks, candy, among other products that are requested by his customers.

loans.use: invest in staple foods, pastries, drinks, candy, among other products that are requested by his customers.

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es: Eva cuenta con un puesto en el mercado, en el cual distribuye productos como: ropa, piñatas, sandalias, zapatos, entre otros productos que son muy solicitados por sus clientes. Ella tiene 25 años de edad y vive junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Eva sabe que sus ventas se incrementan en época navideña, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: piñatas, ropa para dama y niño, sandalias, zapatos, entre otros productos que distribuirá en su negocio.
texts.en:
Eva has a market stall where she sells products like clothing, shoes, sandals, piñatas, and other products in high demand. She is 25 years old and lives with her boyfriend and their three-year-old little boy.

Eva knows that her sales increase during the holiday season, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in piñatas, women and children's clothing, shoes, sandals, and other products for her business.

loans.use: to invest in piñatas, women and children's clothing, sandals, shoes, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: As a married mother of six children, Angela works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Angela is borrowing PHP 5,000 through GDMPC  to repair her fishing boat for her fishing business. She earns income through her fishing business in order to sustain the daily needs of her family. Angela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from GDMPC. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 30-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children (all of whom attend school). Her husband is the main income provider in the family. They work together in order to fulfill their needs.

Mariam has been working as a private teacher since 2009. She adores her profession because she helps students get a needed education. She has organized a special room at her domicile where she receives students and has outfitted it with the necessary materials.

Today, Mariam is applying for a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase an encyclopedia to improve her teaching skills and therefore increase her income. She notes that this will facilitate her work preparation. She wishes to receive more students in the coming school season.

loans.use: to purchase an encyclopedia to improve her teaching skills.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Annet, who, as the group leader, is representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. She is married and is the mother of two children, known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Annet joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has learnt a lot from farming trainings. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Annet plans to invest in a business.

Between the 16 farmers in Annet's Group, a total of 8 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Philis' Group

texts.en:
Philis is 35 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for 17 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual.

Even though Philis is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.

Philis started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to the best seed prices. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Philis’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Bhagabati's Group

texts.en:
Bhagabati, standing on the extreme left hand side in the photograph, is a charismatic, well-behaved and hardworking lady from Koraput district, Odisha, India. She has a family of four and is a blessed mother of two daughters who are currently in school.

Bhagabati is one of the victims who is affected by rural India's sanitation crisis and has a very limited source of funds. For this reason, she was never able to build a suitable toilet for her family. Without access to a toilet, she faces a lot of problems as she has to travel a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible to depend on an open field for defecation as she feels the risk of being infected by life-threatening diseases.

Therefore, Bhagabati, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet and install a hand pump and a commode in it. Access to basic sanitation will consequently result in safety, improved health and medical savings.

She is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet and install a hand pump and a commode in it.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a woman living in Nairobi's slums in search of an opportunity to improve her life. She started working as a sales agent for iSmart Kenya, where she earns an income selling green energy products like clean cookstoves and solar lamps in her community. She is learning valuable job skills in sales, customer service, and professionalism that will help her throughout her lifetime. Please help Doris in her quest for financial independence by funding this Kiva loan.

loans.use: pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Kenya.

loans.name: Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Francoise is 41 years old and married with four children ranging from 7 to 19 years old. In the photo, she is the only one who has money in her hands. She owns a meat business where she works from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 pm. Francoise is a leader of this group, which is called ABISUNGANYE in the local language. The name means "we are together " in English.

Francoise has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase meat for sale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, pay school fees for her children, reinvest in her business and buy medical insurance for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat for selling.

loans.name: Malika's Group

texts.en:
Malika is a simple lady standing in a yellow saree in the middle of the photograph. She lives with her husband and her two daughters. Malika's husband is a farmer by profession. The income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses. They have hardly any savings.

Therefore, Malika was never able to build a toilet in her house. For this reason, she is suffering a lot. She has to go long distances to isolated places in order to relieve herself. She does not find this practice to be safe, so she understands the importance of having a toilet at home and she is concerned about the health of her family.

Therefore, she along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 INR. Malika will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet, attach a commode and incorporate water pipes to it.The loan amount will subsequently result in enhanced cleanliness, health and hygiene.

Malika is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to build a toilet, attach a commode and incorporate water pipes to it.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a resident of Sierra Bullones, a town in Bohol. This community is known as suppliers of most vegetables from the province. Rosalie, as a married woman with four young children, is also dependent on this livelihood of farming vegetables. On her land she cultivates string beans, which she sells in town upon harvest.

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, a sprayer and fertilizer. This will allow her to better take care of her crops. Her income will be utilized for a healthy diet, school fees for her children and household expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, a sprayer and fertilizer.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is smiling and showing off a clean-burning cookstove that she sells door-to-door in Nairobi's slums. These cookstoves practically sell themselves as they cut fuel consumption in half. Using less fuel means less money spent by her customers. For low-income families, the money they save with a clean-burning cookstove can be used on other critical needs such as food, school fees or healthcare costs. Support Racheal with a Kiva loan and help her bring these products to families in need throughout Nairobi.

loans.use: to pay for clean-burning cookstoves to sell in low-income settlements in Kenya.

loans.name: Soad

texts.en:
Soad has had a passion for cooking since she was a child. She got her cooking skills from her mother who taught her various hints and tips many years ago.
Soad is now 60 years old and has been making a living out of selling homemade food in her hometown of Chouf, Lebanon for more than 10 years. She lives with her brother and his family; his wife and their two children. She spends her day preparing all types of homemade food that she sells to her loyal clients upon request. She then saves part of her income to invest in cooking equipment that will improve the quality of her meals. She now needs a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. Soad will be using the loan to buy large quantities of food ingredients as well as a new mixer for her kitchen.
She is very well-known in her area and has a good reputation among her clients who appreciate her clean and tasty products at a very fair price.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients and a mixer for her business.

loans.name: Ratnamani's Group

texts.en:
The lady standing in the middle with a scarf on her head is Ratnamani. She hails from a small village in the Koraput district, Odisha, India. She often remains ill due to a certain disease she has. A mother of two daughters and wife of a farmer, Ratnamani does not have access to a toilet at her home. She has to travel a long distance to attend to nature's call despite her illness. Her health is no longer permitting her to trek such long distances at odd hours.

Therefore, she along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 INR. Ratnamani will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet and install a hand pump in her toilet. The loan amount will subsequently result in enhanced cleanliness, health and hygiene.

Ratnamani is eagerly awaiting for your generous hearts to help her.

loans.use: to build a toilet and install a hand pump in her toilet

loans.name: Nahima

texts.en:
Nahima, a Lebanese woman, lives near the port of Tripoli - North Lebanon with her husband, an private sector employee.

After being unemployed for several years, Nahima decided to open a small grocery store inside her house two years ago. She mainly sells all types of sweets, charcoal, and tobacco. Nahima and her husband rely a lot on the revenue they get from the shop as it allows them to cover the increasing cost of living in Tripoli.

She is asking for 1,234,327 Lebanese pound loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She will be using the loan to buy charcoal and other supplies for her grocery store. In fact, there is an increasing demand for charcoal at the moment, right before winter. Having enough stock will allow her to satisfy all her customers and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and other supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Itaf

texts.en:
Itaf, 62, is a hardworking Lebanese woman who works and lives in Chouf with her husband. Their only son is a Lebanese army officer who tried to help his parents as much as possible.
As her husband had to stop working for health reasons, Itaf decided to take things into her own hands and opened a grocery store twelve years ago in a very attractive location of the town they live in. In her store, she sells food and cleaning products as well as fresh fruits and vegetables. Itaf's main goal is to see her business work well and keep her clients satisfied when they shop there. That is why she is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pound loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She will use the amount to buy large quantities of supplies for her store which will enable her to meet the demand she is expecting. With the increased income, she will be able to provide for her husband and allow her son to start saving more for his own future.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Zhyparkul

texts.ru: Жыпаркул, 29 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей, они ходят в детский сад, образование у Жыпаркул высшее, занимается животноводством. Жыпаркул добилась хороших результатов, у нее есть 2 лошади, 15 овец и 3 коровы. Скот содержит зимой в сараях, летом отправляет на выпас в поля. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 17,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. На прибыль от кредита Жыпаркул планирует увеличить своё хозяйство и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Zhyparkul is 29 years old, married, and the mother of three children who go to kindergarten. Zhyparkul has a higher education. She rears animals. Zhyparkul has achieved good results. She has two horses, 15 sheep and three cows. She keeps her livestock in barns in the winter, and in summer she sends them out to graze in the fields. Her monthly income is about 17,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Zhyparkul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep. Zhyparkul plans to increase her farm and renovate her house with the profits from the loan.

loans.use: to buy some sheep in order to increase the size of her flock.

loans.name: Twubakane Acb Group

texts.en: Florance is a group leader, aged 41. She is married with five children aged between 2 and 17 years. The group is called TWUBAKANE which means “Let us build each other” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to make more profits for them to have a better future. She sells clothes and has been running this business for the past 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is an Organic and Fair Trade certified palm oil farmer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa.

She is 51 years old and married with five children. Her children are attending senior high school and tertiary education.

Abena believes organic palm oil is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, she wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan to purchase a knife for harvesting and pruning her palm oil plants for a higher yield.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Ancille is 68 years old and married with two children who are 18 and 23 years old. In the photo, she is the one wearing yellow shoes in the front. She owns a sorghum business and this is her third time requesting loan from the Vision Finance Company. She is a good client and repays her loans. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 pm. Ancille is a leader of this group, which is called TWITEZIMBERE.

Ancille has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sorghum to sell. With her profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business, and buy medical insurance for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 46-year-old married mother of two. Seven years ago, she started managing her husband's grocery shop so that he can focus on his scraps business. They are working hard to cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Dalal is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new collection of items and offers for the upcoming Christmas season.

Dalal hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of items and offers for the upcoming Christmas season

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will have increased profits. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy another  motorcycle.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia owns and operates a sari-sari store, which she sells merchandise like seasonings, cooking oil, coffee, powdered milk, soap, shampoo, eggs and fabric conditioner.
She is 60 year old woman, has three grown children and resides in the town of Mayorga, in Leyte province.

Basic commodities is in demand nowadays, and she need additional capital to fill those missing in her inventory.

Delia would like to improve her earnings by purchasing assorted supplies for the store like soft drinks, assorted canned goods and toiletries . These will attract more buyers and able to cope with demands.

For the future, Delia is hoping that she could be able to manage it properly in order to have a stable source of income in preparation of the old age.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, assorted canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Nerbie

texts.en:
Nerbie is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Nerbie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other supplies for her business.

Nerbie has been farming vegetables for 7 years and also earns additional income from raising chickens.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 30-year-old woman and has been running a school for three years. She has great enthusiasm to serve community children and is determined to be successful. She has a passion to provide quality education to her students.

Currently she has 52% female students of a total of 236 students enrolled. She has a desire to expand by enrolling more students. A loan of PKR 70,000 will allow her to buy furniture and assets to provide a comfortable learning environment.

Sobia wants to continue to operate this school for the long run and to expand by enrolling more students.

loans.use: to buy furniture and assets to provide a comfortable learning environment.

loans.name: Noureen

texts.en:
Noureen is 33 years old house wife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market 40 years,which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, oranges from his shop. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult.

Therefore his wife, Noureen has requested for a loan amount from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase more variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future.

Noureen is much thankful to the Kiva team and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Sub Group A

texts.en:
Esiza is a group leader; he is 41 years old. He is married with two children, who are 6 and 14 years old.

The group is called Tuzamurane, which means “Let's support each other” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for an opportunity to have a better future.

He sells shoes and has been running this business for the past eight years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes to sell.

With the profits from the business, he would like to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Indahemuka Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a 40-year-old married woman with five children.

She has operated a banana business for three years. She works every day from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m at the market.
