While the work is tough and the hours are long, Agnes is committed to her business so that her children may prosper. She is the president of Indahemuka group and she is the third person in front, on the left side.

Agnes has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of bananas to sell.

She will use the loan to earn more profits, reinvest for better financial stability, pay medical insurance, and buy new clothes for her children.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Norbi De Jesus

texts.en: Norbi is 51 years old and lives in Medellin. She has always loved to serve to people, and that’s the main reason why she opened a store two years ago where she sells many products. People like going to her store because of the good service, and this has allowed her to provide for her family. She wants to accomplish great things, including improve her business by increasing sales and clients and, with them, her profits. She’s asking for a loan to buy supplies for the holiday season when demand for products like food and drinks is highest. Norbi dreams of having her own house, and is sure her business will allow her to do this someday. You can contribute to her success by helping with this loan.

loans.use: buy supplies for the holidays, when demand for food and drinks is highest.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 32 years old and lives in the municipality of Medellín. She’s a happy married woman and loves her husband more than anybody, and he has become in a big motivation for her. In 2002 she started her own business, a selling place where she commercializes different kinds of products like food, accessories, clothes and others.

She wants to improve her business so that she can improve her sales and get more profits. She also wants to be more competitive in the market because there are a lot of other stores like hers, but she knows she can offer better service and products with high quality. She’s asking for a loan so that she can buy inputs, toys especially, for this Christmas season.

Catalina has big expectations for the future of her business; she wants to see it as a successful and recognized business. She also wants to improve the condition of her house. Help Catalina with the loan she needs.

loans.use: to buy inputs, toys especially, for this Christmas season.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Born in 1961, Yusra, a Lebanese woman, prepares knitted clothes and accessories and sells them in the Chouf region where she lives. She is married and her husband works in a printing company in the area. They have two kids who are both doing very well at school.

For the first time, Yusra is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. In fact, she needs to buy a certain quantity of wool that is required to finalize her production before winter. She will also be using part of the loan to cover her daughter's tuition fee before the end of the year.

She has been knitting for more than 20 years and she also prepares homemade food during her free time and sells it for extra income.

Yusra believes that by getting that loan she will be able to increase her sales and income, and thus it will be possible to help her daughter in paying her university fees. She is a hardworking woman, doing her best to ensure the best living conditions possible for her family and helping her husband in the housing expenses. Her main focus right now is helping her daughter complete her studies.

loans.use: To buy quantities of wool and pay part of her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en:
Mateo is just 19 years old and lives in the municipality of Medellín. At his young age, Mateo has taken on the commitment of providing for his family, which is going through a difficult time economically speaking. That’s the reason why, two years ago, he decided to start selling cleaning products.

He hopes his business can improve so that he can provide better for his family. He expects that the business can increase its clientele, sales and profits so that it becomes sustainable and successful. He’s asking for a loan so that he can buy more cleaning products to sell during this Christmas season.

Mateo dreams of buying a house for his family, where they can have an amazing life in comfort and safety. Help this young man to accomplish great things with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy more cleaning products to sell during this Christmas season.

loans.name: Tatiana Maria

texts.en: Tatiana is 23 years old and lives in Sahagun with her two children, a son who is 7 and a daughter who is 5. Her children motivate her to improve their quality of life and inspired her to start selling products, especially clothes. In her area, people have suffered from the consequences of violence, and she moved from her house years ago to start building a new and better life elsewhere. She expects that her business can be more competitive if she gets a loan to buy items to sell like blouses, shorts, and jeans.  Tatiana dreams of giving her children a good life and a better home, and is requesting this loan to make that dream possible.

loans.use: buy items to sell like blouses, shorts, and jeans.

loans.name: Lucia Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil casada su esposo es jornalero viven en el campo tienen 6 hijos Patricio de 16, Miguel de 11, Ana de 14, Jessica de 13, Mónica de 5 años de edad ellos estudian en unidades educativas gratuitas del sector, Mateo de 3 años permanece en un centro de cuidado infantil mientras sus papas  desde muy temprano saca leche a su vaca y se van a trabajar al campo. Margarita necesita el dinero para comprar una vaca lechera aspira tener otro ingreso para ayudar a su esposo con la alimentación, educación de sus hijos espera que se superen y continúen estudiando.
texts.en:
Margarita is 34 years old and she is married. Her husband is a day laborer and they live in the country. They have six children. Patricio is 16, Miguel is 11, Ana is 14, Jessica is 13 and Mónica is 5 years old and they all study in free local schools. Mateo is 3 years old and he stays at a child care center while his parents get up very early to milk the cow and go to work in the fields.

Margarita needs the money to buy a milk cow. She hopes to have another income to help her husband with the feeding and education of their children. She hopes that they better themselves and continue to study.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Yuliet Alejandra

texts.en:
Yuliet is 24 years old and lives in the municipality of La Dorada. She has a great talent--she is a great cook who has always dreamed with having her own food place, and this year it became a reality. She owns a place where she sells delicious food and with the income she is able to help her family.

Yuliet wants to improve her business because she wants it to become a popular attraction in her area. She hopes she can increase the sales so the economy gets better for her and her family. She requested a loan, which she will use to buy a new roaster and food inputs to prepare delicious new recipes. 

Yuliet wants to give to her family a present, something that they have wanted for many years, which is their own house. She hopes her business will let her buy that for them.

loans.use: to purchase a new roaster and food inputs

loans.name: Sandra Enix

texts.en:
Sandra is 34 years old and is a happy married woman. She lives in the municipality of Medellin with her beloved husband and her two sons of 15 and 11 years of age. She has a beautiful family to whom she hopes she can give a good quality of life. That’s the reason why she decided she wants to start her own business, a bar/store where people can buy products and also hang out.

She hopes her business will give her good profits so that she can keep investing in it to make it better and so that she can also provide for her family, the main reason for having the business. She’s asking for a loan so that she can start her bar/store business and buy inputs to begin with and some chairs and tables for the place.

Sandra dreams of paying for her children's education so they become professionals in the future. She also wants to improve the condition of her house. Help Sandra to start her business on the right foot and to give her family a good life; loan now.

loans.use: to start her bar/store business and buy inputs to begin with and some chairs and tables for the place.

loans.name: Tukai

texts.ru: Тукай, 62 года, не замужем, с Тукай живет ее сестра, ей 80 лет. У Тукай высшее образование, работает библиотекарем. Также с 1990 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Тукай на сегодняшний день имеется 9 коров, 40 овец, 4 лошади. На 2,80 Га земли она выращивает люцерну для реализации, в своем огороде овощи для потребления. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тукай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Тукай направит на развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Tukai is 62 years old and not married. Tukai's sister lives with her, and she is 80 years old. Tukai has a post-secondary education, and she works as a librarian. In addition, since 1990 she has worked in field and animal husbandry. Thanks to her very hard work, Tukai's farm now has 9 cows, 40 sheep, and 4 horses. She grows alfalfa for resale on 2.80 hectares of land, and she grows vegetables for her own use in her garden.

In order to further develop her business, Tukai has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock so that she can increase the size of her herd. Tukai will use the income from the loan to develop her business and repair her home.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Yuli

texts.en:
Yuli is an artisan from Indonesia who specializes in silver jewelry. She requested a loan, which she will use to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and hire additional artisans for her workshop. Yuli has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story: "My mother is a silversmith. After finishing her housework, she spends the rest of the day working with silver. It was she who taught me the art and it allowed me to pay my tuition. I married a man who is also a silversmith. We work together, complemented by our different backgrounds. "I really want to grow my workshop. I will be so happy and grateful for all of your support. Thank you!" Use the link below to view Yuli's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4984

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and hire additional artisans for her workshop

loans.name: Gulberto Ceberiano

texts.en:
Seberiano is 54 years old, married, and has three adult children. He lives in a small town called Mascarilla located in northern Ecuador. He brings more than 30 years dedicated to agriculture. 

Seberiano is looking to finance his cane sugar crop, as well as other crops of beans and pickles. During the week he works with his wife in their fields and on weekends he travels to the city to sell the beans in the market. 

Seberiano requested a loan, which he will use to purchase fertilizers and pay for irrigation. He hoped to use the profits to finish building his house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for irrigation

loans.name: Gloria Ivone

texts.en:
Gloria is 35 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello. Some years ago she took some classes in order to be able to create her own business. Now she’s the owner of a beauty salon where she delivers services such as hair styling and cutting and also sells hair treatments.

This business has made her a strong and confident woman who wants to take the world by storm. Now she wants to improve her salon by increasing her clientele and thus her sales as well. She’s asking for a loan so that she can buy a new chair for the salon and some treatments to keep selling them.

Gloria has many dreams, but her biggest one is to buy a house where her family can have a great life. Help Gloria to accomplish her dream and to improve her business with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy a new chair for the salon and some treatments to keep selling them

loans.name: Maurince

texts.en:
Maurince is a 36-year-old married woman with four daughters. For some years, she has been operating a pig breeding business. Last month, one of the pigs gave birth to 15 piglets. Maurince sold ten piglets to cover her sudden needs and will raise the other five. She cannot buy fodder as the price is quite expensive and she needs it in bulk.

Maurince is requesting a 1,750,000 IDR to buy four sacks of pig feed.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of pig feed

loans.name: Tuzamurane Kigwene Group

texts.en:
Etienne is 30 years old and married with two children. In the photo, he is the man standing beside the money and wearing a black blazer. He owns a goats and cows business. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., and he has been in this business for three years.

Etienne is a leader of this group, which is called Tuzamurane Kigwene Group. Etienne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more goats and cows for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, pay school fees for his children, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy more goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Moises

texts.en:
Moises is an artisan from Peru who specializes in leather and wood furniture. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of leather and wood.

Moises has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

At the age of 15, Moises moved to Lima to study leather and woodcraft with his uncle. "After six years of apprenticeship, I started a workshop with my brother who, sadly, passed away in 1980. I proudly honor his memory with my work. Now it's my turn to train others in the family –- my nephews and other relatives. Some of my sisters work with me as well. My art is a medium to express my country's culture and transmit the essence of Peru."

"On behalf of myself, my family and all the artisans who work with me at my workshop, I would like to say thanks to everyone who is helping to fund this microcredit. It is a wonderful feeling when one feels supported and appreciated, and it pushes us to continue working and striving to improve as a business and as human beings."

Use the link below to view Moises's leather and wood furniture on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/5041

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of leather and wood.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 30 years old and is from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He is the only breadwinner in the family. Giorgi works as an artisan and generates approximately 500 GEL from private orders. This makes it difficult to provide for his family’s needs and he greatly desires to create another source of income. Giorgi has decided to open a business selling fruits and vegetables. 

Giorgi is requesting a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell. His request has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. His loan will greatly assist Giorgi and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a business selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro es casado y tiene 3 hijas una de 20, 17 y 13 años, las dos últimas están estudiando la secundaria. El señor Pedro desde niño ayudaba a su padre  a sembrar granos básicos en compañía de sus hermanos. En la comunidad donde vive no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar el cual será instalado en la casa de habitación, este sistema solar será de gran beneficio para toda la familia ya que les servirá a las hijas que están estudiando, a su señora  para realizar los oficios del hogar y al señor Pedro para alumbrarse por las madrugadas para ayudar en los cultivos, es por eso que el señor Pedro estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Pedro is married and has three daughters who are 13, 17 and 20 years of age. The last two are in high school. Since he was a boy, Pedro and his brothers helped his father grow basic grains.

There is no electricity in the community where he lives, so Pedro is asking for a loan in order to purchase a solar energy system which will be installed in his home. This solar installation will greatly benefit his entire family since it will help his daughters with their studies, his wife with the household chores, and it will help Pedro to have light in the early mornings to work in the crops.

For this reason, Pedro would be very grateful if he is given the opportunity to purchase a solar energy system with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a 100-watt solar energy system with four lights.

loans.name: Roman Edilberto

texts.es:
Román, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos; él se dedica a la crianza de ganado y la esposa se dedica a la agricultura, él tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, aparte de ello Román trabaja en una hacienda.
El manifiesta que solicita el crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de un novillo y poderlo engordar además de poder incrementar su inventario que le permitirá poder mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Román es poder generar más ingresos, pagar a tiempo su crédito y ayudar más para mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Román lives with his wife and their three children. His occupation is raising livestock and his wife is a farmer. He has been doing this for five years and he also works on a farm.

Román is applying for a loan so he can invest in the purchase of a cow for fattening. This will add to his herd and help increase his income. Roman's dream is to generate more income, repay his loan on time and help improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and add to his herd.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer de 37 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, además vende pupusas, ya que tiene un chalet en la escuela de la zona. Ella habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus 4 hijos de 12, 16, 18 y 14 años de edad a los que está sacando adelante con mucho esfuerzo como madre soltera. Julia desea invertir en su negocio, para ello solicita a FUSAI un crédito con el cual invertirá en: ropa de temporada, materia prima para su venta de pupusas, boquitas y bebidas para su chalet.
texts.en: Julia is a 37 year old woman who is engaged in the sale of grocery products. She also sells pupusas, since she has her chalet at the school in the area. She lives in her own home with her 4 children, who are 12, 14, 16 and 18 years of age. She is raising them up with great effort as a single mother. Julia wants to invest in her business, so she is asking FUSAI for a loan, which she will use to invest in: seasonal clothing, basic ingredients for selling pupusas, snacks and drinks for her chalet.

loans.use: to invest in: seasonal clothing, basic ingredients for selling pupusas, snacks and drinks for her chalet.

loans.name: Joaquin Antonio

texts.es: Joaquín tiene 60 años de edad y habita en casa propia al lado de sus padres, desde hace 50 años. Él se dedica a la venta de medicina y ropa, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder brindar lo mejor a sus padres a los que apoya y cuida mucho. Joaquín desea mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: alambre eléctrico, caja térmica, toma corriente, entre otros materiales necesarios para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Joaquín is 60-years old and has lived in his own home next to his parents for 50 years. He works selling medicine and clothing on the street. He feels very happy to be able to give his parents the best, who he supports and takes care of. Joaquín wants to improve his quality of life at home and so he is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy electrical wire, cooling box, outlets and other materials needed to install electricity in his home.

loans.use: to buy electrical wire, cooling box, outlets and other materials needed to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Tunas Harapan Group

texts.en: The Tunas Harapan Group is made up of five women who are mostly in sales. Rut, who is standing in the middle of the photo, leads the group. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children. Several years ago, she got divorced and became her children's sole means of support. Since then, she has opened a kiosk where she sells items and also raises livestock. These business have allowed her to pay for her household expenses and her children's education. Rut will use her portion of this loan for 12,500,000 IDR to buy items to sell from her kiosk, and feed her two piglets to get them ready for market. Like Rut, the other women in this group want to use their portions of this loan to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy rice and wheat flour in bulk and to fatten up her livestock.

loans.name: Crespo

texts.es:
Crespo es un hombre de 38 años de edad, casado, tienen 3 hijos de 4, 15 y 18 años y su negocio es la cerrajería. 
Él es independiente, fuerte y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘chasquipampa’ área donde la anterior década servía de pastizales para el ganado, hoy convertida en zona residencial de comercio continuo.
Crespo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja como empleada doméstica y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica no tiene alcantarillado ni agua potable porque los servicios no llegaron al sector. Su negocio es la cerrajería, el fabrica, rejas para jardín, puertas, portones, techos y cualquier armazón metálico, “trabajé como constructor y no había mucho trabajo, cambie de rubro como ayudante de cerrajero para luego independizarme y emprender mi propio negocio…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque la zona no cuenta con este tipo de servicio. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con trabajo constante, la desventaja es la fuerte chispa que produce el arco soldador que daña la vista. Su sueño es construir su casa para abrir su negocio ahí, el desea comprar una máquina dobladora de planchas metálicas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Crespo solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina dobladora de planchas metálicas para fabricar portones.
texts.en:
Crespo is a 38 year old man. He is married and has three children aged, 4, 15 and 18 years old. His business is metal work. .

He is independent, strong and very hard-working. He does his business in the ‘Chasquipampa’ neighborhood, an area that in the past decade served as pastureland for cattle. Today it has become a residential zone with constant commerce.

Crespo is dark-skinned, with short black hair and thin. His native tongue is Aymara which he speaks with his family and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for his business. He shares his life with his wife who works as a domestic employee and with his children who study at school. They live in a rented room made of brick with a metal roof that has electricity. It has no sewage or running water as those services haven't reached the area.

His business is metal work. He makes grates for gardens, doors, gates, roofs and any framework made of metal. "I worked as a builder but didn't have much work. I changed fields as a metal worker's helper and later went out on my own and stared my own business", he commented. His business is successful as this area doesn't have this type of service. The advantage of his business is he has constant work. The disadvantage is the strong sparks produced when arc welding which damage the vision.

His dream is to construct his house to open his business there. He wants to buy a metal bending machine to fabricate doors. This is his first loan with the institute in the 12 years he has carried out this business.

It is for these that Crespo is requesting a loan to buy a metal bending machine to fabricate doors.

loans.use: to buy a metal bending machine to fabricate doors.

loans.name: Saraswati's Group

texts.en:
Saraswati, a humble, enterprising, and a sensible lady, is the one who is standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a village in Koraput district, Odisha, India.This humble lady has a family of four.

Saraswati is a beautician by profession and has a pretty good number of customers. Her husband, being an elderly person, often remains ill and is not able to work anymore. So, Saraswati is the sole earner in her family. She has two daughters.

After meeting the daily household expenses and the medical expenses of her husband, Saraswati is hardly able to save any money. Therefore, she could not build a toilet at her home, so she has to depend on the open field for defecation.

Along with her other group members, Saraswati is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 Indian rupees (INR). Saraswati will use her portion of the loan amount to build a safe, clean, and hygienic toilet with all the necessary sanitary fittings attached to it. Having a toilet in her house will increase her convenience.

Saraswati is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to build a safe, clean, and hygienic toilet with all necessary sanitary fittings attached to it.

loans.name: Mario Obdulio

texts.es: La vivienda en la que vive Mario con su compañera de vida y su hija de 7 años de edad, a las que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una finca, pero además cuenta con una venta de platos típicos, la cual su compañera de vida le ayuda a atender. Mario desea cambiar las puertas de su vivienda, ya que estas se encuentran deterioradas, además el techo de su vivienda presenta filtraciones, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar puertas, láminas, polines y pines para cambiar las puertas y el techo de su vivienda y brindar seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mario lives with his life partner and seven-year-old daughter and always spends a lot of effort to look for ways to get ahead. He works on a farm but also sells typical meals, and his life partner helps him tend to their customers.

Mario wants to replace the doors of their house because they are in poor condition. And the roof is leaky. So he is asking FUSAI for a loan so he can buy doors, metal sheets for the roof, poles and pins so he can replace the doors and the roof of his house and provide security for his family.

loans.use: to buy doors, sheet metal, poles, and pins so he can replace the doors and the roof of his house.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros De Ate Group

texts.es: La Sra. Silma de 50 años de edad soltera y con 3 hijos. Pertenece al grupo comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE ATE”. Un grupo conformado por 5 integrantes los cuales todos tienen un  gran empeño por salir adelante hacia una economía más estable para ellos y sus familias. Tal es así el caso de la Sra. Silma que se dedica al acabado de impresiones (diplomas, almanaques, etc.) en su pequeña imprenta ya hace 2 años en su propio domicilio. En el futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio en comprar más impresoras y así poder tener  más ingresos económicos. Con el préstamo otorgado por kiva lo invertirá para la compra de materiales de impresión (tintas, papel, etc.). La Sra. Silma es la primera del lado izquierdo se le distingue por su polo azul y una casaca de color negro. Ella se despide con un enorme agradecimiento a kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirán con todas sus metas  propuestas.
texts.en:
Silma is 50-years old, single and has 3 children. She belongs to the loan group "Señor de Los Milagros de Ate". It is a group composed of 5 members who have a great determination to get ahead through a more stable economy for them and their families. This is the case for Silma who has worked in print finishing (diplomas, almanacs, etc.) in her small printing office in her own home for two years.

In the future she would like to grow her business by buying more printers and this way she can have a better income. With the given loan through Kiva, she will buy printing materials (inks, paper, etc.).

Silma is the first to the left and can be seen with her blue polo and a black dress coat. She signs off with a huge thank you to Kiva and says that they will comply with all of their proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy printing materials (inks, paper, etc.).

loans.name: Tunas Baru Group

texts.en:
Afliana is a 47-year-old woman (standing on the right side) and is married to Nikanor, a 45-year-old man.They have five children; two are currently working and three are at school.

Their household income leans on Afliana's small kiosk, which sells daily needs such as shampoo, matches, salt, cooking oil, sugar, etc. and some vegetables, while her husband, Nikanor, is an ojek (motorbike taxi driver). As an ojek, Nikanor has low and unstable income and often finds difficulty in fulfilling their family needs.

Seeing the economic situation that they are facing has forced Afliana to improve her business income. Afliana then formed Tunas Baru Group and requested IDR 8,000,000 for their business expansion. Afliana would utilize her loan portion to purchase more merchandise to sell, such as rice, instant noodles, cooking oil, wheat, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell, such as rice, instant noodles, cooking oil, wheat, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Tabata Shule Group

texts.en:
Josephine, who is in her early 60s, is a widow with two adult daughters. For ten years now, she has been selling cold drinks at wholesale prices. Josephine works from ten in the morning through four in the afternoon and is able to make a very good monthly profit. She successfully repaid a previous loan that she used to increase her stock of drinks. Josephine used the profit from her first loan to take care of her family, repay her loan, and cover household expenses.

Josephine is requesting a loan to buy and sell drinks at retail and wholesale prices. This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Josephine is part of a loan group called Tabata Shule, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for repaying their loan. Josephine appreciates Kiva’s support for their group. In the future, she dreams of owning a poultry business.

loans.use: to buy cold drinks at retail and wholesale prices

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 30-year-old woman who is married to Papi, a 30-year-old box truck driver. They have been blessed with three children from their marriage, namely Patricia, seven, in second grade of elementary school; Kelya, three years old; and Alferdo, one year old.

To assist her husband in earning additional income, Victoria took the initiative to produce fried corn and entrusted it to every small shop/kiosk around her village. Victoria has been running this business for two years, and it has enabled her to be a more independent woman because from her small-scale business, Victoria can earn her own income.

As Christmas is coming soon, Victoria really wants to increase the amount of fried corn she sells per usual, as the demand for her product usually increases in December. Victoria is happy and grateful because when she dreamed of expanding her business, she heard about the SeSaMa loan product offered by TLM at the same time.

Victoria took this opportunity and requested IDR 2,000,000 from TLM through Kiva. With the loan support, Victoria would spend the loan for corn in bulk, cooking oil and other ingredients, and kerosene.

loans.use: to buy more corn in bulk, cooking oil and other ingredients, and kerosene.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa es una joven de 22 años de edad soltera estudiante de la carrera profesional de administración de negocios en una universidad estatal. Actualmente se encuentra cursando su décimo ciclo. Rosa se siente feliz ya que gracias a sus estudios podrá ayudar a su madre. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para el pago de sus estudios y materiales de estudio. El deseo de rosa es de tener su propio negocio. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar a estudiantes como ella.
texts.en: Rosa is a young 22-year old. She is single and a Business Administration student in a state university. Currently she is studying in her 10th cycle. She is happy because thanks to her studies she will be able to help her mother. For that reason, she is asking for a loan to pay for her studies and study materials. Rosa's wish is to have her own business. She thanks the Kiva investors for supporting students like her.

loans.use: to pay for her studies and study materials.

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
César tiene una linda familia que está compuesta por su compañera de vida y sus hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, la familia cuenta con 10 años de residir en su localidad, cuando sus hijos se encuentran de vacaciones le apoyan en su negocio el cual consiste actualmente en vender jabón y detergentes, su puesto de venta está ubicado frente al mercado municipal desde hace cinco años.
Con el crédito piensa comprar detergentes y jabón, también pretende aprovechar la temporada por lo que invertirá en adornos navideños, al tener nueva mercadería surtirá su negocio, será de ayuda ya que podrá atraer a nuevos clientes, incrementar ventas e ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
La visión de César es resarcir su deuda en el tiempo estipulado, así como también abastecer a su familia con alimentación, vestuario y educación.
texts.en:
César has a lovely family composed of his wife and children, who are in school. The family has been living in this area for 10 years. When his children are on school vacation, they support him in his business, which currently consists of selling soap and detergents. His stall has been located in front of a town market for five years.

With the loan he thinks of buying detergents and soap, as well as intending to take advantage of the season to invest in Christmas decorations. With the new merchandise he will supply his business. It will be a big help because he will be able to attract new customers, increase sales and income to comply with his obligations. César's vision is to repay his debt in the allocated time, as well as supplying his family with food, clothing and education.

loans.use: to buy detergents and soap, as well as intending to take advantage of the season to invest in Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Jonatan Isaac

texts.es: Jonatán tiene 25 años de edad y vive con sus padres y hermanos en casa familiar desde hace muchos años. Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios de jardinería en diferentes lugares, lo que le permite salir adelante y apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar. Jonatán desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, polines, pines y pagar mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, que como se observa en la fotografía se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en: Jonatán is 25-years old and has lived with his parents and siblings in a family home for many years. He works loaning his gardening services in different places. This allows him to get ahead and support his family with the household expenses. Jonatán wants to change the roof on his home because it is falling apart. So, he is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheets, poles, pins and to pay labor to change the roof of his home, because as you can see in the photograph it is deteriorating.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, poles, pins and to pay labor to change the roof of his home.

loans.name: Elsy

texts.en:
Elsy (39) is a married woman with four children. Her husband, Jibrael (50) works as an ojek (motorbike taxi driver). As their kids are growing bigger and go to school, Elsy and Jibrael cannot lean on only one income as it won’t fully meet all of their needs.

Therefore, when Elsy had adequate business capital, she started a broiler business in 2014. This business can help Elsy to fund the kids’ schooling needs and also other needs that could not be covered before.

Lately, Elsy has had many requests from her customers already, looking ahead to the feast of Christmas, but unfortunately she lacks capital. Therefore, when she heard from a neighbor about the Sesama product of TLM, she was really interested and directly joined with the existing group.

Then she requested a loan amounting to IDR 2,000,000 from TLM. This loan would help Elsy to buy boxes of chicks and their fodder. Elsy hopes that the loan will help her to develop her business bigger than before so that she can earn much money for this Christmas.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicks and their fodder.

loans.name: Truth

texts.en: Truth, 26, lives with her parents in Chiredzi District. She operates a takeaway stand and uses her earnings to pay school fees for her younger sister and brothers. Truth is requesting a Kiva loan to construct her own restaurant to expand her business. Truth plans to use the profits she earns to build a house for her family. Truth volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, and teaches effective communication skills to students at the nearby high school. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct her own restaurant and expand her business.

loans.name: Tilla

texts.ru: Тилла, 63 года, вдова, живет с сыном и его семьей. У Тиллы среднее образование, уже 18 лет она занимается торговлей. Сейчас арендует торговое место, где продает муку, чай, масло и прочие продукты питания. В обороте есть товар на 300,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тилла обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку муки для реализации. Доходы от кредита Тилла планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Tilla is 63 years old, a widow, and lives with her son and his family. Tilla has a secondary-level education and has worked in trade for 18 years. Right now, she rents a stall where she sells flour, tea, butter, and other such food products. She has 300,000 som (KGS) worth of goods in stock. Her monthly income averages 16,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Tilla has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy flour for resale. Tilla plans to use the income from her loan to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy flour for retail sale in her shop.

loans.name: Dean

texts.en:
Dean is 17 years old and lives with her husband and their child in Chriedzi District. She runs a stand at the flea market and uses her earnings to buy food for her child and support her family.

Dean is requesting a Kiva loan to start a large clothing shop. She plans to use the profit she earns to build a house for her family. Dean volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, and helps students improve their confidence and discover their strengths. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to start a large clothing shop.

loans.name: Kinrose

texts.en:
Kinrose, 27, lives in Chiredzi District with her husband and two children. She runs a stand at the local flea market. Through her business, Kinrose is able to pay her children’s school fees and to help support her extended family.

Kinrose is requesting a Kiva loan to start her own boutique, and plans to use the profit she earns to expand the boutique. Kinrose volunteers at the nearby high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, and encourages her students to find their strengths and improve their confidence. Kinrose will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work with her students.

loans.use: to startt her own boutique.

loans.name: Svodai

texts.en:
Svodai is a 28-year-old widowed mother of two children living in Chiredzi District. Svodai operates a take away stand at the local flea market to pay school fees for her children. Svodai is requesting a Kiva loan to start her own large restaurant.

She plans to use the profit to build a house for her family. Svodai volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students at the local high school about active citizenship. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to start her own large restaurant.

loans.name: Sharai

texts.en:
Sharai is 20 years old and lives with her parents in Chiredzi District. Sharai is requesting a Kiva loan to launch her own business selling clothes from a stall in the local market, and will use the loan to purchase stock.

Sharai plans to reinvest the profit she earns into her business to help it grow. Sharai volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, and focuses on building her students’ confidence and teaching effective communication. Sharai will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: to launch her own business selling clothes from a stall in the local market.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 24 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Chiredzi District. She runs a stand at the local flea market selling shoes, clothing, and other items. Through her business, Joyce is able to support her family and pay school fees for her children.

Joyce is requesting a Kiva loan to construct a large clothing boutique. She plans to use the profit to further expand her boutique. Joyce volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, and leads life skills sessions for students at the local high school. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: to start a large boutique

loans.name: Duga Group

texts.fr:
Fabiola fait partie du groupe Duga  et  habite à Muramvya. Elle  a 43 ans et est mariée à Etienne, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants   dont 3 étudient.


Elle fait le commerce de  la bière de banane  depuis 25 ans. 


Elle est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes  à transformer en bière pour servir plus de clients,  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Fabiola is part of the Duga group and lives in Muramvya. She is 43 years old and married to Etienne, a trader. Together they have 4 children of whom 4 study at school.
She has been selling banana beer for 25 years. She is on her seventh Turame loan cycle. With the Kiva loan that she will receive, she will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas to convert into beer to serve more clients, to earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas to convert into beer to serve more clients, and earn more.

loans.name: Bebi's Group

texts.en:
Bebi is the lady standing on the right hand side in the photograph. She is a teacher by profession and hails from a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. Bebi is a divorcee and has a daughter in her care. She is the only breadwinner in the family, and with the limited income she finds it hard to build a toilet in her house, which she does not possess right now.

Therefore, Bebi is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 India rupees (INR) from Kiva partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean, hygienic toilet and to install a hand water pump to facilitate the supply of water and increase her privacy and convenience.

Bebi is in dire need of your kind help and is eagerly awaiting it.

loans.use: to build a clean, hygienic toilet and install a hand water pump to facilitate the supply of water.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Chiredzi District. She supports her family and pays her children’s school fees by selling fruit and potatoes from her small stand.

Joyce plans to expand her grocery business and seeks a Kiva loan to construct her own large supermarket. She plans to use the profit she earns to build a house for her family.

Joyce volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, and teaches students at the local high school about active citizenship. Joyce will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: to construct her own large supermarket

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 19 years old and lives with her parents in Chiredzi District. She runs a stand at the local flea market and uses her earnings to cover school fees for her sisters and to contribute to her family. Maria is requesting a Kiva loan to construct a large boutique. She plans to use the profit she earns to build a house. Maria volunteers at the nearby high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading discussion groups on how students can create a better world. Maria will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct a large boutique.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru: Майрам 47 лет. Она из Джоми. Майрам более 10 лет шьет и кроит национальные платья по заказу. В день она может сшить даже по 3 национальной одежды. Майрам ответственная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она никогда не боялась трудиться. Это видно по результатам ее работ. Майрам нравится создавать новые образы для женщин и вдохновляет ее благодарные лица клиенток. Она хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Майрам просит кредит для купли стройматериалы. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей улучшить жилищные условия семью.
texts.en:
Mayram is 47 and from Jomi. She has been cutting and sewing traditional dresses to order for more than 10 years. In a day she can sew up to three items. She is a responsible and hardworking woman who has never been afraid to put in effort, as is evident from the results of her work. She likes to create new styles for women and is inspired by her customers' grateful faces.

Mayram wants to renovate her house. She is requesting a loan to buy building materials. The loan amount will help her improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Nogoye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois et il regroupe des femmes issues du même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations de voisinage.
Madame Nogoye est la responsable ,elle est mariée et mère  de six enfants dont une fille. Ses enfants sont tous scolarisés. Elle est âgée de 50 ans et s 'active dans le commerce de poissons frais et de légumes depuis bientôt vingt ans .Avec son nouveau crédit de 400 000 francs CFA elle va se payer des paniers de poissons frais  et des légumes pour les commercialiser au niveau de son quartier.Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent d'aider son époux dans la prise en charge alimentaire et scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created since the first cycle of the banc villageois and brings together women coming from the same neighbourhood and linked by good neighbourly relations.

Mrs Nogoye is the leader, she is married and the mother of six children including one girl. Her children all attend school. She is 50 years old has worked in the trade of fresh fish and vegetables for almost twenty years. With her new 400,000 FCFA loan she will purchase baskets of fresh fish and vegetables to sell them in her neighbourhood.

The profits from her activity will allow her to help her husband in taking care of the food and school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fish and vegetables for petty trading.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Chiredzi District. She operates a poultry business and uses her earnings to pay her children’s school fees. When she received financial assistance from Kiva, she managed to improve her business considerably. However, Sylvia is now seeking another Kiva loan to further expand her fowl run and purchase more chicks. She plans to use the profit to build a house for her family. Sylvia volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students at the local high school about effective communication. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to further expand her fowl run and purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Groupe Codk

texts.fr: Le commerce de vente des pagnes que Stella a appris grâce à son entourage, il y a maintenant 15 ans, participe à la survie de sa famille. Malgré l'insuffisance actuelle du capital alloué à cette activité, elle compte dans l'avenir agrandir son travail. Sur la photo, Stella porte une robe rose et a son bébé dans ses bras.
texts.en: The business of selling pagne (African cloth) which Stella learnt from her entourage, fifteen years ago, contributes to the survival of her family. In spite of the current insufficiency of capital allocated to this activity, she hopes in the future to expand her work. On the picture, Stella wears a pink dress and has her baby in her arms.

loans.use: build her stock to resell pagne (African cloth).

loans.name: Trinidad Encarnacion

texts.es:
Trinidad es una joven mujer  de 22 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años, y su negocio es la tienda de barrio.
Ella es constante, amable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘chasquipampa’ caracterizada por encontrarse ruinas de asentamientos de los antiguos chasquis que eran mensajeros incas, de clima templado y seco con una temperatura máxima de 17 grados centígrados. 
Trinidad es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la venta de comida al lado de la tienda, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como, pan, leche, azúcar, sal, detergentes, jabón, desodorante y otros, “antes vendía juguetes ambulantemente, con mi pareja decidimos abrir una tienda y luego vender comida, ambos nos ayudamos en las 2 actividades…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque no cuenta con competencia directa en el lugar. La ventaja de su negocio es que su esposo la colabora, la desventaja es la falta de mercadería para abastecer el negocio. Su sueño es abrir una tienda como sucursal, ella desea comprar mercadería para surtir la tienda de barrio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Trinidad solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería para surtir la tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
Trinidad is a young 22 year-old married woman with one son who is two years old. Her business is a neighborhood shop.

She is consistent, friendly and hardworking. She runs her business in the Chasquipampa area, which is known for ruins found there of settlements of the ancient Chasquis, who were Incan messengers. It has a mild, dry climate with a maximum temperature of 17 degrees Celsius.

Trinity has a dark complexion and long black hair and is short in stature. Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of mainstream culture and to run her business. She shares her life with her husband who sells food next to the shop.

They live in a rented room constructed of brick and a corrugated iron roof and have potable water, electricity and sewage. Her business is the sale of food items such as bread, milk, sugar, and salt, as well as detergent, soap, deodorant, and other products.

She says "I used to sell toys as a travelling salesperson, then my partner and I decided to open a shop and sell food. We help one another with both businesses." Her business is successful because it has no direct competition in the area. The advantage of her business is that her husband works with her, and the disadvantage is the lack of goods to supply it.

Her dream is to open a branch of a neighborhood store. She wants to buy merchandise to stock the her neighborhood shop. This is the first loan she is applying for with the institution in the year that she has been running both businesses.

It is for these reasons that Trinidad is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise to stock her neighborhood shop.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her neighborhood shop.

loans.name: Mary Lyn

texts.en:
Mary Lyn is standing next to her five-gallon containers for her water business. She sells this purified water for drinking to her neighbors in Garcia Hernandez. In addition to this, Mary Lyn also raise hogs for a living. Mary Lyn has been in this business for three years, earning PHP 2,500 per month.

Mary Lyn is asking for a loan to buy more empty five-gallon containers, piglets, and sacks of feed for her pigs. Her income will be used for the welfare of her three children, aged six, eight, and nine. She will use the profit to pay for their school fees and buy food for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy more empty five-gallon containers, piglets, and sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Santos Ceferino

texts.es: El piso de la vivienda de Santos es de tierra, por lo que él desea encementarlo, ya que en su vivienda habita con su esposa y sus dos hijos una niña de 16 años y un varón de 12 años de edad, a los que está sacando adelante. Santos es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios en una gasolinera, actividad que realiza desde hace muchos años. Para encementar el piso de su vivienda, Santos solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y pagar mano de obra para encementar el piso de su vivienda, y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The floor in Santos's home is earthen, and he wants to pour a cement floor. He lives in his home with his wife and their two children, a 16-year old daughter and a 12-year old son. Santos wants to get them ahead.
Santos is a hard-working man who earns his living working at a gas station, which he has done for many years.
Santos is requesting a loan from FUSAI to pour a cement floor in his home. He will use the loan to purchase cement, sand and gravel and to pay for labor for pouring the cement floor. In this way, he will improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel and to pay for labor to pour a cement floor in his home.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 38 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has five dependent children to take care of and three of whom are in school. Cassava growing is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for twenty years. To earn extra income, her husband also works for others for a fee. 
This is the third micro loan for Sokha with VisionFund. She is now applying for a new loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for supporting her cassava. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for supporting her cassava

loans.name: Urmila's Group

texts.en:
The lady with a smile on her face standing on the right hand side of the photograph is Urmila. She is a resident of a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. Urmila is one of the victims who is affected by India's rural sanitation crisis.

The absence of toilet is a big headache for Urmila. She has to travel a long distance in order to attend nature's call at odd hours, including late at night and early in the morning. She does not find this practice safe and feasible anymore. Therefore, she and her group members are requesting a loan amount of 40,000 India rupees (INR) from Kiva partner People's Forum. Urmila will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet, install a hand pump, and incorporate water pipes to it. The loan amount will subsequently result her in enhancing cleanliness, health, and hygiene.

Urmila is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to build a toilet, install a hand pump, and incorporate water pipes to it.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is maize farmer from Marmara village. As a member of Babban Gona, Yakubu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Yakubu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 41 years, primary school proprietor in Mombasa Kenya. He is a father of four and has been in this business for the last four years, doing well.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya, used to renovate his classrooms and anticipated profits to build more classrooms.

He hopes to own a full school from class one to eight in future.

loans.use: to renovate his school classrooms .

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a widow with 4 children. She describes herself to be dedicated. She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be climate changes. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs to boost farming. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Elsi Antonia

texts.es:
Elsi se siente muy satisfecha por estar disfrutando de los beneficios que la inversión del crédito anterior le están dando, pues mantiene la continuidad de su negocio el cual es vender pupusas, con sus ingreso a iniciado un nuevo rubro que es administrar una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, gracias a su progreso pueda darle una vida más confortable a su familia, la cual mantiene su mismo núcleo.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo financiamiento para comprar quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, bebida, harina, boquitas, dulces, arroz, etc., tendrá un inventario más surtido para elaborar la venta de pupusas y fortalecer mucho más su tienda, considera que con los créditos ella está teniendo un mejor desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Elsi feels very satisfied because she is enjoying the benefits of her previous loan. She is able to keep her business going, which is selling 'pupusas': thick, hand-made tortillas usually filled with cheese, pork rinds, or chicken. With her earnings, she has started a new line of work, which has been administering a convenience store. Because of her progress, she has been able to provide a more comfortable life for her family, whose members are the same as before.

She seeks a new loan to buy cheese, fried pork rinds, oil, drinks, flour, snacks, sweets, rice, etc. She will be able to have a more varied inventory so she can sell pupusas and boost her store even more. Elsi thinks that with the loans she is able to establish herself better economically.

loans.use: to buy cheese, fried pork rinds, oil, drinks, flour, snacks, sweets, rice, etc to have a more varied selection.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 38 years old and lives in Chiredzi District with her husband and their child. She operates a poultry business and uses her earnings to support her family and pay her child’s school fees.

When she received her first Kiva loan she used it to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. However, Theresa is now requesting a second Kiva loan to expand her fowl run and purchase more chicks. She plans to use the profit she earns to build a house for her family. Theresa volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches students at the local high school about active citizenship. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through Theresa’s weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to expand her fowl run and purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Srun is aged 30 years and single. To make a living, he has been farming rice for 10 years and sometimes working as a paid construction worker in local area in order to earn additional income. Srun can manage to earn about 37,000KHR per day. 
Srun is the first cycled client with VisionFund. He is applying for a loan to buy a decent motorbike for commuting to work. He hopes this loan will enable him to save time and reduce some expenses on motor-taxi when he goes to work.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for commuting to work

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Javier Amado

texts.es: Don Javier de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica una variedad de muebles, tiene 15 años de dedicarse al negocio y muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus muebles, el está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Javier, 50 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He own a carpentry workshop in which he makes a variety of furniture items. He has been in this business for 15 years and is preferred by many people because he offers quality and good prices for his furniture.

He is seeking a loan through INTEGRAL in order to invest in his business. He wants to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, reed, and other articles that will help him to attract more clients. He then wishes to reach his goals of improving the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, reed, and other articles.

loans.name: Javier Amilcar

texts.es: Javier de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica desde hace 20 años a la crianza de ganado y comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, adiconal a eso tambien trabaja como conductor de transporte, el esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de otra  vaca para continuar con su trabajo ya que la va muy bien y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Javier is 44 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has been raising animals and selling his products around the zone where he lives for the last 20 years.

In addition to this he also works as a transportation driver. 

He is requesting another loan to buy another cow and continue his work, since it is already working well for him and this way he can earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Oscar Fernando

texts.es: Oscar de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al trasporte de carga desde hace varios años y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el quiere mejorar su vivienda termniando de construir un cuarto pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razon esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios para poder ampliar su casa y vivir mas comodos.
texts.en: Oscar is 48-years old.  He lives in his own home with his family.  Oscar has made his living in freight transport for many years.  With his earnings, he is able to get ahead.  Oscar wants to make improvements to his home by finishing construction on a room.  However, with that he earns from his work, he doesn't have enough to get it done.  That is why he is requesting a loan.  Oscar will use the loan to purchase the necessary construction materials to expand his home and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase needed construction materials.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome, a 48-year-old mother, lives in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. Motivated to provide for her children, she now owns a thriving business selling dried fish. It is a favorite breakfast food for Filipinos. It is usually fried and dipped in vinegar paired with rice. She is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish so she can accommodate more orders from her customers. Salome is happy that her business allows her to send her children to school. As a responsible mother, she hopes that all her children will be successful in their studies and for them to become professionals someday. They are aged 5 to 17.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish.

loans.name: Graziella

texts.en:
Graziella lives in Aley and has been working from home as a tailor since 2000. She is married and has two daughters. Her husband works in a private company based in Beirut and her children go to school not far from home.

Graziella is 35 years old. Her main activity consists of fixing clothes for shops in the area as well as for private clients who directly reach out to her.

Graziella hasn't upgraded her equipment in a long time. In order to do so, she needs a 1,543,658 Lebanese pound loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. The loan will help her get a new sewing machine at a good price. In such a way, she will be working with improved conditions and quality of work. She is hoping that this investment in her equipment will reflect in her income, which should allow her to cover part of her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Haydee De Los Milagros

texts.es: Doña Haydee de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de catalogo desde hace 5 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa y productos todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: 52-year-old Ms. Haydee lives in her house with a family group. She has made a living by selling clothes and products from catalogues for 5 years. Her business is located in a residential area, and she has many customers because of the variety of her products. With her earnings that she has earned she has managed to settle some costs of her house. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and products, all wholesale, to be able to continue her sales and hence have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and products, all wholesale.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina lives in Dimiao with her husband. She is a woman who managed small businesses for an income. She runs a Sari-sari store business, operates a motorcycle transport business and farms rice. 

Silvina encountered challenges along the way, such as customers buying items on credit or unpredictable weather which affects her rice fields, however Silvina is always a risk-taker. She is asking for a loan to expand her business and start raising hogs. She will use her loan to buy piglets and feed to fatten them. Her children are all adults and Silvina is determined to make a success of her business so that her children will not need to provide for her and her husband's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman from Dimiao, Bohol. She is 42 years old with three children aged 10, 11 and 15. 

Marilou grows vegetables and sells Tupperware products like tumblers, lunch boxes and she also sells Vita Plus health drinks. She works hard so she can help her husband, who is a motorcycle driver. 

She is asking a loan to buy fertilizer, tupperware products and Vita Plus health drinks. Through the loan, she expects a better yield on her gardening and to sell more products and health drinks. This in turn will help her sales improve and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, tupperware products and vita plus health drink

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is a 48-year-old businesswoman who operates a stall. In her stall she sells food, most of the time chicken barbecue and hot dogs. It is common for people in the Philippines to have barbecue at nighttime. Barbecued meat is composed of different parts such as the head, intestine, liver, and backbone. To further increase her production, Rosalinda is asking for a loan to buy more chicken meat, intestines, chicken heads, and backbones.

Rosalinda hopes to expand her business so she can pay for her two children's school fees. They are aged 11 and 18.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat, chicken intestines, chicken heads, and backbones.

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis se encuentra realizando sus actividades agrícolas de temporada, ella requiere de un nuevo financiamiento para ejecutarlas sin dificultades, comprara concentrado para alimentar a los cerdos y otra parte le servirá para pagar los costos que implica la recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos, espera tener buenos resultados de la inversión.
Ella afirma que si no fuera por la ayuda de los préstamos su negocio no continuara funcionando, hoy en días tiene una mejor situación económica, con la que respalda el pago de sus deudas.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is in the middle of performing her agricultural work for this current season. She is needing a new loan to carry out those activities without any difficulties. The loan will allow her to buy feed for her pigs, as well as provide money that goes into the harvesting of basic grains.

She hope to see good results through the loan.

She affirms that if it were not for the help of the loans, her business would not continue to operate. These days Gertrudis is at an improved economic state, which helps with the repayment of her loans.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and to pay for the costs that go into the harvesting of basic grains.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman and the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She’s a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and fees for the kids.

She has operated a food selling business for two years, selling at home to neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from fellows in the same business and her aspirations are to expand her business in the near future.

Mwanasiti is borrowing this loan to buy food stuff like maize, wheat flour, beans and cooking oil. She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting that will help her very much.

She joined Yehu to have access to loans which will help in expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy food stuff like maize, wheat flour, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 25 years old and lives with her husband and child in the Guruve district. She operates a small tuck shop, selling cooking supplies and other home goods. With the earnings from her shop, Lillian pays for her child’s school fees and is able to assist her extended family. 

Lillian seeks to expand her business  and requests a Kiva loan to purchase more products for her shop. Lillian volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, encouraging students to find their strengths and improve their confidence. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through Lillian’s weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her shop

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Don jose de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace mas de 8 años, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahi llegan a moler el maiz, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, el solicita un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: 60-year-old Mr. Jose lives in his own house with his wife. He has owned a corn mill located in a residential area for more than 8 years, and has many customers, especially the ladies who make tortillas and hence go to his mill to grind corn. With what he earns from his work, he has managed to cover some costs of his house. He requests a loan to buy what is necessary for the mill, such as sashes, discs, knives. etc, and hence have better income.

loans.use: to buy what is necessary for the mill, such as sashes, discs, knives. etc.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita has been involved in the retail clothing business for two years. She organizes her sales from the house, where she lives with her husband and two school age children.

Edita works hard to satisfy her customers' demand and go in line with the market. The requested loan is very important for her to purchase a new stock of winter clothing to resell to customers. She hopes to receive lenders' support and develop her business, because the income she earns is vital for her family's living.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of winter clothing to resell to customers.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is a 30-year-old married woman from Sierra Bullones, Bohol. She has a daughter who is one year old. Marlon helps her spouse, who is a driver, in looking after the welfare of their family. While he drives, she looks after her sari-sari store business, which she started last year.

She is asking for a loan to expand and increase her inventory. She will use it to buy in bulk soft drinks, canned food, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, candies, chips, detergent, sugar and seasonings. Marlon is confident that with good management, financial awareness and perseverance, she is on the way to a successful business. It is her dream to give her family a decent home. Once she can save enough, she plans to make improvements in her house to make it bigger and more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned food, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, candies, chips, detergent, sugar and seasonings.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, 25, lives with her husband and child in Guruve district. She sells groceries from her small tuck shop in order to pay for her child’s school fees and to help support her extended family.

Cecilia plans to expand her business and requests a Kiva loan to construct her own large retail shop. Cecilia also volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, where she leads life skills sessions in active citizenship and personal confidence. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct her own large retail shop.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience, 23, lives with her husband and child in Guruve district. She runs a poultry business, which has made it possible for Patience to pay her child’s school fees and to assist her extended family. Patience requests a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run to expand her poultry business. She plans to use the profits to open her own retail shop in two years. Patience volunteers at the nearby high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching effective communication to students. Patience will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work at the school.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer luchadora que práctica el cultivo de granos básicos y la crianza de ganado y cerdos, al desarrollar estas actividades puede generar ingresos para sostener su hogar, ella es casada pero su esposo vive fuera del país, actualmente vive con su hijos, algunos de ellos están estudiando, desde que se quedó al frente de su hogar ella cuida de sus animales y con ayuda de mozos realiza las labores agrícolas por el momento no representa dificultades para administrar su negocio.
Con el préstamo podrá comprar concentrado para mantener al ganado y a los cerdos robustos y sanos, además pagara mozos para sembrar granos básicos, piensa que dé está manera fortalecerá su negocio y atenderá siempre muy bien a sus clientes, por lo que espera tener resultados positivos.
La visión de Ana es mejorar sus cosechas, tener más animales de corral y ofrecerles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Ana is a hardworking woman who cultivates basic grains and raises cattle and pigs. Through carrying out this work she is able to generate income to sustain her home. She is married but her husband lives out of the country. She currently lives with her children, some of which are studying. Ever since she stayed in front of her house, she takes care of her animals and with the help of workers she carries out the agricultural labor. For the moment, there are no present difficulties in administering her business.

With the loan she will be able to buy animal feed to keep the cattle and the pigs robust and healthy. She will also pay workers to plant basic grains. She believes that this way, she will strengthen her business and attend to her customers very well, and to do this she wishes to have positive results.

Ana's vision is to improve her harvest, have more farm animals, and offer her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to keep the cattle and the pigs robust and healthy, and also to pay workers to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa, 25, lives with her husband and child in Guruve district. She operates a small shop out of which she sells groceries. Monalisa uses her profits to pay school fees for her child and to help provide for her extended family. She is requesting a Kiva loan to construct her own large retail shop to expand her business.

Monalisa volunteers at the nearby high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, and leads students in discussion groups on how they can create a better world. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work at the school.

loans.use: to construct her own large retail shop.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
