Amal, a 35-year-old, Lebanese woman, started her clothes-selling business in Beirut back in 2010 in order to help her husband cover the children's school tuition fees. Her husband owns a shop that sells all types of curtains and her three children all go to school.

In her home-based shop, Amal sells clothes for women and children. She also sells perfume and accessories. This variety of products allows her to attract women and children in a very strategic location in Beirut.

Amal needs a loan to be able to meet the demands of her clients. She is asking for an LBP 2,571,003 (Lebanese pounds) loan for the first time, from Kiva partner, Ibdaa Microfinance SAL. She will be using the loan to buy new clothes and accessories her clients are asking for.

Amal is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her sales and income from her business. With this improved income, she will be supporting her husband in providing their three children with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for her clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Jovel

texts.es: Jovel de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijas, el se dedica al cultivo de arroz bajo riego desde hace 30 años y comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, gracias a ese trabajo como ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando por tercera ocasion otro crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de mas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. ya que le va muy bien en su trabajo y sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jovel, 65 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and 4 children. He has been growing rice under risk for 30 years and sells his products in different markets near his house. Because of this work, he and his family have been able to move forward and progress in life.

This is the third time he is seeking a loan through INTEGRAL so that he can buy more fertilizers, manure, pest control, and more. As things are going very well with his work and sales, he hopes to earn more income for a greater quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Yahuar Maqui Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Maria Antonieta  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo, saltado, sopas entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como carnes, aceite, arroz entre otros.
Los socios en general  agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the "Yahuar Maqui" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco.

One of the members, Maria Antonieta, alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business. She makes different types of dishes, such as rice, chicken and soups, among others. She has had this business for quite some time and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She is an entrepreneurial woman that hopes to obtain additional profits to be able to continue supporting her family. 

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies such as meat, oil, and rice, among others.

All of the partners thank those that make this dream possible and promise to repay their loans back on time. The partners in the bottom photos asked for permission to arrive to the meeting late as they were working.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as meat, oil and rice, among others.

loans.name: Janeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Janeth es una joven muy aplicada y trabajadora, a sus treinta y cuatro años de edad, ya cuenta con su propio salón de belleza, en cual deja todos los días largas jornadas de trabajo para que este sea exitoso y crezca. Ella ya ha tenido una muy buena experiencia con un crédito de Kiva y MiCrédito, este lo ocupo para pagar su título de Licenciada en Administración de Empresas, por lo cual confía fielmente y está profundamente agradecida con ambas organizaciones. 
Ella ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo que planea invertir en su salón, y comprar planchas de pelo, maquillaje, tratamientos, cremas, pinturas de uña, entre otros artículos, dado que esta temporada del año será fundamental para que su negocio crezca. En un futuro desea mejorar infraestructura de su local.
texts.en:
Janeth is a very studious and hard-working young woman. At 34 years of age, she already has her own beauty parlor, to which she devotes long work hours so that it will be successful and grow. She has already had a good experience with a Kiva loan and with MiCredito, which she used to pay for her diploma of Graduate in Business Administration. For this reason, she faithfully trusts in and is profoundly thankful to both organizations.

She has requested a new loan which she plans to invest in her salon and buy hair irons, cosmetics, treatments, creams, and nail polishes amongst other things since during this season they will be essential in order for her business to grow. In the future, she wants to improve the infrastructure of her place of business.

loans.use: to buy hair irons, cosmetics, treatments, creams, and nail polishes amongst other things.

loans.name: Pamellah

texts.en:
Pamellah is 25 years old, and lives with her husband and child in Guruve district. She operates a poultry business and uses her earnings to cover her child’s school fees and to help support her family. Pamellah requests a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run to expand her poultry business. She plans to use the profits from her poultry business to open a retail shop.

Pamellah volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the nearby high school, leading discussion groups on how students can create a better world. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work with her students.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run and expand her poultry business.

loans.name: Treatmore

texts.en:
Treatmore, 25, lives in Guruve district with her husband and child, where she runs a poultry business. With her earnings, Treatmore is able to pay her child’s school fees and to assist her extended family.

Treatmore is requesting a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run in order to improve her poultry business. Treatmore plans to use the profits she earns to open her own retail shop.

Treatmore also volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching effective communication. Treatmore will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work at the school.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Hatinahama

texts.en:
Hatinahama is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Guruve district. She operates a poultry business, and with her earnings is able to pay her children’s school fees and to help support her extended family.

Hatinahama seeks a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run to expand her poultry business. She plans to use the increased profits from her poultry business to expand into a butcher shop.

Hatinahama volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, and leads students in sessions on active citizenship and personal confidence. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Wadzanai

texts.en:
Wadzanai is 25 years old and lives in Guruve district with her husband and child. She operates a poultry business, using her earnings to pay for her child’s school fees and the needs of her extended family.

Wadzanai seeks a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run to expand her poultry business. She plans to use the increased profit to launch a butcher shop.

She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students at the local high school. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Rafaela Cristina

texts.es:
Rafaela es una mujer de cincuenta y siete años de edad, de carácter fuerte, ella es estilista desde que era una adolescente, hace muchos años fundo en su casa de habitación un salón de belleza que ha ido creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo. Madre soltera de tres hijos, a los cuales logro preparar ya son egresados de la universidad. Su hija mayor es su principal apoyo emocional y económico. 
Ella ha decidido optar a un crédito de saneamiento que ofrece Kiva junto a MiCrédito, con el cual planea mejorar las condiciones del servicio higiénico que tiene en su negocio, dado que hacer esto le garantizaría que sus clientas se van a sentir seguras y satisfechas con el servicio que se les está brindando. En un futuro desea poder expandir su salón actual y abrir otra sucursal en su ciudad.
texts.en:
Rafaela is a 57-year old woman with a strong personality. She has been a stylist since she was a teen. Many years ago she set up a beauty salon in her home. The business has been growing, thanks to her efforts.

Rafaela is the single mother of three children. She was able to prepare them well, and they are enrolled in the university. Rafaela's eldest daughter is her main emotional and financial support.

Rafaela decided to take out a sanitation loan offered by Kiva together with MiCrédito. With the loan, she plans to improve the condition of her business's restroom. Doing so will guarantee her customers feeling safe and satisfied with the service Rafaela offers them. In the future, she wants to expand her current salon and open another branch in her city.

loans.use: to improve the condition of her business's restroom.

loans.name: Charmaine

texts.en:
Charmaine is 19 years old and lives in Guruve district with her husband and child. She runs a poultry business, and uses her earnings to assist her extended family and to cover school fees for her child. Charmaine seeks a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run to expand her business. She plans to reinvest her profits into her business and aims to become a top supplier of chickens in Guruve.

Charmaine volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches students at the local high school to find their own strengths. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Fidelity

texts.en:
Fidelity, 27, lives with her husband and child in Guruve district, Zimbabwe. She volunteers at the nearby high school as a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches students about active citizenship.

Fidelity raises chickens and uses the profits to pay school fees for her child and to help support her extended family. She is requesting a 500 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Camfed Zimbabwe to build a large chicken run to improve her business. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

Fidelity plans to use her increased earnings to open a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to build a large chicken run to improve her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, 25, lives in Guruve district with her husband and child. She helps support her extended family and pays her child’s school fees with the earnings from the poultry business she operates. Florence is requesting a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run to improve her business. She plans to use her increased profits to open a retail shop.

Florence volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, encouraging students to partake in active citizenship. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 25 years old and lives in Guruve district with her husband and child. She operates a poultry business in order to pay school fees for her child and to assist her extended family. Sandra is requesting a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run in order to expand her business. She plans to continue improving her poultry business and aims to become a top supplier of chickens in her community.

Sandra volunteers at the nearby high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, building her students’ confidence and teaching effective communication. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and child in Guruve district where she operates her poultry business. Through the success of her business, Natasha is able to pay her child’s school fees and to help support her extended family. Natasha is requesting a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run. She plans to use the increased profits to further expand her poultry business to include laying hens as well.

Natasha volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading discussions at the local high school on how students can create a better world. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work at the school.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Tarisai

texts.en:
Tarisai, 26, lives in Guruve district with her husband and child. She operates a tuck shop and uses her earnings to pay school fees for her child and to help her extended family. Tarisai seeks to expand her business endeavors and is requesting a Kiva loan to construct her own retail shop. Tarisai plans to reinvest the profits she earns into the retail shop.

Tarisai volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students at the local high school about effective communication. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct her own retail shop.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Guruve district, Zimbabwe. Through her success raising and selling chickens, she pays her children’s school fees and helps her extended family. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to students at the local high school.

Sylivia has applied for 500 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Camfed to build a large chicken run for her flock. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

In the future Sylivia plans to use her profits to include laying hens in her operation.

loans.use: to build a large chicken run for her flock.

loans.name: Ever Windsor

texts.es:
Ever es un hombre de 38 años, vive con su pareja, tiene una hija de 16 años y su negocio es la venta e instalación de antenas parabólicas.
Él es constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max Paredes’ caracterizado por ser la zona comercial más antigua y popular, aquí se confecciona ropa al lado de restaurantes y colegios y comercios en todas las áreas, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura máxima de 14 grados centígrados.
Ever es de tez morena, cabello negro corto y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta e instalación de antenas parabólicas, las largas distancias y el difícil acceso en poblaciones alejadas hacen que la televisión sea un servicio inexistente, frente a esta situación una buena solución es la instalación de antenas parabólicas satelitales, las cuales brindan una señal codificada para ser reproducida en el televisor, “la mayor parte de las áreas rurales y de los barrios alejados del centro de la ciudad no tiene el acceso a la televisión por cable, yo les brindo una solución alternativa para estar acorde al resto de la población…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso debido a que su público es rural y de zonas alejadas sin acceso a televisión. La ventaja de su negocio es que realiza la venta e instalación, la desventaja es la falta de antenas y decodificadores para brindar el servicio. Su sueño es ampliar las ventas en el área rural, el desea comprar antenas y decodificadores para realizar la conexión de televisión satelital en el campo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ever solicita un préstamo para comprar antenas y decodificadores para realizar la conexión de televisión satelital en el campo.
texts.en:
Ever is a 38-year-old man who lives with his life partner and has a 16-year-old daughter. His business is selling and installing satellite dishes.
He is consistent, responsible, and hardworking. 

His business is located in the 'Max Paredes' district, characterized as being one of the oldest and most popular shopping areas. Here, clothes are made next to restaurants, and schools, and businesses of all types. The weather is cold and dry with a maximum temperature of 14 degrees Celsius.

Ever is swarthy, with short black hair and a sturdy build. His mother tongue is Aymara, which he speaks within his family. He speaks Spanish in situations of general culture and in his business. He shares his life with his partner, who also works in the same business, and with his daughter who is going to school. They live in a rented space built of brick with a corrugated metal roof, and that is connected to potable water, electric power, and a sewage system. 

His business is selling and installing satellite dishes. The long distances and difficult access to remote towns makes television a nonexistent service. To alleviate this situation, a good solution is to install a satellite dish, which provides a coded signal to be reproduced on the TV. "Most of the rural areas and neighborhoods located far from the city center do not have access to cable television. I offer them an alternative solution to stay on par with the rest of the population..." he says. 

His business is a success thanks to the fact that his customers live in rural and distant areas without access to television. The advantage of his business is that he takes care of sales and installation; the disadvantage is the lack of antennas and decoders to provide the service. 

His dream is to expand his sales in rural areas. He wants to buy antennas and decoders so he can set up satellite television connections in the country. 

This is his first loan sequence with our institution in three years of operating this business. It is for these reasons that Ever is requesting a loan to buy antennas and decoders to connect satellite television in the country.

loans.use: to buy antennas and decoders so he can set up satellite television connections in the country.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian, solicita un nuevo crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de productos comestibles, como cereales, agua, golosinas, granos básicos, etc., para surtir su mini tienda, en vista que se aproxima una buena temporada en la que considera podrá obtener buenos ingresos.
Ella comenta que con el crédito anterior pudo incrementar su inventario y esto le permitió generar buenas ganancias pagar las deudas y suplir los gastos del hogar. En relación a la vez anterior Mirian ha podido hacerle unas mejoras a su hogar además de poder llevar el sustento para su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian is requesting a new loan to invest in the purchase of food products such as cereal, water, snacks, grains, etc. to stock her mini-store because a good season is coming up during which she thinks she will be able to earn good income. 

She says that with the previous loan, she was able to increase her inventory and this allowed her to generate revenue to pay debts and household expenses. Last time, Mirian was able to make some improvements to her home in addition to being able to earn a living for her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of food products such as cereals, water, snacks, grains, etc., to stock her mini-store.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally, 25, lives with her husband and child in Guruve district. She operates a tuck shop business and uses her earnings to pay school fees for her child and to assist her extended family. With the success of her business, Sally managed to expand her shop. She is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase stock for her new shop in preparation for the holiday season. Sally plans to reinvest her profits into her business.

Sally volunteers at the nearby high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading discussion groups on how students can create a better world. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her new shop.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Happiness is 21 years old and lives with her parents in Guruve district. She operates a poultry business and uses her earnings to help support her family. Happiness seeks a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run to improve her business. She plans to use her increased profits to expand her business into a butcher shop as well.

Happiness volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local high school leading life skills sessions. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Tariro

texts.en:
Tariro, 21, lives with her parents in Guruve district. She helps support her family with the earnings of her gardening business. Tariro is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase seeds and garden appliances so that she can expand her garden. She plans to use the profits she earns to expand her gardening business, to a shop where she will sell her farm produce.

Tariro volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide where she teaches students about active citizenship. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and garden appliances.

loans.name: Laina

texts.en:
Laina is 28 years old and lives with her parents in Guruve district. She runs a poultry business to help support her family. Laina plans to expand her business, and is requesting a Kiva loan to construct her own fowl run. She plans to use her profits to launch a poultry business to complement her gardening business and better serve her community.

Laina volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide where she leads life skills sessions. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct her own fowl run.

loans.name: Cassandra

texts.en:
Cassandra graduated from cosmetology school in September. She decided to start practicing as an esthetician immediately, since a close family friend had a spot for her at a local hair salon, Alante Hair Design. Since the salon is already well-established, Cassandra has access to a large clientele base.

Ever since she was a little girl, she wanted to be a makeup artist. She wasn’t able to start right away because her parents taught her that if she wanted something, she had to work hard for it. After realizing that she wanted to become a business owner, she went full force with her dreams and everything has fallen into place.

She will use her Kiva loan to purchase inventory for the holiday season, as the salon owner has warned her they are very busy during this time of year.

In the future, Cassandra would like to have a mobile service salon by purchasing a mobile utility truck. This truck would have a full-service salon and would go to the client, as opposed to a storefront.

With Kiva lenders' help, Cassandra will be able to provide service to clients and grow her business so she can fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the holiday season.

loans.name: Leonorah

texts.en:
Leonorah is 23 years old and lives in Guruve district with her husband and child. She runs a poultry business and uses her earnings to both pay her child’s school fees and assist her extended family.

Leonorah seeks a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run so she can improve her poultry business. She plans to use the profits she earns to expand with the addition of a butcher shop.

Leonorah volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, and she leads her students in life skills sessions on effective communication and improving her students’ confidence. The interest on her social-interest loans will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Feresiya

texts.en:
Feresiya is 26 years old and lives with her husband and child in Guruve district. With the success of her poultry business, Feresiya is able to pay her child’s school fees and to aid her extended family. Feresiya is requesting a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run to improve her poultry business. She plans to use the profit she earns from her poultry business to realize her dream of opening a retail shop.

Feresiya volunteers at her local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions, and teaching active citizenship and personal confidence. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus, 24, lives with her husband and daughter in Chiredzi District. She runs a stand at the local flea market and uses her earnings to support her family and to pay school fees for her daughter. Felistus is requesting a Kiva loan to construct her own large boutique. She plans to reinvest her profits and continue expanding her boutique.

Felistus volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, and leads life skills sessions for students at the nearby high school. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct her own large boutique.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn, 28, lives with her husband and two children in Guruve district. She runs a poultry business in order to pay school fees for her children and to help support her extended family. Roselyn requests a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run. She plans to use her profits to open a retail shop in her community.

Roselyn volunteers at the nearby high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading students in life skills sessions. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Nomatter

texts.en:
Nomatter is 22 years old and lives with her husband and child in Guruve district. She operates a poultry business, and uses her earnings to cover her child’s school fees and to help support her extended family. Nomatter is requesting for a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run to improve her business. She plans to use the increased profits to further expand into a retail and butcher shop.

Nomatter volunteers at the nearby high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, helping her students find their own strengths. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
At the age of 47, Asif started his school in 2015. Asif intended it to grow each and every day and hoped one day it would become the top school in his area. He shares a major problem is financial constraint to improve the school building. Asif has 87 students in his school, whereas 57% female students are enrolled. He says one of the key issues is to have well-trained teachers, and also the school facilities do not meet the needs of his students.

Asif requested PKR 75,000 to build school infrastructure and construction. The number of school students is constantly increasing, and so Asif is helping his teachers improve their technical skills so they can provide a high-quality education to the children.

loans.use: to build school infrastructure and construction.

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en:
Tendai is 28 years old and lives with her parents in Chiredzi District. She supports her children and family by selling cosmetics from a small stand. With plans to expand her business, Tendai seeks a Kiva loan to construct her own shop. She plans to reinvest her profits into her cosmetics business.

Tendai volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, and leads life skills sessions on active citizenship and building her students’ confidence. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: to construct her own shop.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
42 years old and married, Rabia has been running her school for 12 years. Her school holds 186 students, and 51% are female student.

Rabia faces many challenges in running her school successfully. Currently, she faces inadequate building space in order to accommodate her school children. Rabia has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to repair and construct the school building.

Rabia plans to expand her school from middle to high school level by increasing both the building and school enrollment.

loans.use: to repair and construct a school building.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old, single man from Dier Al-Balah, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Mahmoud has a stall for selling kitchenware in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Mahmoud has taken a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of kitchenware to sell from his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually allow him to save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of kitchenware to sell from his stall.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old, single man from Khanyounis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Mohammad has a stall in the city where he sells clothing. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Mohammad has taken a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell from his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually let him save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell from his stall. .

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 29-year-old, married man from Khanyounis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Nidal has a stall in the city where he sells shoes and clothing. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Nidal is taking a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell from his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually let him save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell from his stall.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old, married man from Khanyounis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Ahmad has a stall in the city where he sells clothing. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Ahmad is taking a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell from his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to not only increase his sales and customers but also let him eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell from his stall.

loans.name: M.lata's Group

texts.en:
M.lata is an elderly person standing to the extreme left hand side in the photograph. She is a humble resident of a remote village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. She has one son and one daughter in her care, and both her children are grown up.

The factor that concerns her the most is that she does not have an appropriate toilet at her home, because of which she faces a lot of difficulties to travel a long distance to relieve herself in this old age. She is very much concerned about her health, as she is getting older with the passage of time.

Therefore, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. M.lata will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and safe toilet and install a hand water pump in her toilet.

She will be able to gain peace of mind and decrease her medical expenses by getting access to a toilet. She is eagerly awaiting your support.

loans.use: to build a clean and safe toilet and install a hand water pump in her toilet.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is 23 years old and lives with her husband and child in Guruve district. She runs a poultry business and through her success, is able to pay school fees for her child and help support her extended family.

Adeline is requesting a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run to improve her business. She plans to use her profits to open a retail shop as well.

Adeline volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, instructing students at the local high school on active citizenship. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Prospective

texts.en:
Prospective is 22 years old and lives with her husband and child in Guruve district. She operates a poultry business in order to pay school fees for her child and to help her extended family.

Prospective is requesting a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run to increase business. In addition to serving her community, Prospective plans to expand her business to serve boarding schools as well.

Prospective also serves her community through her volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading discussion groups on how students can create a better world. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 24-year-old, single man from Khanyounis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Muhammad has a stall in the city where he sells clothing. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Muhammad is taking a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell from his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers and eventually permit him to save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell from his stall.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 29-year-old, single man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Alaa' has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Alaa' took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually to save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old, married man from Khanyounis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Mohammad has a grocery store in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Mohammad has taken a USD murabaha-type loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new goods and inventory to sell from his store. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers and eventually let him save enough income to cover the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy new goods and inventory to sell from his store.

loans.name: Marlene Virginia

texts.es:
Marlene es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 1 año y 3 hijas de 14, 16 y 19 años, y su negocio es la confección de prendas de vestir.
Ella es amable, conversadora y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’ caracterizada por encontrarse el cruce de caminos que conecta a este lugar con poblaciones y zonas alejadas de la ciudad, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura máxima de 12 grados centígrados.
Marlene es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y físico robusto. Su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida al comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuanta con agua potable energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de pantalones de vestir para hombre, actividad que inicio junto a su pareja, compran tela por rollo y realizan ventas por mayor y por menor, también realizan trabajos a pedido, “toda la familia trabaja en el negocio, ahora mis hijas también se están iniciando…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque realiza buenos cortes. La ventaja de su negocio es que es familiar y todos trabajan, la desventaja es la falta de máquina collareta para trabajos con mejor acabado. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales, ella desea comprar una máquina de coser collareta para mejorar el acabado de la confección. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marlene solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser collareta para mejorar el acabado de las confecciónes.
texts.en:
Marlene is a 38-years old woman. She lives with her life partner and has a one-year old son and three daughters of 14, 16 and 19 years old. Her business is sewing clothing. 

She is friendly, chatty and very responsible.  Her business is located in the "Cruce Villa Adela" area which is characterized by the crossroads that link this place with towns and areas cut off from the city. The climate is cold and dry with a maximum temperature of 12 degrees celsius. 

Marlene is of dark complexion, has long dark hair and has a robust physique.  Her mother tongue is Aymará which she speaks in her home environment.  She speaks Spanish as the common language and for the business she runs. She shares her life with her partner who works in the same business, and with her children who are studying at school. They live in a rented room built out of brick with a roof made of corrugated iron. The room has running water, electricity and sewage.

Her business is making pants for men, an occupation she began together with her partner. They buy fabric by the roll and they sell both wholesale and retail. They also work by request. She comments "all the family works in the business, now my daughters are also starting". Her business is successful because she makes good cuts. The advantage of her business is that her family and everyone works, and the disadvantage is the absence of an industrial sewing machine for works with better finish. 

Her dream is that her children become professionals, and she wants to buy a sewing machine to improve the finish of the clothing. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 20 years that she’s been in this business.

It is for these reasons that Marlene is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to improve the finish of the clothing.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve the finish of the clothing.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a married woman with two adult children. They live in Valencia, Bohol. Since her husband is a farmer, Tital learned how to embrace the work in the long run. The last three years has been spent working on her coconut farm, and she also earns an income as a copra dealer. Tita also raise hogs.

She is asking a loan to increase the volume of her business. She will use it as an additional capital to buy more copra and deal with other coconut farmers, so she can buy their produce and sell it in the market. She will also spend the money on the needed feed for her hogs. She hopes to expand her business and increase her income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy feed and more copra from farmers.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 41-year-old women working for her community though school. Samina started this school 20 years ago and did her best to make a successful school. There are 122 students in her school, 60% of which are female. Samina enjoys her duties and struggles a lot to provide all facilities to the children. She desires to establish a computer lab for her students to provide computer skills.

She has requested PKR 60,000 to build room in the school to accommodate increasing strength of students. She believes the key to success is hard work, and that is something she is used to.

loans.use: to build room in the school to accommodate increasing strength of students.

loans.name: Muzin

texts.en:
Muzin is a 45-year-old, married woman from Jenin, West Bank. She lives with her family in a small, old house. She is the only breadwinner for her family, and they depend on her for support. Muzin has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides her with a good income, but the economic situation became bad recently.

Muzin took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help her to buy a new collection of clothes to sell at her stall. She hopes that this new inventory will enable his to increase her sales and customers, and eventually save enough income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is a 33-year-old Palestinian entrepreneur. He lives with his family in a small, old house in Ramallah City. Hadi is a talented photographer. He is considering filming important and necessary events to inform the world about his country, especially "because he lives in the conflict area such as Palestine."

Hadi is taking a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new camera to cover what is happening in Palestine. He hopes that this new camera will enable him to take professional video.

Hadi appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy a new camera to cover what is happening in Palestine.

loans.name: Al-Munzer

texts.en:
Al-Munzer is a 20-year-old, Palestinian entrepreneur man. He lives with his family in a small, old house in Khan Younis City, Gaza Strip.

Al-Munzer is talented in photography. He is considered filming something important and necessary to inform the world about his country, especially because he lives in a conflict area, such as Gaza.

Al-Munzer took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new camera to cover what is happening in Palestine. He hopes that this new camera will enable him to take a professional photo.

Al-Munzer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new camera to cover what is happening in Palestine.

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 15 y 11 años y dos niñas de 16 y 2 años de edad, además vive con ellos su madre, a la que siempre busca la manera de apoyar. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicharras, tostadas de plátano y yuca, entre otros productos. María desea invertir en sus productos y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: plátanos, chicharras, yuca, chile, limón, etc., para su negocio y de esta manera surtir su mercadería.
texts.en: María is 37 years old. She lives with her life partner, her two sons aged 15 and 11, and her two daughters aged 16 and 2. Her mother also lives with them, and María always strives to support her. She makes and sells craklings, plantain and yucca toasts, and other foodstuffs. María wishes to invest in her products and for that reason she requests a loan from FUSAI to purchase plantains, pork rind, yucca, chili peppers, lemons, etc. for her business. That way she'll stock up on merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase plantains, pork rind, yucca, chili peppers, lemons, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a married man of 30. He lives in Valencia, Bohol with his family. He has three children aged four, two, and eleven.

Joel is engaged in a habal-habal service (transporting passengers using a motorcycle) and he also runs a sari-sari store business that is mostly managed by his wife when he is driving his motorcycle.

He is asking for a loan to pay for motorcycle maintenance and to increase his inventory for the store. He will include buying grocery items such as toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, and bath soap to sell.

His hard work is for his children’s future, their school fees, and healthy meals.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and buy toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, and bath soap.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a farmer from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married with one dependent aged 17. She also raises hogs for supplemental income. She has been in the farming business for 5 years now. This is the main source of her income.

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and feed and supplements for pigs. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm and thus augment her harvest and yield. As well, her pigs will grow well, assuring her of good sales in 4 months.

In the future, Gloria hopes to make her farming business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed and supplements for pigs.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La señora Antonia es casada, tiene cinco hijos, ella es ama de casa y trabaja en agricultura y ganadería con sus hijos y su marido, cuando era niña estudio hasta segundo grado, pero dejó de asistir a clases porque la escuela le quedaba demasiado largo y en tiempos de lluvias se le complicaba llegar hasta la escuela. Dos de sus hijos están en estados unidos trabajando y le mandan dinero para que compren ganado e inviertan en la finca.  En la comunidad donde habita la señora Antonia no hay luz eléctrica, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema de refrigeración solar el cual será instalado en la casa de habitación, ella quiere un Refrigerador ya que a veces hace cuajada y crema y cuando no se refrigeran rápido se le daña, también cuando hace bebidas se lo toman caliente y al obtener un refrigerador tomarían bebidas mas frescas, además podría mantener heladas las vacunas para el ganado  y los productos lácteos y las carnes se mantendrían por mayor tiempo, es por eso que ella estaría muy agradecida si le brindan la oportunidad de un préstamo para la compra de este refrigerador que será de gran beneficio para el hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia is married and has five children. She is a housewife and also works in agriculture and livestock with her children and husband. When she was a girl, she was in school until the second grade, but she stopped attending classes because the school was too large and when it rained it was difficult to get to. Two of her children are working in the United States, and they send her money to buy livestock and invest in the farm. Because there is no electric light in the community where Mrs. Antonia lives, she is asking for a loan to buy a solar refrigeration system, which will be installed in the house.

She wants a refrigerator because sometimes she makes curds and cream, which spoils if it’s not refrigerated quickly. Also when she makes drinks, she has to drink them warm, but with a refrigerator she could have them cold. Finally, she could keep the vaccines for the livestock frozen and keep the lactose products and meat at a better temperature. It’s for these reasons she would be very grateful if given the opportunity to take a loan and purchase this refrigerator, which would be such a valuable addition to her home.

loans.use: to have a 165-liter solar refrigeration system installed.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 54 years old and married, with a son aged 17. Her husband is a farmer and a carpenter.

They grow rice crops to sell while also manages a small backyard piggery. She grows pigs for fattening and sells them in the market.

Naomi is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase pig feeds and fertilizers to help her business earn more profit. In the future, Naomi hopes to have a good life with her family.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene resides in Dimiao, Bohol. He is 55 years old and he owned a vulcanizing shop business.

Vulcanizing services are good for emergencies of vehicle owners who have problems with their tires. It entails mounting and dismounting of tires. This business started in 2010 and earns him PHP 4,000 per month.

Gene also sell clothes to the people in his place. He is asking for a loan to buy clothes and pay for repair and maintenance in his vulcanizing shop.

Gene plans to manage his business well so he can further expand, save, and reinvest in the same business, in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes and pay for repair and maintenance in his vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Dolomé

texts.fr: Dolomé est une femme âgée de 64 ans qui vit à Baguida. Veuve et mère d’un enfant, Dolomé est une marchande de produits alimentaires et de crabes qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Dolomé désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des bols de poissons fumés et des paniers de crabes en vue de bien revendre puis d’en tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en: Dolomé is a 64-year-old woman who lives in Baguida. A widow and the mother of one child, she is a merchant of grocery items and crabs, which are supplied three times a month from the market. She resells the merchandise in her stall in front of her home. Dolomé would like this loan to finance her purchase of bowls of smoked fish and baskets of crabs with the aim of having good sales and then making a profit and earning more revenues. She could then do better at covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bowls of smoked fish and 6 baskets of crabs

loans.name: Soulen Milagros

texts.es:
Soulen es una joven estudiante que vive con su madre, hermanos y abuelos. Es la hija mayor de 3 hermanos. Su madre es ama de casa. Ella decidió estudiar Control de Calidad Textil porque le pareció muy interesante, adicional a ello se acopla mucho a las cualidades que tiene desde niña.

Le va muy bien en su carrera, trata siempre de esforzarse para ser la mejor de su clase. Le dedica 45 horas semanales a sus estudios, entre clases teóricas y prácticas. Lleva estudiando 10 meses, aún le falta un año y medio para culminar su carrera. Cuando esto suceda, a ella le gustaría trabajar en una importante empresa en la cual pueda desempeñarse en diferentes áreas que le permita obtener mayor experiencia para luego crear su propia empresa.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es poder culminar exitosamente su carrera para luego formar su propia empresa y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

En los últimos meses, su madre no cuenta con trabajo lo que no le permite contar con el dinero que Soulen necesita para que pueda culminar con sus estudios. Por eso, recurre a KIVA para que puedan apoyarla y así su madre pueda estar más tranquila, al saber que Soulen podrá culminar su carrera a tiempo.

En señal de agradecimiento a KIVA, Soulen quiere dedicarles unas líneas: "Me siento muy contenta y agradecida por el apoyo que me están brindando, gracias a ustedes muchos estudiantes como yo pueden lograr sus sueños. Gracias KIVA desde el fondo de mi corazón!".
texts.en: Soulen is a young student who lives with her mother, siblings and grandparents. She is the older sister of 3 siblings. Her mother is a housewife. Soulen decided to study Textile Quality Control, because she found it very interesting. Also, it fits very well with the qualities she has had since she was a child. She is doing very well with her career. She always works hard to be the best in her class. She studies for 45 hours a week, including theory and practices. She has been studying for 10 months and still has a year and a half left to finish her career. When this happens, she would like to work at an important company which will allow her to work in different areas and obtain more experience in order to open her own company.  Her greatest dream in life is to finish her career successfully so she can later start her own company and be able to give her family a better quality of life. In the last months, her mother does not have a job and this is why she does not have the money that Soulen needs to finish her studies. Therefore, she is asking KIVA to support her so that her mother can be less worried knowing that Soulen will finish her career on time. Grateful to KIVA, Soulen is writing the following lines: "I feel very happy and grateful for the support they are giving me. Thanks to you, many students like myself can achieve their dreams. Thanks KIVA from the bottom of my heart!".

loans.use: to continue with her studies in Textile Quality Control.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana es una mujer trabajadora de 39 años de edad, que vive con su hija de 15 años de edad, a la que está sacando adelante como madre soltera. Ella cuenta con un salón de belleza, en el que ofrece diferentes servicios como: masajes, cortes de cabello, entre otros, lo cual le permite salir adelante. Ana desea invertir en su salón de belleza, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para adquirir maquinaria, plancha de cabello, entre otros productos para su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Ana is a hard-working woman of 39 years of age who lives with her 15-year-old daughter, whom she is raising as a single mother. She has a beauty salon in which she offers various services such as massages and haircuts, among other services, which allows her to get ahead.

Ana wants to invest in her beauty salon. To do this, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to acquire equipment, a hair iron, and other products for her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy equipment, a hair iron, and other products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Areli

texts.es: Areli a sus 63 años de edad se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de comestibles, en un chalet que tiene ubicado en la escuela de la zona, además cuenta con una mini tienda, en su vivienda. Ella habita en casa de su propiedad desde hace muchos años, por lo que es muy reconocida en su comunidad. Areli desea invertir en su negocio y para ello solicita a FUSAI un crédito con el cual invertirá en: lácteos, productos para pupusas, granos básicos, golosinas, entre otros productos para su tienda y el chalet.
texts.en: At 63 years old, Areli works in the business of selling food at a kiosk located in the school of her area. She also has a mini-store in her home. She has lived in her own house for many years, and for this reason she is very well known in her community. Areli wants to invest in her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI that she will invest in: dairy products, products for "pupusas", basic grains, sweets, among other products for her store and kiosk.

loans.use: to invest in: dairy products, products for "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas), basic grains, sweets, among other products for her store and kiosk.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La socia Lucy continúa dedicándose al negocio de venta de huevo sancochado y la venta de huevo. Con estas dos pequeñas actividades sale adelante y aporta en su hogar, ella pertenece al banco comunal "sirenachayoc" y desea seguir luchando por su meta de conseguir un local donde ella pueda expender sus productos de mejor manera.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar papa, mayonesa, huevos y gelatina, ingredientes indispensables para su negocio.
La socia está satisfecha y agradecida con el préstamo otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA.
texts.en: The member Lucy continues working in the business of selling cooked eggs and fresh eggs. With these two small businesses she moves forward and supports her household. She belongs to the Communal Bank "Sirenachayoc", and wants to continue working hard for her goal of getting a store where she can sell her products in a better way. Lucy is requesting a loan to buy potatoes, mayonnaise, eggs and gelatin, indispensable ingredients for her business. She is happy and grateful for the given loan by the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, mayonnaise, eggs and gelatin.

loans.name: Eid

texts.en:
Eid is married and has five children. After he retired from his work he decided to open his own business which is a grocery store. ‎He started a small project of selling food, supplies, and general products to improve his income. Then he started to ‎make and sell sandwiches to earn even more income.

Eid does not want to stop. He wants to develop and expand ‎his shop, so he has asked for a loan to enable him to expand and promote his shop and buy new products so he can attract more ‎customers. Perhaps this will help him to increase his monthly income and improve his living conditions.‎

loans.use: to expand and promote his shop and buy new products.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a 28-year-old married man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

He has a store for selling laptops and computers in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict.

Hamza took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of laptops to sell at his store. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of laptops to sell at his store.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 35-year-old, married woman from the city of Jabalia, which is located in the Gaza Strip. She works as an employee in the public sector where she earns a low income. This income barely covers all of the family needs. But she wants to make her family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Samah has taken a USD loan from FATEN which will enable her to buy a solar power system for heating water for the family house.

By taking this loan, Samah will be able to decrease electricity expenses, while also using a form of energy cleaner than gas. Her family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Samah appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juana Elizabeth  es una socia emprendedora y luchadora, ella continúa dedicándose a su negocio de venta de accesorios de carros, gracias a este negocio sale adelante junto con su familia que la apoya. Como el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio ella solicito el préstamo para aumentar su mercadería.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar llantas, retrovisores y faros de auto.
La socia está satisfecha con el crédito otorgado y agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella.
texts.en:
Juana Elizabeth is an entrepreneurial and hard-working [communal bank] member. She continues working in her business of selling automobile accessories. Thanks to this business she is moving ahead along with her family, which she supports. Because her dream is to enlarge her business, she applied for the loan to expand her merchandise.

She applied for the loan to purchase tires, rear-view mirrors, and auto headlights.

She is satisfied with the loan granted and thanks the Kiva investors for continuing to have confidence in her.

loans.use: to buy tires, rear-view mirrors, and auto headlights.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de comidas, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora.la socia sigue luchando a diario por su meta de tener un restaurante  donde podrá vender de forma segura todo lo que ella prepara para sus clientes. 
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar carne, arroz y pollo.
La socia esta agradecida por el crédito otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Zenovia continues making a living in her food sales business. She is a hard-working and enterprising woman. The partner continues struggling daily for her goal to have a restaurant where she will be able to sell in a secure way all the she prepares for her customers.

The partner requests a loan in order to buy meat, rice and chicken.

The partner is grateful for the loan offered by the Kiva investors and promises to make her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice and chicken.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad was born in 1976. He is single and lives with his family in Irbid. He has been running his own grocery for ‎many years now. He started his project selling a few vegetables and food supplies.

Now, Mohammad wants to expand his ‎business and increase his profit to be able to cover his parents’ expenses and to provide for them. Unfortunately, he currently ‎doesn't have enough money to do so.

For this reason, Mohammad has applied for this loan to buy more products and food supplies ‎such as flour, chips, soft drinks, candies, and vegetables to improve his shop and thus also his standard of living.‎

loans.use: to buy more products and food supplies ‎such as flour, chips, soft drinks, candies, and vegetables.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a puto vendor from Dimiao, Bohol. Puto is a steamed rice cake that is a favorite snack for locals. With her plastic pail, Mercy carries her puto to her neighbors during mornings and early afternoons.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, baking powder, sugar, and yeast. Her income allows her to buy food for her four children aged eight to nineteen.

Mercy is confident that through her loan, her capital will increase and give her the chance to continue her expansion in the future. Her profit will also be utilized for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, baking powder, sugar, and yeast

loans.name: Wend Baraka Group

texts.fr: Wend Baraka vient de finir son 1er prêt Kiva. Le remboursement a été fait normalement. Binanaté, membre représentatif du groupe remercie tout le personnel et les prêteurs de kiva pour le soutien. Avec le prêt, Binanaté avait pu payer les céréales (Maïs, haricot, mil,...) et vendre. Elle a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de payer des habits pour ses enfants, de faire quelques dépenses pour sa famille et surtout d'augmenter son activité. Binanaté a encore besoin de crédit pour renforcer son activité. A l'issue de ses ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Wend Baraka just finished its first Kiva loan. Payments were made normally. Binanaté, the representative member of the group, says thank you to Kiva personnel and lenders for the support. With this loan, Binanaté had been able to pay for grains (corn, beans, millet, …) to sell. She had a profit, which enabled her to buy clothing for her children, pay for a few things for her family, and grow her business in particular.

Binanaté still has need of loans to bolster her business. Following her sales, her profits will allow her to continue her work.

loans.use: to buy cereals (beans, corn) to sell.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is a 32-year-old, married man from Dier Al-Balah, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Yaser has a pickles stall in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. He is taking a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of vegetables to make pickles to sell from his stall.

Yaser hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers and eventually let him save enough income to cover the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of vegetables to make pickles to sell from his stall.

loans.name: Madjiguene's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 29 Décembre 2009 et regroupe des femmes issues du même quartier et unies par de bonne relations sociales et professionnelles.Madame Rokhaya est la responsable ,elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants à sa charge.Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de chausses pré fabriquées.
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour avoir pratiqué cette activité depuis bientôt dix ans.
Son nouveau crédit de 450 000 francs cfa lui permettra de se payer des paires de chaussures des écharpes et des bijoux qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de son quartier. 
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires des ses enfants et de renforcer son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 29, 2009. It is composed of women from the same neighborhood who are united by good societal and professional relationships. Ms. Rokhaya is the group’s official. She is the married mother of two children in her care. She is active in commerce, selling pre-made shoes.

She has good experience for having practiced this work for nearly ten years.

Her new loan of 450,000 francs CFA will enable her to purchase pairs of shoes, scarves, and jewelry, which she will sell retail in her neighborhood.

The profits made from her business enable her to meet the food and schooling needs of her children and to bolster her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase pairs of shoes to run a revenue-generating business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia Lucila continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de autopartes de carro, con esta actividad sale adelante y aporta en su hogar los gastos familiares.la socia pertenece al banco comunal "santo Domingo" y es muy trabajadora y emprendedora por eso quiere seguir ampliando sus negocio y dar más opciones de compra a sus clientes.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar llantas, lunas de carro y retrovisores.
La socia esta contenta y agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella y ayudarla a seguir a adelante.
texts.en:
The partner Lucila continues making a living in her car parts sales business. With this activity, she gets ahead and brings home the household expenses. The partner belongs to the communal bank "Santo Domingo" and she is very hard-working and enterprising. For this reason, she wants to continue expanding her business and give her customers more purchase options.

The partner requests a loan in order to buy tires, car windows and rearview mirrors.

The partner is pleased and grateful to the Kiva investors for continuing to trust her and helping her to forge ahead.

loans.use: to buy tires, car windows and rearview mirrors.

loans.name: Lissette Mercedes

texts.es:
Lissette, solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en mercadería para su negocio como granos básicos, cantaros, guacales, platos, entre otros productos plásticos, la compra la realizara al crédito y al contado.
Lissette manifiesta que el crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de plásticos, granos básicos, etc. Esto le dio la oportunidad de poder tener mejores ingresos que le permiten darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, además de poder incrementar el  inventario de su negocio y atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
Lissette is applying for a new loan to invest in merchandise for her business, such as basic grains, pitchers, crates, and plates, among other plastic products. She makes her purchases on credit and for cash.

Lissette states that she invested the previous loan in the purchase of plastics, basic grains, etc. This gave her the opportunity to be able to have better income, which allowed her to give a better quality of life to her family, in addition to being able to increase the inventory of her business and attract more customers.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her business, such as basic grains, pitchers, crates, and plates, among other plastic products.

loans.name: Sika Eugenie

texts.fr: Veuve, Sika est une femme âgée de 66 ans et mère de quatre enfants. Sika vie à Baguida où elle produit et vend des amuses gueules faite à base du maïs puis aussi des légumes. Sika s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché du nécessaire et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Sika sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des bols de sucre, de maïs, des litres d’huile et des tas de légumes. Ce crédit lui permettra  d’avoir une plus grande quantité de marchandises ; ce qui lui permettra de réaliser plus de revenu et mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Sika, is a widow, 66 years old, and the mother of four. She lives in Baguida, where she makes and sells tasty snacks made from corn or vegetables. She gets her supplies of necessities three times a month at the market and resells her products by circulating about nearby districts.

Sika is requesting this loan to purchase bowls of sugar and corn; liters of oil; and loads of vegetables. This loan will enable her to have more products to sell, thus enabling her to make more income and to do better at cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bowls of corn, 4 liters of oil, 10 bowls of sugar, and 2 loads of vegetables

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es: Pedro es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a la pesca, actividad que le permite salir adelante desde hace mucho tiempo, además el y su compañera de vida cuentan con una panadería artesanal, actividad que les permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Él tiene 29 años de edad y vive con su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 8, 6, 4, y 3 años de edad, que son la mayor razón de su esfuerzo. Pedro desea mejorar su  panadería, ya que el trabajo en el mar es cada día más difícil, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: latas para pan, un horno industrial y productos para elaborar pan francés y pan dulce.
texts.en:
Pedro is a hardworking man who makes a living fishing, a activity which has allowed him to get ahead for a long time. In addition, he and his life companion have a artisanal bakery, an activity which allows them to have better economic income. He is 29 years old and he lives with his life companion and their four children 8, 6, 4, and 3, who are the principal reason for his efforts.

Pedro wants to improve his bakery since the work at sea is more difficult every day. For this reason, he requests a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in bread pans, an industrial oven and products for making French bread and sweet bread.

loans.use: to invest in bread pans, an industrial oven and products for making French bread and sweet bread.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de choclos, con estas actividad el socio sustenta a su familia, por eso desea seguir aumentado su mercadería y expandir su negocio por fin de año.el socio pertenece al banco comunal "Sirenachayoc".
El socio solicito el crédito para comprar choclos.
El socio Carlos está agradecido con el préstamo que le otorgaron los inversionistas de KIVA y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Carlos continues working in his business of selling corn on the cob. With this work, he supports his family. For this reason, he wants to continue increasing his merchandise and expanding his business for the end of the year. He belongs to the communal bank "Sirenachayoc."

He applied for the loan to purchase corn on the cob.

{Communal bank] member Carlos is grateful for the loan that the Kiva investors granted him, and he promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy corn on the cob.

loans.name: Bintumwa Group

texts.fr:
Anatole   fait partie du groupe Bintumwa  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 36 ans et est mariée à Concilie,  un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, anges de 6 à 10 ans  tous étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de bananes  depuis  15ans. 

Il est à son dix-septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter  son capital et acheter une grande  quantité  de bananes à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années, il voudrait  acheter des terres cultivables  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Anatole is part of the group Bintumwa and lives in Bujumbura. He is 36 years old and married to Concilie, a farmer. Together they have four children, from 6 to 10 years old, all students.

Anatole has been doing commerce in bananas, for fifteen years.

He is on his 17th Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to augment his capital and purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy arable land and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a su actividad como profesora de nivel secundario, es una labor que a ella le gusta porque quiere forjar bien a las nuevas generaciones. La socia por fin de año necesita equipar su hogar con electrodomésticos que le será de utilidad.
Elizabeth peticiono el crédito para comprar una cocina para su hogar.
La socia agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella y ayudarle a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The partner makes a living as a secondary school teacher. It is work she likes because she wants to prepare the new generations well. For the end of the year, the partner needs to equip her home with home appliances which she can use.

Elizabeth requested the loan in order to buy a stove for her home.

The partner thanks the Kiva investors for continuing to trust her and helping her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a stove for her home.

loans.name: Aref

texts.en: Aref is 25 years old and lives in Marka with his wife and his two children. He is the sole breadwinner in his family. Because of ‎that, Aref decided to start his own business to increase his income and improve the standard of living for his family.  Aref ‎opened a grocery store near his home and now he wants to buy more kinds of products and food supplies to sell to attract ‎more customers. Because of that, he applied for a loan to help him buy what he wants and expand his business.‎

loans.use: to buy more kinds of products and food supplies to sell to attract ‎more customers

loans.name: Clarah

texts.en:
Clarah is 25 years old and lives with her husband and child in Guruve district in Zimbabwe. She raises chickens in order to pay school fees for her child and to help support her extended family. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local high school, encouraging her students to find their own strengths and build their confidence.

Clarah is requesting a 500 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Camfed Zimbabwe to build a large chicken run for her flock. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

Clarah plans to use her profits to pursue her dream of opening a take-out restaurant.

loans.use: to build a large chicken run for her flock.

loans.name: Fatheye

texts.en:
Fatheye is a 32-year-old, married woman with two children. She lives in Irbid, which is affected by the Syrian conflict, since where ‎they live and work is close to the Syrian border. There are a lot of refugees coming into Irbid cities and starting to compete with ‎the locals for jobs. Because of that, Fatheye has to work and help her husband, since her husband is working in a used ‎furniture shop, and all Syrian refugees are able to work in this job with a lower salary.

Fatheye decided to use her talent in ‎making home antiques and flower arrangements, and she is getting a good income from her work. That's why she wants to ‎expand her work and cover more customers' needs.

Therefore, she applied for a loan to help her buy more supplies, ‎flowers, watercolors, and more materials to increase her products to sell, and increase her income to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more supplies, ‎flowers, watercolors, and more materials to increase her products to sell.

loans.name: Felimon

texts.es:
