Felimon con 68 años de edad, de estado civil casado,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su esposa y sus hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaen,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica el a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 10 años.El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Felimon es socio recurrente. Firma con aval.
texts.en:
Felimon, who is 68 years old and is married, lives in his own house made of rustic materials along with his wife and their children in the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaen and the department of Cajamarca, Peru. He has very good personal as well as work references on the part of the residents of the zone. The majority of the inhabitants of this location work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising.

He works in agriculture, specifically in raising coffee, with 10 years of experience in this area. The loan that will be granted to him will be used in agricultural work, applying and incorporating plant sanitation products and fertilizers and paying for labor for his harvest. In this way it [the loan] will help to improve the physiology, morphology, and productivity of his crop. Thus he will also have a timely harvest, and in the end he will have greater production and a better quality of product, which he will have no problem in selling.

Felimon is a repeat client. He signs with a guarantee.

loans.use: to apply and incorporate plant sanitation products and fertilizers and to pay for labor for his coffee harvest.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a 39-year-old housewife. She is responsible for her kid`s education. To be able to do so, she had to find a source of ‎income in addition to her husband`s income. So Manal started her own business and opened a beauty salon in her home. After she succeeded in that business and had regular customers, she opened an independent beauty salon. ‎Now she is applying for a loan in order to buy a new hair dryer, new tools for nails and new makeup to increase her quality ‎of work and increase her income so she will be able to help her husband more and more.‎

loans.use: to buy a new hair dryer, new tools for nails and new makeup.

loans.name: Mirirai

texts.en:
Mirirai, 28, lives with her husband and children in the Chikomba West District. She operates a successful poultry business and uses her profits to pay her children’s school fees. Mirirai used her first Kiva loan to launch her poultry business, and through her success, Mirirai was able to provide food for her family and her relatives.

Mirirai is requesting a second Kiva loan to further expand her fowl run. Mirirai plans to use her profits to continue expanding her business into a poultry production farm.

Mirirai volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students at the nearby high school about active citizenship and personal confidence. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: To further expand her fowl run

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Chikomba West District. She operates a successful grocery business and uses her profits to pay her children’s school fees.

Emily used her first Kiva loan to launch her grocery business and has used her profits to provide her family with food, clothing and blankets. Emily is requesting a second Kiva loan to purchase more stock and increase variety in her stock in preparation for the upcoming holiday season. She plans to use the profit she earns to further expand her grocery shop.

Emily volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions at the local high school and teaching her students about active citizenship. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock and increase variety.

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana es una mujer trabajadora de 25 años de edad que vive en casa humilde pero propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 3 y 1 año de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de pollos actividad que lleva realizando desde hace mucho tiempo y que le he permitido apoyar con los gastos de su hogar. Ana desea construir el corredor de su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, madera, alambre y clavos para construir el corredor de su vivienda y de esta manera brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 25, is a hard-working woman who lives in a humble house of her own together with her life companion and her two children, 3 and 1. She makes a living selling chickens, an activity she has done for a long time and which allows her to help with the household expenses.

Ana would like to construct a porch on her residence and for this reason she requests a loan from FUSAI in order to buy corrugated tin, lumber, wire, and nails to construct the porch on her residence and in this way offer more security to her family.

loans.use: to buy corrugated tin, lumber, wire, and nails in order to construct a porch on her residence and in this way to offer better security to her family.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a 32-year-old mother living with her husband and three children in the Chikomba West District. She sells clothing from her stand at the local flea market, and uses her earnings to pay her children’s school fees.

Irine used her first Kiva loan to launch her business and has used the profits to support her children and family. She is requesting a second Kiva loan to increase her stock and improve her business.

Irine plans to use her profits to pursue her dream of owning her own boutique. Irine volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students at the local high school. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through Irine’s weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent is 23 years old and lives with her husband and child in the Chikomba West District. She runs a stand at the local flea market to cover school fees for her child. Milicent used her first Kiva loan to launch her business, and has used her profits to provide food and clothing for her family.

She seeks a second Kiva loan to rent a larger shop to expand her business. Milicent plans to use the profit to pursue her dream of owning a large clothing shop. Milicent volunteers at the nearby high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, and leads students in discussion groups on how they can create a better world. Milicent will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work with her students.

loans.use: to rent a larger shop to expand her business.

loans.name: Chiedza

texts.en:
Chiedza is 29 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Chikomba West District. She is successfully operating her small grocery shop and uses her earnings to cover her children’s school fees. Chiedza used her first Kiva loan to launch her grocery business, and used her profit to provide food for her family.

Chiedza is requesting a second Kiva loan to increase the variety of her stock. She plans to use the profit she earns to expand her grocery shop. Chiedza volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, and leads her students in discussions on how they can create a better world. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: To increase the variety of her stock

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, 25, lives with her husband and child in the Chikomba West District. She runs a poultry business and uses her earnings to pay her child’s school fees.

Mildred is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more chicks and chick feeds so as to meet increased demand during the holiday season. She plans to use the profit she earns to expand her business into a large poultry farm.

Mildred volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading discussion groups on how her students can create a better world. Mildred will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feeds

loans.name: Eniphar

texts.en:
Eniphar is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Chikomba West District. She operates her garden and grocery business, using the profits to pay for her children’s school fees and to help support her family. 

Eniphar used her first Kiva loan to launch her garden business, and has used her profits to provide food for her family. She now seeks a second Kiva loan to build a fence around her garden and purchase a variety of seeds to increase the variety of crops to better meet her clients’ needs. Eniphar plans to use the profit to construct a greenhouse to further expand her business. 

Eniphar volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, encouraging students to discover their strengths and helping to improve their confidence. Eniphar will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work with her students.

loans.use: to build a fence around her garden and purchase a variety of seeds to increase the variety of her crops.

loans.name: Dzidzai

texts.en:
Dzidzai is 30 years old and lives with her parents and her three children in the Chikomba West District. She operates her own goat farm and uses her profits to pay her children’s school fees and to help her extended family.

Dzidzai used her first Kiva loan to launch her goat farm. Through her success, Dzidzai purchased quality kitchen utensils and is able to provide food for her family. She is requesting a second Kiva loan to purchase more goats to increase her business. Dzidzai plans to use her profit to add livestock to her farm business.

Dzidzai volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students at the local high school about effective communication. The interest on Dzidzai’s social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: To purchase more goats

loans.name: Simbisai

texts.en:
Simbisai, 38, lives with her three children in the Chikomba West District. She runs a successful grocery business and uses her earnings to pay her children’s school fees.

She used her first Kiva loan to launch her grocery business. With the profits from her business, Simbisai purchased food and school uniforms for her children.

She is requesting a second Kiva loan to increase the variety of her stock in anticipation of the holiday season. She plans to use the profit she earns to further expand her business.

Simbisai volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide and instructs her students in effective communication. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to increase the variety of her stock.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
María Raquel con 42 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera, vive en casa familiar,junto a su hijo, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos y cuyes,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 02 años, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para la crianza de los mismos. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio,obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ha manejado 2 préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa uno fue de S/.1,000.00 el cuál lo canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Maria Raquel, at the age of 42, is a single mother. She lives in the family home along with her son in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo in the department of Lambayeque, Peru. She has very good personal as well as work references on the part of the residents of the zone. The majority of the inhabitants of this area work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising.

She raises and sells small animals such as ducks and guinea pigs at her own home, with more than two years of experience in this field. She is applying for the loan to purchase animals and feed to raise them, and in this way to make her business grow, obtain more income, and be able to improve her quality of life.

She has managed two loans with Edpyme Alternative. One was for 1,000 PEN, which she paid off punctually.

loans.use: to buy animals and food to raise them.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 26 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Chikomba West District. She runs a poultry business and uses her earnings to pay her children’s school fees.

Jennifer is requesting a Kiva loan to increase her number of chickens in preparation for the upcoming holiday season. She plans to use the profit to expand her business into a large poultry farm.

Jennifer volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions at the local high school and teaching students about effective communication. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Esnath

texts.en:
Esnath, 33, lives with her husband and three children in the Chikomba West District. She runs a poultry business and uses her earnings to cover her children’s school fees. 

Esnath seeks a Kiva loan to purchase more chicks and chick feed to increase business during the holiday season. She plans to use the profit to expand her business into a large poultry farm. 

Esnath volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, helping students at the local high school to improve their confidence and discover their strengths. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Chikomba West District. She uses the earnings from her poultry business to pay her children’s school fees. 

Patience is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more chickens to meet increased demand during the holiday season. She plans to use her profit to expand her business into a large poultry farm. 

Patience volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions at the local high school and teaching students about active citizenship. Patience will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Chikomba West District. She runs a clothing business and uses her earnings to pay school fees for her children. Apolonia used her first Kiva loan to launch her clothing business, and used some of her profits to purchase necessary home items for her family.

Apolonia is seeking a second Kiva loan to purchase more stock and increase variety. She plans to use her profits to expand into a large clothing shop. Apolonia volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions and teaching students about active citizenship. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to purchase more stock and increase the variety of items she sells.

loans.name: Shingirirai

texts.en:
Shingirirai is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Chikomba West District. She operates a poultry business and uses her profit to pay her children’s school fees. 

Shingirirai seeks a Kiva loan to purchase more chicks and chick feed, and plans to use her profit to expand her business into a large poultry farm. 

Shingirirai volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students at the local high school about active citizenship. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Enma Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Enma es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos provienen de su negocio que es la venta de útiles escolares y abarrotería, este negocio lo atiende de manera personal y se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes.
Doña Enma su negocio lo realiza desde hace 7 años, solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de productos como pan, café, huevos, harina, frijoles, arroz, etc. para surtir su negocio y aprovechar las ventas bajas donde compra ya en esta temporada navideña hay descuentos en la mayoría de productos.
Doña Enma sueña con poder extender su negocio y poder vender más variedad de productos y así poder mejorar su fuente de ingresos. 


Danli, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015
texts.en:
Enma is an entrepreneurial woman who works in commerce. Her main source of income is her stall where she sells school supplies and basic groceries. She runs the stall herself and wakes up very early to serve her clients.

She has had this shop for seven years, and is requesting support through a loan to purchase products like bread, coffee, eggs, flour, beans, rice, etc. to stock her shop. She wants to take advantage of sales in the places where she shops since during there are discounts on most products during the Christmas season.

Enma dreams with expanding her business to that she can sell a wider variety of products, and thus improve her income.

Danli, Honduras- November 2015

loans.use: to purchase bread, coffee, eggs, flour, beans, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, nuevamente solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fajas, grasa, gasolina y algunos repuestos que le faltan para darle mantenimiento a su molino nixtamal y así ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior Rafael pudo mejorar su negocio y eso le permitió poder atraer más clientes generar más ingresos y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, además le permitió poder resarcir sus deudas.
texts.en:
Rafael is asking for a loan once again, in order to buy girdles, grease, gasoline and some parts that he lacks in order to maintain his corn-grinding machine so he can offer better service to his customers  

With his previous loan Rafael was able to improve his business, which allowed him to attract more customers, generate more income and give his family a better quality of life. Moreover it allowed him to pay off his debts.

loans.use: buy girdles, grease, gasoline and some parts that he lacks in order to maintain his corn-grinding machine so he can offer better service to his customers

loans.name: Mollin

texts.en:
Mollin, 33, lives with her parents and her three children in the Chikomba West District. She runs a tailoring business and sells her sewing to pay her children’s school fees. 

Mollin is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a new sewing machine, material and thread to better serve her clients. She plans to use the profit she earns to open a large tailor shop in her community. 

Mollin volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students at the local high school. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, material and thread.

loans.name: Esnath

texts.en:
Esnath is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Chikomba West District. Esnath runs a poultry business and uses the profit to pay her children’s school fees. 

When she received her first loan she used it to purchase more chicks and chick feed. She is now seeking a second Kiva loan to purchase more chickens and vaccines. She plans to use the profit she earns to expand her business to a large poultry farm. 

Esnath volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching effective communication to students at the local high school. The interest on her social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and vaccines.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer emprendedora que a sus cincuenta y tres años de edad, no deja de trabajar duro todos los días, ella posee una tienda de ropa nueva y usada, zapatos, accesorios, perfumes, entre otros productos, desde hace treinta años ella ha sido una mujer luchadora para sacar adelante a su hijo quien tiene problemas en su salud, cuestión que no le es impedimento tener una vida normal. 
Ella ha recurrido a Kiva y MiCrédito, esperando se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita comprar nueva mercadería como ropa nueva, zapatos, sandalias, perfumes, entre otros, acorde a la demanda de sus clientes para estas fechas festivas, en un futuro desea poder mejorar la infraestructura de su local, además de poder abrir otra tienda en uno de los mercados de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Reyna is an enterprising woman who at 53 years of age has not stopped working hard every day. She has a store with new and used clothing, shoes, accessories and perfume amongst other products. For thirty years she has been a woman fighting to get her son ahead who has problems with his health, which has not stopped her from having a normal life.

She has appealed to Kiva y MiCrédito, hoping to be awarded a loan which will allow her to buy new merchandise like new clothing, shoes, sandals and perfume amongst others in keeping with the demand from her clients for the festive season. In the future she wants to be able to improve the infrastructure of her shop as well as open another store in one of the markets in her city.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise like new clothing, shoes, sandals and perfume amongst others.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo granos basicos desde hace 5 años y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios para poder tener una casa mas amplia.
texts.en:
The young woman face is blurred because she is 24 years old and lives in a high risk zone. She works cultivating basic grains. With her earnings from her sales, she is able to settle some household costs.
She wants to improve her home by building a room, but her earnings from sales are not enough. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy the necessary construction materials so that she can have a roomier home.

loans.use: to buy the necessary construction materials.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience, 30, lives with her husband and two children in the Chikomba West District. She sells soap and kapenta to pay her children’s school fees. 

Patience used her first Kiva loan to purchase stock for her business. With her earnings, Patience purchased food and clothing for her family. She is requesting a second Kiva loan to purchase a variety of products and increase her stock  in preparation for the holiday season. Patience plans to use the profit she earns to open a large grocery shop. 

Patience volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, and encourages students to find their strengths and improve their confidence. Patience will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products and increase her stock.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 28 years old and lives with her parents in the Chikomba West District. She operates a poultry business and uses her earnings to cover school fees for her siblings and to help contribute to her family. 

Martha seeks a Kiva loan to purchase more chicks, vaccines, and chick feed to expand her business. She plans to use her profit to further expand her business into a large poultry farm. 

Martha volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, and encourages students to find their strengths and increase their confidence. The interest on Martha’s social-interest loan will be repaid through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, vaccines, and chick feed.

loans.name: Nicolas De Bari

texts.es: Nicolas de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 32 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked for ten years in agriculture growing corn and sorghum. When he harvests he sells his product in the neighboring towns and he has many fixed clients. With what he obtains from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. and improve the land that is shown in the photograph. Then he can continue with his crops and in doing so have greater income, as this is his only source of work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is a 35-year-old, married man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. 

Yaser has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. 

Yaser took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Chikomba West District. She runs a poultry business and uses the earnings to pay her children’s school fees. 

Marian is requesting a Kiva loan to construct a large fowl run. She plans to use the profit to expand her business into a large poultry farm. 

Marian volunteers at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, and leads discussion groups on how her students can create a better world. Marian will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work with her students.

loans.use: to construct a large fowl run.

loans.name: Maquimanta Purisun Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
El socio Jose tiene 38 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a brindar el servicio de transporte, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona resposablbe, el socio espera poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para su carro.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank MAQUIMANTA PURISUN; the bank is located in Cusco Province. 

The member, Jose, is 38 years old, has 2 children and is single. The member alternates his daily activities, offering transportation service. The member has a good time with his business, which is doing well thanks to the effort he puts in it every day. The member is a responsible person. He hopes to be able to continue working and continue supporting his family.

The member is requesting a loan to buy tires for his car. 

All the members are thankful for the loan and promise to comply with the established repayment dues.

The member who is in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy tires for their car

loans.name: Jaqueline Yaneth

texts.es: Jaqueline tiene 19 años de edad y vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en casa familiar desde hace 2 años. Ella se gana la vida gracias a su trabajo como cocinera, el cual realiza en un comedor del mercado, lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia, con mucho esfuerzo. Jaqueline desea construir un cuarto para ampliar su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto que le permita ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en: Jaqueline is 19 years old and has lived with her parents and siblings in the family house for two years. She makes a living thanks to her work as a cook, which she does in an eatery in the market. This allows her, with great effort, to get the family ahead. Jaqueline wants to construct a room to expand her house. So she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and re-bar to build a room which will allow her to enlarge her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and re-bar to build a room which will allow her to expand her house.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila hails from the town of Panglao. She is a 42-year-old married woman and has two grown children. She raises and sells hogs to the locals and town settlers in her community. Her husband earns a living by being a mason (working in construction). Aside from hog raising, she sells snack foods for an additional source of income.

She needs funds to support her existing hog raising project. Due to high demand for hogs this season, she needs more funds to keep up. That is why she joined CEVI, to cater to her financial need. Leonila has requested a loan to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins. This loan could boost her income and slowly enable her to manage her finances.

Leonila is hoping that someday she will be productive and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Abella

texts.en:
Abella resides in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is 57 years old with four grown children.

Blessed with fertile land in her area, she has been growing bananas and rice for a decade now. She is asking for a loan to help increase her farming production. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer and banana seedlings and to pay for labor to plow and clear her rice fields.

Abella is motivated to work hard not just for herself, but also because she would like to support the needs of her grandchildren, such as school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and banana seedlings and pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa con 68 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, vive en casa propia,junto a su hijo, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de la zona se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales por las mañanas en el mercado antiguo y a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(carneros y aves de corral). Se solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales para venta y otros gastos personales.De esta manera tendrá mayor venta y atención a clientes y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en su calidad de vida.

Teresa cuenta con experiencia crediticia en el Banco de la Nación, con pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
68-year-old Teresa is widowed and lives with her son in a house that she owns. They live in the Cayaltí district of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque department of Peru.

She has very good references, personal as well as professional, from the area's residents. The majority of the region's people make a living in agriculture, business, and ranching.

Teresa makes a living by selling tamales at the old market in the morning, and by raising and selling farm animals (rams and poultry).

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of animals to sell, and for other personal expenses. In this way, she will have better sales and better customer service, so that she can make income to improve her quality of life.

Teresa has a credit history with the Nation's Bank [el Banco de la Nación], with on-time payments.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of animals to sell and for other personal expenses

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is happy that she has been able to maintain and grow her food stall. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs. She is now involved in a business buying and selling fresh meat, which she finds more salable and easy to manage.

She trusts that you could lend her an amount of 30,000 PHP which she will use to buy different kinds of meat like pork, beef, and chicken from wholesalers and resell them at retail prices in her community. She is glad that she now has regular customers which have been referred to her by other customers to buy meat directly from her.

Zenaida aims to acquire a delivery car to use for her meat selling business. She hopes to lead a more stable life as she nears her senior years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to pay for different kinds of fresh meat like chicken, pork, and beef to sell.

loans.name: Wenñena

texts.en:
Wenñena is 49 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Wenñena has a general store business in the Philippines. Wenñena requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Wenñena has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Wenñena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alma Bella

texts.en:
Alma Bella is 27 years old and a mother to two children, aged 3 and 5. It is quite challenging for her to look after their needs now that they are growing.

She is engaged in selling barbecued meat during evenings, and she also sell vegetables for an income.

She needs additional capital to buy more vegetables and meat for the barbecue.

Alma Bella dreams of seeing her business become big so she can afford to send her children to higher education when the time comes.

Alma Bella lives in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and meat for barbecue

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pay her laborer.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosana dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay her laborer.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy an additional stock of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nancy dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 27 years old; she is married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Angela requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Angela has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: José habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de  15 y 17 años de edad. Él tiene 41 años de edad y se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de jornalero en una finca, cercana a su comunidad, lo que le permite salir adelante con su familia. José desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI que le permita invertir en: alambre eléctrico, caja térmica, toma corriente, entre otros materiales para realizar la conexión de energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
José lives in his own home with his wife and their two children, who are 15- and 17-years old respectively. José is 41-years old and earns his living offering services as a day laborer on a farm close to his community. The works allow him to get ahead with his family.
José wants to bring electricity to his house, and to do so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI. The loan will allow him to invest in electrical wire, a fuse box, power outlets and other materials to bring electricity to his house.

loans.use: to purchase electrical wire, a fuse box, power outlets and other materials to bring electricity to his house.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is 31 years old; she married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Donna has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Donna requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Donna has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
A 35-year-old married woman named Run is a resident of Battambang province. She has three dependent children who are all in school. To make a living, she and her husband are growing cassava and working for others for a fee. Pests seriously damage her rice crop, and this is the main challenge for her.

As she is in need of working capital to save the business, so she decided to lead a group of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund.

She is going to use her loan to pay for a labor fee, which she expects to increase the productivity of her crop yield.

She hopes that she will get abundant yields to improve the living standards and be able to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to pay a labor fee, from which she expects to increase the productivity of her crop yield.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 45 years old and married with eight children. With six children in school, Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, shampoo, and other groceries. She has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock to sell.

In the future Violeta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 25 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Catherine buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Catherine requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

In the future, Catherine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 30 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
Mary Ann requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and repair her pig pens.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and repair her pig pens.

loans.name: Ameyo Mawuena

texts.fr: Ameyo est une veuve femme âgée de 64 ans résidant à Baguida. Mère d’un enfant, Ameyo est une revendeuse de savons liquide et de l’huile d’arachide qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Ameyo sollicite ce prêt pour commander des tonneaux de pâte de savon liquide et des bidons d’huile d’arachide en vue de bien revendre puis de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Ameyo is a 64-year-old widow and mother of one child living in Baguida. She resells liquid soap and peanut oil. Ameyo restocks twice a month in the market, and resells by travelling to surrounding areas. Ameyo is asking for this loan to order barrels of liquid soap paste and cans of peanut oil for resale to meet her customers' needs, and to have plenty of financial independence to help her children with their school education.

loans.use: to buy 5 barrels of liquid soap paste and 2 cans of peanut oil

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a hard-working 43-year-old woman who earns a living selling fresh fish, which she does to help manage the finances in her home. She has her own property where she lives with her husband and four children, three of whom still attend school. Her husband is a fisherman as well as a mason (he works in construction). She is happy to have her family.

Lina wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan from CEVI to purchase assorted fish, cellophane, and ice to continue building her business. Her sales will improve and she will be able to provide for the needs of her family.

Lina used a previous loan to expand her fish-vending business and wants to continue doing so.

loans.use: to purchase assorted fish, cellophane, and ice.

loans.name: Haysas's Group

texts.en:
Haysas’s group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Haysas makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Met's Group

texts.en:
Met’s group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Met makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea’s group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Sophea makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokrum's Group

texts.en: The members of Sokrum's Group live in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Sokrum makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokhun's Group

texts.en: The members of Sokhun’s Group live in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Sokhun makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Vutha's Group

texts.en:
Vutha’s group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Vutha makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sophae's Group

texts.en:
Sophae’s group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Sophae makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nhaet's Group

texts.en: Nhaet’s group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Nhaet makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal produces and sells puff loaves and is requesting a loan in order to buy her raw materials such as flour in bulk and diversify her sales to include dry fish. She is 22 years old and currently living with her parents and siblings in the Yendi district. Her work involves producing puff loaves from home and she moves door to door to sell.Also volunteering as a Camfed alumnus, she gives time each week to mentor younger students and members on issues of wellbeing. She plans to use the profit she earns to save as school fees and continue to support her siblings. The interest on her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Racheal's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering. She dreams of continuing her education at the teacher training college

loans.use: To buy raw materials in bulk and diversify to include the sale of dry fish

loans.name: Ahlonkoba

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de quatre enfants, Ahlonkoba est une femme âgée de 58 ans qui vit à Baguida. Ahlonkoba est une couturière qui confectionne des habits en pagnes dans son atelier de couture sise à son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire, Ahlonkoba se rend une fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes, des douzaines de fermetures et un ensemble de huile et de fil en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner un gain et pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Ahlonkoba is fifty-eight years old, widowed and mother to four children. She lives in Baguida and works as a seamstress. She makes pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) in the workshop situated in her home. Once a month she visits the market to buy all her supplies.

Ahlonkoba is requesting this loan to buy pagnes, dozens of zips and a unit of oil and thread. Her increased sales will generate a profit which will be used to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), 5 dozen zips and 1 unit of oil and thread.

loans.name: Thái

texts.en:
Thái is 39 years old and she is married. She lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

Her family has a latrine but it is not hygienic. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Thái's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. With her business profit, Thái hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ukamilifu Group

texts.fr:
Désiré  fait partie du groupe Ukamilifu  et  habite à Ngozi. Il a 45 ans et est marié à Athanase,  une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants, âgés de 3 à 18 ans  4 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de  chèvres et de bananes depuis  15ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter  son capital et acheter   une grande quantité de bananes  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années, il voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Désiré is a member of the Ukamilifu Group. He is forty-five years old and married to Athanase, a farmer. Together they have five children aged between three and eighteen years old. Four of their children are currently in school.

Désiré has been buying and selling goats and bananas for fifteen years. This will be his third loan with the field partner, Turame. The loan will increase his working capital and enable him to buy a large quantity of bananas for sale.

In the coming years, Désiré would like to see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas.

loans.name: Vith's Group

texts.en: Vith’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Vith makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Finess Iii Group

texts.fr: Nyele est une malienne âgée de 40 ans, mère de 06 enfants dont 05 sont scolarisés,elle est veuve c'est elle qui est au milieu sur la photo.Très satisfait par rapport au prêt précédent qui lui a permit d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire.Un prêt qui été bien remboursé et bénéfique pour la famille.Les enfants ont été bien nourrit leur santé amélioré .Nyele n’ayant pas assez de fonds crédit pour  son activité commercial avait fait appel au RMCR  pour avoir plus de fonds crédit  pour mieux financer son activité commercial. Elle s’approvisionne dans les foires locales et urbaines en marchandises ( le riz , et manioc) et après approvisionnement ,elle les revendus aux comptants à des prix acceptables . Pour cette vente elle affirmant avoir fait un bénéfice approximatif de 200000 fcfa et qu'avec ce bénéfice elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de la famille donc  elle souhaite continuer avec un nouveau prêt pour assurer l'avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nyele is forty years old, widowed and mother to six children, five of whom attend school. She comes from Mali and is standing in the centre of the photo. She was very pleased with her previous loan which helped her increase her working capital. This loan was repaid correctly and on time. As a result, her children were well fed and their health improved.

Nyele works with the field partner, RMCR, to finance her business. She buys her supplies (rice and cassava) at local markets and sells her goods for cash at very reasonable prices. Her previous loan resulted in a profit of 200,000 francs CFA which enabled Nyele to support her family and this is why she is requesting another loan. She would like to be able to guarantee a good future for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto  tiene la edad de 54 años, está casado y vive con la esposa y dos hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is 54 years old, he is married and currently living with his wife and children. He is requesting the loan to buy coffee seedlings and fertilisers, and to care for a coffee plantation that he wants to start.

He wants to give the crops the appropriate care so that they will produce a higher yield and, therefore, to be able to obtain a higher income. He wishes to give his family a better quality of life in the future and a higher economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a farmer.

This is the first loan that he is receiving from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't received before other loans from national banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with more accessible conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Bendia 27 (1) Group

texts.fr: BENDIA 27 (1) vient de finir son 1er prêt kiva. Le remboursements a été fait normalement. Kotimi, membre représentatif remercie tout le personnel et les prêteurs kiva pour le soutien. Avec le prêt, Kotimi avait pu payer les céréales (Maïs, haricot, petit mil) pour vendre. Elle a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de payer des habits pour ses enfants, de, faire quelques dépenses pour se famille et surtout d'augmenter son activité. Kotimi a encore besoin de crédit pour continuer son activité. Contrairement aux 1er prêt , cette fois ci au Burkina, le prix des céréales est moins cher donc Kotimi pourra en acheter pour stocker et revendre. A l'issue de ses ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
The 'Bendia 27 (1)' Group has just finished their first Kiva loan, the repayments were all made on time. Kotimi is the group representative is very grateful to all the lenders and support organisations. Her loan enabled her to buy cereals (maize, beans and millet) for sale. Her profits were used to buy clothing for her children, provide for some of the expenses of the family and improve her business.

Kotimi is requesting this new loan to continue her business. This time, cereal prices in Burkina are much lower so Kotimi will buy stock, store it and sell it later. Her profits will be used to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of cereals.

loans.name: Duterintambwe I Group

texts.fr:
Christophe  fait partie du groupe Duterintambwe I  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 32 ans et est marié à Annociate,  une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 2 ans.

Il  fait le commerce de bois sec depuis  12 ans. 

Il est à son seizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter  son capital et acheter   beaucoup de bois  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter des terres cultivables.
texts.en:
Christophe is a member of the Duterintambwe I Group. He is thirty-two years old and married to Annociate, a farmer. Together, they live in Gitega and have a two-year-old child. Christophe has been sellling dry wood for twelve years.

This will be Christophe's sixteenth loan with the field partner, Turame. The loan will increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of wood for sale. This will increase his earnings.

In the coming years, Christophe would like to be able to buy some agricultural land.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of wood for sale.

loans.name: Abakazoza Group

texts.fr:
Agnès  fait partie du groupe Abakazoza  et  habite à Ngozi. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée  à J. Claude,  un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de  1 à 12 ans dont 3 étudient. 

Elle   fait le commerce de chèvres et de bananes   depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son  quinzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  son capital et acheter   une grande quantité de bananes   à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Agnès is a member of the Abakazoza group and lives in Ngozi. She is 32 years old and married to J. Claude, a retailer. The couple have 6 children, aged 1 to 12, 3 of whom attend school.

Agnès has been selling goats and bananas for 10 years. This is her 15th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her working capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of bananas for resale, so that she can earn more money.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Prifania

texts.fr: Prifania, 43 ans, vit en union libre. Elle est mère de deux enfants. C’est une femme dynamique, une commerçante très débrouillarde. Elle revend des fruits et légumes au marché public de son quartier. Elle travaille sans relâche pour améliorer sa condition de vie. Elle cherche un prêt pour augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Prifania, who is 43 years old, is in a common-law relationship. She is the mother of 2 children. She is a dynamic woman and a resourceful retailer. She sells fruits and vegetables at the public market in her district. She works tirelessly to improve her living conditions. She is looking for a loan to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fanjanirina

texts.fr:
Fanjanirina est une femme battante de 48 ans. Elle est mariée avec 5 enfants à charge. Elle habite dans un quartier semi-rural ou elle tient une gargote et exerce une activité d’élevage de poulet de chair et cela depuis 2 ans. 
Elle a déjà pu acquérir du capital pour la gargote mais ce prêt va financer l’élevage de poulets de chair. Pour cela, elle va acheter 100 poussins de chair et 100 Kg de provendes pour engraisser les poussins. Elle a déjà trouvé des clients pour acheter ses poulets de chair. Elle fait aussi de la livraison dans des restaurants. 
Fanjanirina espère gagner beaucoup de bénéfices. Son rêve est de construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Fanjanirina is a 48-year-old with a fighting spirit. She is married and raising 5 children. She lives in a semi-rural area where she runs a canteen and has been breeding chickens for 2 years.

She has already been able to find funding for her canteen, so this loan will go towards financing her chicken breeding business. She plans to buy 100 broiler chicks and 100 kilos of feed with which to fatten them. She has already found customers for her broiler chickens. She also delivers to restaurants.

Fanjanirina hopes to make a large profit. Her dream is to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy 100 broiler chicks and feed.

loans.name: Thomas Philippe

texts.fr: Thomas est revendeur de boissons gazeuses. Il a démarré cette activité en 2009. Grace à plusieurs microcrédits qui lui ont été octroyés, il a beaucoup développé son activité.  Il sollicite d’autres crédits pour continuer à faire avancer son petit business
texts.en: Thomas sells soft drinks. He started this business in 2009. Thanks to several microloans that he has already been granted, he has significantly developed his business. He is requesting more loans in order to keep improving his small business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Angena

texts.fr: Angena a 51 ans. Elle est divorcée et sans enfants. Elle vit seule. Pour gagner les revenus nécessaires pour répondre à ses besoins, elle revend des produits cosmétiques. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Angena is 51 years old. She is divorced and has no children. She lives alone. She sell cosmetics in order to earn enough money to cover her needs. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of cosmetics.

loans.name: Patou

texts.fr:
Patou est un jeune homme sérieux de 24 ans. Il est marié et élève 2 enfants dans un quartier animé de la ville. Il est boucher depuis 7 ans, une activité familiale dont son père lui a enseigné.
Cela fait un an qu’il est emprunteur chez Vahatra. Les bénéfices des prêts d’avant lui ont permis d’acheter des matériaux de construction car son objectif est de construire une maison pour sa famille. Pour ce prêt, il compte acheter 74 Kg de viande de porcs et 65 Kg de viande de zébus. Il a une très bonne place au bord de la route et il pense gagner beaucoup de bénéfices.
Avec les bénéfices, il compte finir la construction de sa maison et constituer de l’épargne pour faire face aux imprévus et assurer l’avenir.
texts.en:
Patou is a serious young man of 24 years of age. He is married and raising 2 children in a lively district of town. He has been a butcher for 7 years, a family business which his father taught him.

He has been a Vahatra borrower for one year. The profits he has earned thanks to his previous loans have allowed him to buy construction material; his aim is to build a house for his family.

He plans to use this loan to buy 74 kilos of pork and 65 kilos of zebu meat. His business is in a very good location on the side of the road and he expects to make a large profit.

He plans to use those profits to finish construction on his house and build savings for a rainy day, ensuring his future.

loans.use: to buy zebu meat and pork for resale.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Ana continúa con su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano (segunda de la derecha, viste blusa rosada). El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comprar ropa de segunda mano por fardos, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque las ventas fueron buenas. Actualmente la banca sigue trabajando junta, pudieron comprar materia prima para sus actividades, realizar el pago de servicios y mejorar la infraestructura de sus ambientes de trabajo. El negocio de Ana mejoró porque logró incrementar su capital de trabajo, “mejoré mi capital y por estas épocas las ventas también mejoran es por eso que quiero seguir creciendo…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque ambula diariamente buscando clientes en diferentes lugares. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con mercadería variada, la desventaja es falta de mercadería para mejorar su actividad. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa, ella desea comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor para mejorar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ana continues in her business selling used clothing (she is standing second from the right in a pink blouse). She used the loan she obtained previously to buy packs of used clothing. Her loan payments were on time as a result of the good sales volume she had.

Currently the community bank continues working together. The members have bought raw materials for their businesses, paid for services and improved their infrastructures.

Ana's business improved because she was able to increase her working capital, "I improved my capital and in that period sales were also better so I could continue expanding..." she says. Her business is successful because she goes out every day to look for customers in different places.

The advantage of her business is that she has a variety of merchandise. The disadvantage is the lack of goods to improve business. Her dream is to open a clothing store. She wants to buy used clothing wholesale. This is her second loan through the institution in the six years she has been involved in this activity.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy used clothing wholesale to improve her working capital.

loans.use: to buy used clothing wholesale to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Cleta

texts.es: Doña Cleta de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace mas de 15 años a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cleta, 49, lives in her own house with her family. For 15 years she has been making and selling tortillas from home and she has many customers. With her profits she is able to cover some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal to conitnue her tortilla business and earn more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal.

loans.name: Cesar Alexander

texts.es: Cesar es un joven trabajador que vive con sus padres y su hermano, en casa propia. Él tiene 22 años de edad y se dedica a prestar sus servicios en el bus de transporte colectivo, actividad que le permite aportar a la economía de su hogar, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder apoyar a su familia. Cesar desea mejorar la cocina de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía, en su vivienda no cuenta con un espacio adecuado para preparar sus alimentos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, clavos, alambre y madera para construir un cuarto para la cocina, donde preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young worker who lives with his parents and a brother in his own house. He is 22 years old and works in bus transportation, an activity that has allowed him to earn an income for the household for which he is happy to support his family.

Cesar wants to improve the kitchen in his house. As can be seen in the photo, the house does not have enough room to adequately prepare meals. Therefore he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy sheet metal, nails, wire and wood to build a room for the kitchen where he can prepare meals.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, nails, wire and wood to build a room for the kitchen where he can cook.

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: María tiene 38 años de edad, ella habita en casa de su propiedad desde hace 20 años, por lo que es muy reconocida en su comunidad. María se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, además en el mismo domicilio tiene una tienda y una venta de gas, lo cual le permite salir adelante, ella desea invertir en su negocio, para lo cual solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: vitaminas, anti-gripales, pastillas para el dolor, etc., para su farmacia.
texts.en:
Maria, 38, has lived in her own house for 20 years and is well-known in her community. She sells medicines and also runs a store in her home and sells gas, allowing her to get ahead.

She wants to invest in her business and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy vitamins, cold medicines, analgesics, etc. for her pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, cold medicines, analgesics, etc. for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Concepcion Marina

texts.es: Doña Concepcion de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos (enchiladas, enredados, tostadas de platanitos) desde hace 15 años e inicio con capital propio, gracias a su trabajo como ha logrado salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Concepcion, 52, lives in her own house with her husband. She sells snack foods (enchiladas, enredados and banana fritters) and has been in business for 15 years. She started out with her own capital and thanks to her work has been able to get ahead and cover household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more products to continue her sales activity and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy enchildadas, enredados (elephant ears) and banana fritters.

loans.name: Aibek

texts.ru: Айбек, 26 лет, женат, есть 2 детей (сын и дочь). У Айбека - высшее образование. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, он занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айбека, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 11 коров, 60 овец и 8 лошадей. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Также есть земельный надел мерою 10,0 Га, где выращивает клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айбек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 голов дойных коров для увеличения продаж экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Айбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, постройку сараев для скота и приобретение бытовой техники для дома.
texts.en:
Aibek is 26 years old, married, and the father of two children (a son and a daughter).  He has a higher education.  In order to provide a source of income for his family, he is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  Thanks to his very hard work, he currently has 11 cows, 60 sheep, and eight horses on his farm.  He sells milk on a daily basis and also has 10 hectares of land on which he grows clover for resale.  He makes a monthly income of about 19,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further grow his farming business, Aibek has turned to Kiva's Partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  This loan will allow him to buy three dairy cows and sell larger volumes of organic milk.  He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further increase his number of farm animals, to build barns for his livestock, and to purchase some home appliances.

loans.use: to buy three dairy cows in order to sell larger volumes of organic milk.

loans.name: Ever Alberto

texts.es: Ever tiene 30 años de edad, ella cuenta con una granja de pollos, la cual posee desde hace varios años, por lo que cuenta con clientes, que solicitan sus productos. Él habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus dos hijas la mayor de 9 años y la menor de 9 meses de edad. Ever desea invertir en mayor cantidad de pollos, para cumplir con la demanda de productos que sus clientes solicitan en época navideña, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado y vitaminas para cumplir con los pedidos de temporada navideña.
texts.en: Ever is 30 years old. He has owned a chicken farm for some years, and it brings him customers who request his products. He lives in his own house with his two daughters, one who is 9 years old and the other who is 9 months old. Ever wants to invest in a greater quantity of chickens to meet the demands of his customers during the Christmas season. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in chickens, feed, and vitamins in order to fulfill the orders during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to invest in chickens, feed, and vitamins in order to fulfill the orders during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette a 47 ans. Elle a 4 enfants. Elle gère un commerce où elle vend des produits alimentaires. Le crédit lui permet de s'approvisionner régulièrement et d'éviter les ruptures de stock. A l'avenir, elle espère développer son activité et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Bernadette is 47 years old. She has 4 children. She runs a business selling food. This loan will allow her to restock on a regular basis and avoid stock shortages. In the future, she hopes to develop her business and ensure that her children's needs are met.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food products.

loans.name: Savern' Group

texts.en:
The members of Savern’s Group live in a rural village in the Kampot province in Cambodia.

Savern makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. Additionally, they will save time since they will not have to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Sewese Group

texts.fr:
Marceline est celle qui a le bidon  d’huile devant c’est une commerçante qui vend de l’huile et d'arachide. Malienne âgée de  42 ans mariée et mère de six (6) enfants : 2 filles et 4 garçons dont leurs âges varient entre  2 et 18 ans.
Marceline n’a pas été à l’école, elle fait recourt au RMCR parce que ces moyens financiers sont limités.
Sa réputation est bonne dans son quartier et dans la ville et elle a toujours bien remboursé ses prêt précédents avec le RMCR. Elle veut  augmenter le nombre de bidon d’huile et acheter beaucoup d’arachide pour la vente afin de tirer plus de profit ce qui va  l’aider à mieux prendre en charge(santé,hygiène,alimentation) sa famille.
Elle vend en espèce dans la ville, elle s’approvisionne dans un pays voisin. 
Marceline a eu des impacts du prêt sur son activité, et un changement notable dans la vie  sa famille.
Elle souhaite avoir d’autres  prêts afin d’acheter plus de bidons  d’huile et d’arachide pour vendre.
texts.en:
Marceline is the one standing in front and holding the basin of oil. She is a retailer who sells oil and groundnuts. A 42-year-old Malian, she is married and the mother of 6 children (2 girls and 4 boys) aged between 2 and 18.

Marceline did not go to school and has turned to RMCR because her funds are limited. She has a good reputation in her district and in town and has always properly reimbursed her previous RMCR loans.

She would like to increase the number of cans of oil she has and to buy a lot of groundnuts for resale, so that she can maximise her profits and can better take care of her family's expenses (health, hygiene, food). She makes her sales for cash in town and gets her supplies in a neighbouring country.

The loans have had a significant impact on Marceline's business and have effected obvious change in her family's life. She would like more loans so that she can buy more oil and groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: to buy cans of oil and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Adjoa est une femme âgée de 50 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Adjoa est une couturière qui expose des pagnes et des articles de mercerie dans son atelier de couture sise à son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire, Adjoa se rend quatre fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander des rouleaux de doublures et des paquets de fil à coudre en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner un gain et pouvoir aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Married and mother to two children, Adjoa is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Tokoin. Adjoa is a seamstress who displays pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth) and sewing material in the workshop located in her home.

Adjoa goes 4 times a month to the market in order to get the supplies she needs and is requesting this loan in order to order some rolls of fabric lining and packets of sewing thread, so that she can sell more, earn a profit and help her husband take care of their children's needs.

loans.use: to buy 3 rolls of fabric lining and 20 packets of thread.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas desde hace mas de 5 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo es como logra salir adelante con su familia, el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro, metal, herramienta, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Antonio is 33 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his partner and daughter. Antonio has owned a metal workshop for more than five years. This business is located in his home. HE has many customers because he does quality work, offers affordable prices, and always tailors his products to his customers tastes. With profits from his work, Antonio is able to move forward with his family. Antonio is applying for a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy iron bars, other metals, tools and more. He can thus continue with his work and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy iron bars, other metals, tools and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
