texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se deidica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace 5 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz por quintales y cal para poder seguir con su tabajo y tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: This young woman's face is pixelated because she is 29 years old and lives in a high risk zone. She has made and sold tortillas for 5 years. Her business is located in her residence and she has a lot of customers. With the earnings she makes she is able to get ahead. She lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She is asking for a loan to buy quintals of corn and lime to continue with her work and have better income.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn and lime.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer de 22 años de edad que vive con su hijo de 3 años de edad, al que está sacando adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado municipal, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes. Sandra desea continuar mejorando su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que en época de lluvia el agua se filtra deteriorando sus pertenencias. Con el crédito anterior ella logro mejorar el piso de su vivienda, por lo que se siente muy agradecida.
texts.en: Sandra is a 22 year old woman who lives with her 3 year old son, whom she is getting ahead with a lot of hard work. She sells vegetables in the municipal market, an activity she has been doing for 15 years, and she has a large number of customers. Sandra wants to continue improving her home and that is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, nails, and wire to improve the roof on her home, since when it rains water leaks in and damages her belongings. With the previous loan, she was able to improve the floor in her home, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, nails and wire to improve the roof on her home, since when it rains water leaks in.

loans.name: Napoleon Alberto

texts.es:
Napoleón, solicita nuevamente un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de una vaca la cual la cuidara, la engordara y posteriormente la venderá, él está  buscando sacar una mejor ganancia y tener clientes satisfechos.
El crédito que anteriormente se le brindo, lo invirtió en  el fortalecimiento del negocio de ganado y en la siembra de granos básicos, esto le permitió continuar trabajando, generar más ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Napoleón is asking for a new loan again to invest in buying a cow that he will care for, fatten up and sell. He is seeking to make better profits and have satisfied customers.

The loan he received previously was invested in fortifying his cattle business and in planting basic grains. This will allow him to continue working, generate more income and give his family group a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow he will care for, fatten up and sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Doña Cristina de 53 años de edad es viuda vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 8 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, adicional a eso tambien posee una venta de pupusas, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como logra salir adelente con sus gastos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Cristina is 53 years old. She is a widow and she lives in her own home with her two daughters. She has had a small store for 8 years. It is located in her residence. She sells a variety of products such as snacks, beverages, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc. She has a lot of customers because of her good prices. In addition to that, she also sells pupusas. With what she earns she is able to get ahead with her expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale, since this is her only source of income, and this way, she can have more earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Edwin Manuel

texts.es: Edwin de 41 años de edad viven casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su carro desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Edwin is 41 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his family. Edwin has been providing transportation services in his car for 15 years. He has many customers, who prefer his services because he is a responsible driver. Edwin is able to cover household costs with the income from his work. Edwin is applying for a loan in order to buy tyres and look after his vehicle. He needs to do this as the car is his only source of income. By looking after the vehicle and working, Edwin can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tyres and look after his vehicle.

loans.name: Cristina Mercedes

texts.es: Cristina a sus 57 años de edad cuenta con una tienda de productos básicos, la cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia, con mucho esfuerzo. Ella vive con su esposo en casa de su propiedad desde hace muchos años, por lo que es muy conocida por los vecinos como una mujer trabajadora. Cristina anteriormente solicito un crédito que esperaba invertir en el techo de su vivienda, pero el baño de su vivienda, necesitaba de una mejora urgente, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, para lo cual comprará: lámina galvanizada, madera, alambre y clavos para mejorar su techo.
texts.en:
At 57 years old, Cristina has a grocery shop, which allows her to work hard and support her family. Cristina lives with her husband in a house that the couple has owned for many years. Cristina is well-known by neighbours as a hard-working woman.

Cristina took out a loan in order to fix the roof of her home. Unfortunately, her bathroom needed urgent repair work. She is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy metal sheeting, wood, wire and nails to improve her roof.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, wire and nails to improve her roof.

loans.name: Narin's Group

texts.en:
Narin’s group live in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Narin makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Narin and her group member safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

texts.en:
Nim’s group live in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Nim makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Nim and her group member to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: That's Group

texts.en:
That’s group live in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. That makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help That and her group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia, 44, owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like sugar, cooking oil, eggs, assorted canned goods, firewood and toiletries. She has two school-aged children.

She has been running her sari-sari store for many years now, serving neighbors in the community where she lives.

Sales of basic commodities are at peak these days, but she has very limited capital to do bulk purchases to fill the inventory in her shop.

Lucia is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries, soft drinks and liquor. These are vital in her day-to-day livelihood activity. In that way, her income will slowly improve and she will be able to provide her children with healthy diets. Slowly, she could start to set aside some profits for emergency use.

In the future, she dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries, soft drinks and liquor.

loans.name: Hòa

texts.en:
Hòa is 39 years old and she is married. Hòa lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, this region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.

She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Hòa first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Hòa hopes someday to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita is married to a fisherman from the town of Garcia Hernandez. Since her marriage, she has been actively involve in the fishing business and selling of her husband's catch to the people in her community. Her children are mostly grown, but her youngest is 14.

Ramonita is asking a loan to buy fishing nets and a new engine for their fishing boats in order to enhance their catch. She is confident that with the loan, their problems will be addressed and they can increase their income.

Ramonita will use her profit for the education of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and an engine.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla a sus 30 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad en compañía de su hermano mayor. Ella se gana la vida con su tienda de productos básicos, lo cual le permite salir adelante con su familia. Karla desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para mejorar el techo de su vivienda. Con el crédito anterior ella mejoro el techo del corredor de su vivienda, por lo que se siente muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Karla is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her older brother. She makes a living with her shop selling basic goods which means she can support her family.

Karla wants to improve the roof on her house and in order to do this she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy: galvanized steel, wood and nails in order to improve the roof on her house. With her previous loan she improved the hallway ceiling in her home and she feels very grateful for this.

loans.use: to buy galvanized steel, wood and nails to improve the roof on her house.

loans.name: Jose Sotero

texts.es:
Jose, es un hombre que vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, de 5, 3 y 2 años de edad, los cuales dependen del económicamente; Jose se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y a la apicultura (colmenas), el manifiesta que tiene 52 colmenas y lleva 3 años dedicándose a ese oficio que aprendió gracias a una ONG que lo capacito.
Jose solicita el crédito para invertirlo madera, alambre, clavos, etc., para la elaboración de cajas de madera en las que podrá alimentar los enjambres de abejas, esto le permitirá aumentar la producción de colmenas, además podrá adquirir insumos agrícolas para sacar una buena cosecha de los granos básicos; por ende podrá generar mayores ingresos y de esa manera poderle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El sueño de Jose es poder enseñarle este oficio a su grupo familiar y de esa manera poder aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Jose is a man who lives with his wife and three children, ages 2, 3, and 5.  They are financially dependent on him.  Jose works cultivating basic grains and keeping bees (hives).  He states that he has 52 hives and has been doing this work for three years.  He learned how to do it thanks to an NGO that trained him.

Jose is asking for a loan to invest in wood, wire, nails, etc., for making wooden boxes in which he will be able to feed the bee colonies.  This will allow him to increase his hive production.  Additionally, he will be able to get agricultural supplies for getting a good harvest of basic grains.  In the end, he will be able to generate a better income and, in that way, he can give his family a better quality of life.

Jose’s dream is to be able to teach his family this type of work and, in that way, increase his production.

loans.use: to invest in wood, wire, nails, etc., to make wooden boxes in which he will be able to feed his bee colonies

loans.name: Nghĩa

texts.en:
Mr Nghĩa is 41 years old and married. He has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years. Nghĩa lives in Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. His family is a low-income household in the village, and his job is unstable.

His family has a two-hole latrine. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is that the latrine is not hygienic. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Nghĩa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. With his business profit, Nghĩa hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Erenie

texts.en:
Erenie is 43 years old, married, and has six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Erenie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Erenie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Giovanni

texts.es: oscar de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida se dedica desde hace varios años a la pesca y venta de punches(cangrejos) por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando nuevamente un credito pero en esta ocasion es para darle mantenimiento a la lancha y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Oscar, 33, lives in his own home with his life partner. For several years now, he's earned a living by fishing for and selling punches (crabs) in the local markets near his home. He has many clients due to his good prices, and with the profits he can meet some of the household expenses.

He is applying for a loan again, but this time it is to repair the boat so that he can continue with his work, which brings him good income.

loans.use: to repair the boat.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 34-year-old, hog raiser from the town of Dimiao, Bohol. She is a hardworking woman who raises five children out of this business. Marites is asking for a loan to supply the needs of her present hogs through feed as well as to buy additional piglets to raise. Some amount from the loan will also be utilized for her child's school fees.

Marites will continue to hope for the best so that she can give her children a better chance in life through education. Their education is her priority at the moment. Any income generated will be for school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed and to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 50 years old and married with one child.

Hannah works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Hannah has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Hannah aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Ana Ermelinda

texts.es:
Ana, de 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, pero que actualmente están de vacaciones.

Ana, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ella vende su producto de manera ambulante, es decir que ella viaja a los cantones vecinos a vender su producto.  

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa de moda y a buen precio, para salir a vender en estas fechas de fin de año; pues ella espera que la temporada le ayude a obtener buenos ingresos. 

Los sueños de Ana, son poder continuar con su negocio y así darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener una mejor calidad de vida a lado de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Ana, aged 33, is a single mother of two school-aged children who are currently on holiday.

Ana works selling clothes for women, men and children. She sells her products as a street vendor, meaning that she travels to neighbouring cantons to sell these products.

Ana needs this loan to buy fashionable clothing at good prices in order to sell it towards the end of the year, as she hopes that the season will help her to earn a good income.

Ana dreams of being able to continue her business and provide her children with a good education, and of having a better quality of life together with her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fashionable clothing at good prices in order to sell it.

loans.name: Kerhieb's Group

texts.en: The members of Kerhieb’s Group live in a rural village in the Kampot province of Cambodia. Kerhieb makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family

loans.name: Arn's Group

texts.en: The members of Arn’s Group live in a rural village in the Kampot province in Cambodia. Arn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en: The members of Phorn’s Group live in a rural village in the Kampot province in Cambodia. Phorn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families

loans.name: Phun's Group

texts.en: The members of Phun’s Group live in a rural village in the Kampot province in Cambodia. Phun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families

loans.name: Erika Jesenia

texts.es:
Erika tiene 23 años y se dedica a la agricultura. Ella vive con sus abuelos en una pequeña comunidad llamada Gulachan, cerca de Lita al norte del Ecuador. Erika creció junto a sus abuelos y hoy en día, ella cuida de ellos. 

Erika cultiva café, la zona donde vive es muy conocida ya que su clima es perfecto para el cultivo de este tipo de productos. Ella está casada pero su esposo no le puede ayudar en el campo, ya que tiene un empleo en la ciudad y viaja todas las semanas a su trabajo. Ambos tienen un niño de 5 años que recién entro a la escuela.

El crédito servirá para pagar trabajadores y comprar fertilizantes, los cuales son necesarios para el cultivo del café y así evitar las plagas. Erika tiene muchas expectativas en la vida y su objetivo es empezar ahorrar dinero para en el futuro montar un puesto de comida.
texts.en:
Erika is 23 years old.  She works in agriculture.  She lives with her grandparents in a small community called Gulachan, near Lita in the northern part of Ecuador.  Erika grew up with her grandparents.  These days, she takes care of them.

Erika grows coffee.  The area where she lives is very well known because its climate is perfect for cultivating that type of product.  She is married, but her husband can’t help her in the field because he has a job in the city and travels every week to his job.  Together they have a 5-year-old child who recently started in school.

This loan will serve to pay laborers and buy fertilizers which are needed for the coffee crop in order to avoid infestations.  Erika has a lot of hopes for her life and her goal is to begin to save money to open a food stand in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay laborers.

loans.name: Alvaro Enrique

texts.es: A sus 34 años de edad Álvaro cuenta con una tienda de productos básicos, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Él vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 3 meses de edad, al que siempre busca la manera de brindar lo mejor, y es la razón de su alegría. Álvaro desea invertir en su negocio y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
At the age of 34, Álvaro runs a shop selling basic goods, which helps him to support his family. He lives with his partner and their 3-month-old son, his source of joy, for whom he is always seeking to provide the best of things.

Álvaro wants to invest in his business, so he is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in staple grains, dairy products, cold meats, sweets, drinks and other products to stock his shop with.

loans.use: to invest in staple grains, dairy products, cold meats, sweets, drinks and other products to stock his shop with.

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
Gumercindo, vive con su familia que la conforma su compañera de vida y sus seis hijos, todos dependen de él económicamente, Gumersindo se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, a la venta de plásticos y la crianza de cerdos. Él desarrolla esta actividad desde hace 10 años y lo hace con dos de sus hijos en los horarios de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m.
Con el otorgamiento del presente crédito Gumercindo pretende comprar dos cerdos y lo demás lo invertirá en la recolección de granos básicos y compra de artículos plásticos, esto le ayudará a mejorar su actividad económica, esto le permitirá generar más ingresos  y mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
El sueño de Gumercindo es continuar fortaleciendo su negocio gracias al otorgamiento del crédito para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Gumercindo lives with his family, which is comprised of his life partner and their six children. All of them are financially dependent upon him. Gumersindo grows basic grains, sells plastics, and raises pigs. He has been engaged in this business activity for ten years. He does with with two of his children from 7:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.

Gumercindo plans to use the current loan to buy two pigs. He will use the rest to invest in gathering basic grains and in buying plastic items. This will help him to improve his financial activity. This will allow him to generate more earnings and to improve his family's quality of life.

Gumercindo dreams of strengthening his business in order to be able to get his family ahead thanks to the loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs, to gather basic grains, and to buy plastic items.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer trabajadora de 25 años de edad, que se dedica a preparar diferentes platos típicos, lo cual le permite salir adelante junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 1 año de edad al que busca la manera de sacar adelante. Carmen desea mejorar el techo y piso de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual le permitirá invertir en: cemento, arena, lámina, madera y clavos para mejorar el piso y techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 25, is a hard-working woman. She makes different typical dishes. This allows her to get ahead with her life partner and her one year old son. She seeks the way to get him ahead.

Carmen wishes to improve the roof and the floor of her house. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. The loan will allow her to buy cement, sand, sheet metal, wood, and nails to improve the floor and the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, sheet metal, wood, and nails to improve the floor and roof of her house.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela, ella vive en casa de sus padres y les ayuda con los gastos de la casa. 

María, tiene su propio negocio el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, ella tiene una tienda en su casa, en donde vende productos de primera necesidad como alimentos, productos de aseo, verduras, golosinas, etc. 

María, necesita el préstamo para invertir en su tienda con más productos como azúcar, arroz, café, sodas, verduras, golosinas y más; porque en esta época de fin de año y navidad se vende muchos de estos productos para los preparativos de las fiestas. 

Los sueños de Maria, son poder continuar con su negocio y tener un mejor ingreso para su familia y para sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, aged 34, is a very hard-working woman. She is a single mother of two children who are in school. She lives in her parents' home and helps them with household expenses.

María has her own business, which is her main source of income. She runs a shop from her home, selling basic necessities such as food, hygiene products, vegetables, sweets, etc.

María needs this loan to invest in more products for her shop, such as sugar, rice, coffee, soda, vegetables, sweets and more, because she sells many of these products towards the end of the year and at Christmas to prepare for parties.

María dreams of being able to continue with her business and have a higher income for her family and children.

loans.use: to invest in more products for her shop, such as sugar, rice, coffee, soda, vegetables, sweets and more.

loans.name: Micherlange

texts.fr: Micherlange est âgée de 37 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a deux enfants à charge. Elle est une vendeuse ambulante, elle revend des produits cosmétiques. Son rêve de pouvoir devenir autonome financièrement et offrir de meilleures conditions de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Micherlange is 37 years old. She lives in a common law relationship and has two children in her care. She's a traveling saleswoman who sells cosmetics.

Her dream is to become financially autonomous and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla lives in Garcia Hernandez with her three children, ages 1, 4 and 8. Her husband is a fisherman. She helps him by selling his catch and preparing his tools for fishing.

Myla is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets and a weighing scale. This will replace the old fishing nets and allow them to catch more. Myla hopes that someday, she and her husband can invest in a bigger boat that they can use for fishing to further increase their income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a sari-sari (variety) store owner, where she sells a variety of goods. She is 32 years old and a married woman. She has four children, ages 15, 11, 4 and 2 years old, who need her support. They live in a town of Mahaplag, Leyte. Marjorie has been running her store for five years to earn income. It is the business that helps them sustain themselves every day.

Thus, she hopes to improve this business in the future for their sustainability and for her children’s education. For this, she is requesting a loan to buy stock for her store such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, snack foods, mosquito repellent, drinks and other commodities.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, snack foods, mosquito repellent, drinks and other commodities.

loans.name: Alejandra Sofia

texts.es:
Alejandra es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es alegre, feliz y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max paredes’ caracterizada por agrupar la mayor parte de producción manufacturera y el comercio en todas las áreas, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura máxima de 12 grados centígrados.
Alejandra es de tez morena, baja estatura y usa lentes de aumento, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la realiza en compañía de sus padres que trabajan viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano de mujer, ella compra ropa por mayor para separarla y escoger la ropa femenina, la cual asea y expone en maniquíes y colgadores en su puesto fijo de venta al aire libre, “inicie mi negocio junto a mi hermana, hasta conseguir el capital mínimo para independizarme…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque asea y expone la ropa de forma atractiva. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende ropa por género, la desventaja es la falta de mercadería para las épocas navideñas. Su sueño es desarrollar su negocio hasta estabilizarlo, ella desea comprar muebles y maniquíes para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Alejandra solicita un préstamo para comprar muebles y maniquíes para vender ropa de segunda mano.
texts.en: Alejandra is a 23 year old woman. She is single, without children, and her business is selling second hand clothing. She is happy, joyful and hard working. She works in the "Max Paredes" zone, characterized for grouping the largest manufacturing producers and commerce in all areas. With a cold a dry climate with a maximum temperature of 12 degrees Centigrades. Alejandra is dark complected, of short stature and wears thick lens glasses. Her native tongue is Aymara which she speaks at home with her family and she also speaks Spanish as general knowledge and at work. She lives with her parets who also work. They live in a rented room, built out of brick with corrugated metal roofing and wood floors. They have running water, electricity and sewage. Her business is selling women's second hand clothing, she buys cloths wholesale to sort and choose women's clothing. She then sells them and displays them on mannequins and hangers in her outdoor sales stand. "I starte the business with my sister, until I had enough capital to become independent..." she states. Her business is successful because she cleans and displays the clothing in an attractive manner. Th advantage of her business is that she sells her clothing by gender, the disadvantage is the lack of merchandise during the Christmas season. Her ream is to develop her business until it becomes more stable. She wants to buy furniture and mannequins for her business. This is the first loan with the institution in one year of activity. This is why Alejandra is asking for a loan to buy furniture and mannequins to sell clothes second hand.

loans.use: Buy furniture an mannequins to sell second hand clothing.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is married and has a pottery business in the Philippines.

Emma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy raw materials needed for her pottery business.

Emma has been in this business for 25 years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Melrose

texts.en:
Melrose is 31 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Melrose has a general store business in the Philippines. Melrose requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell.

Melrose has been in this business for four years. In the future, Melrose would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Jovita works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines. Jovita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in Mahaplag in Leyte, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer. Mary is engaged in the hog raising business. She has been doing this to help her husband support the needs of their children. 

Mary requested a loan, which she will use to buy piglets and feed. She plans to improve her business in the future to be able to send her children to college. She hopes they finish their studies and have a good future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and pigs

loans.name: Nabeeha

texts.en:
Nabeeha is a 63-year-old widowed woman living in Zarqaa. Nabeeha iholds a secondary school certificate.

She ‎started to sew clothes and sell them. Then she took a loan and used it to buy a new sewing machine, to increase the quality of her ‎work. Now Nabeeha is applying for a loan to help her expand her business. She wants to buy fabrics and yarns to sew more clothes ‎to sell and increase her income.

Nabeeha`s future plan is to increase her income, and to save money to buy a shop instead of ‎her rented shop, therefore she needs you to support her to achieve her dreams.‎

loans.use: to buy fabrics and yarns to sew more clothes ‎to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en:
‎Jordan has received a large influx of refugees, posing various challenges at the national and local level. The largest impact is in the northern govern-orates, which have been hosting the largest number of ‎refugees. Scarce resources and permitted access of refugees to health and education services have ‎resulted in a huge burden on the local communities in these govern-orates, one of which is Salheye.
‎
Hanady is 23 years old and from Salheye. She is studying Arabic languages and is in her second year. ‎Hanady's father could not cover her tuition fees because of the financial crises that he has faced. Therefore, she applied for an education loan to pay for her next semester fees, and achieve her dreams.‎

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees, and achieve her dreams.‎

loans.name: Gladis Elizabeth

texts.es: Gladis cuenta con una venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre solicitan sus productos, y es con las ganancias de su negocio, que logra sacar adelante a sus dos hijas de 23 y 20 años de edad, con las que vive como madre soltera en casa de su propiedad desde hace muchos años. Gladis tiene 42 años de edad y siempre está buscando la manera de brindar lo mejor a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gladis sells beauty products through catalogs. She's had this job for quite some time, and as a result has a good number of customers who always seek her products. With the earnings from her business she is able to move her two daughters forward, ages 23 and 20. She lives with them as a single mother in a house she has owned for many years.

Gladis is 42 years old and is always looking for a way to provide the best to her family. For that reason she seeks a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica al transporte de carga y al cultivo de granos basicos desde hace varios años, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir su casa pero con lo que obtiene no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razon esta solicitando un credito para la compra de todos los materiales de construccion necesarios y asi poder tener una vivienda mas digna.
texts.en:
Juan, age 43, lives in his own house with his wife and his son. He has devoted himself to cargo transport and growing basic grains for several years. With the earnings that he gets he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

He wants to improve his house by finishing construction. However, he does not earn enough to be able to do so. This is the reason he is requesting a loan to buy all of the needed construction materials. This way he will be able to have a more decent house.

loans.use: to buy all of the needed construction materials.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and married with four children. For the past five years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling charcoal. Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family and she has borrowed and repaid nine previous loans through NWTF. 

Jocelyn is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Elizabeth has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nhenh

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Nhenh is 62 years old and married. She has four children.

She is a farmer who grows rice and bananas for a living. Beside this, she also works as a garment worker. She has been in this business for several years, earning about US$11 per day and is able to save about US$6 each day for future needs.

This is the first loan for Nhenh with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan to buy additional plots of farmland to expand her rice farming business.

She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully and also hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more plots of farmland to expand her rice farming business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokol

texts.en:
Sokol is 29 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she and her husband farm cassava. She earns additional income from selling snacks. The current business earns her family about 90,000 KHR per day. Low crop yield of cassava has been the main challenge for her business. 

Sokol requested her second loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy seeds and fertilizers for her cassava. She used her previous loan to better support her family to have sufficient food and education. She hopes that this loan will allow her to earn more income from her cassava.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her cassava

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Imelda works hard to support her family. She runs a business selling rice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF.

Imelda is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Yérèyiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Kadia est celle qui tient le panier des noix de néré, Elle fait le stockage et la transformation de certains produits traditionnels de consommation,elle est Malienne. Agé de a 58 ans, mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants une fille et quatre garçons âgés de 20 à 30 ans. Kadia n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école mais après son mariage, elle a fait l’alphabétisation.
Elle fait recours au RMCR parce que sa possibilité financière est faible afin de pouvoir acheter plus. 
Femme courageuse et tenace dans son activité, elle augmente son stock de noix de néré (transformé en épice) et fait le métier  de stockage il ya 15 ans de cela. Elle a toujours bien remboursé ses emprunts du RMCR.
Les bénéfices du prêt l’aideront à mieux prospérer dans son activité tout en la permettant de s'occuper à mieux  de sa famille.
Elle fait ses achats et ventes dans les villages environnants, elle souhaite avoir d’autres prêts afin d’accroitre ses activités.
texts.en:
Kadia is the woman holding the basket of néré nuts in the photograph. She stocks and transforms traditional food products. She's 58 years old, Malian, and the mother of five children, one girl and four boys, aged 20 to 30.

Kadia never had the chance to attend school, but she learned to read and write after getting married. She's seeking help from Kiva's partner, RMCR, because her financial capacity is low and she wants to buy more supplies.

She's a courageous and hardworking woman, who stocks up on néré nuts, transformed into spice. She's been in this trade for 15 years. She repaid all her RMCR loans without problems.

Her profits will help her business to blossom and enable her to better provide for her family. She buys and sells in the surrounding villages, and wishes to obtain other loans in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals to transform into spice and resell

loans.name: Augusta

texts.fr: Augusta est âgée de 33 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a deux enfants. Pour gagner de quoi faire vivre sa famille, elle a mis sur pied un petit commerce au détail. Elle revend des produits divers. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Augusta is 33 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has two children. In order to earn enough to support her family, she has put together a small retail shop. She sells general merchandise. She is asking for a loan to expand her stock.

loans.use: expand her stock.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis Alberto de estado civil soltero, es natural de la ciudad de Tarija, tiene una hija pequeña a quien brinda su apoyo moral y económico.
El Sr. Luis Alberto actualmente trabaja como dependiente para la Alcaldía Municipal de Tarija hace más de 3 años seguidos gracias al esfuerzo y el buen desempeño que ha tenido; el desempeña la labor de albañil en estas dependencias en todo lo referido a parques y otras áreas comunes del municipio.
Se pudo constatar además que el Sr. Alberto cuenta con capacitación técnica en el rubro de la construcción en tanto cuenta con el conocimiento necesario como para poder emprender de manera particular su propio negocio, para lo cual requiere recursos para poder adquirir herramientas de trabajo y de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
Vive en la casa de sus suegros y a futuro aspira contar con un pequeño terreno en el cual pueda construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is single, and is from the city of Tarija. He has a small daughter to whom he provides moral and economic support. Luis Alberto currently works as an employee in the municipal office of Tarija, a job he has had for more then 3 years running, thanks to his effort and the good performance has has had. He works as a mason in all the agencies, in all the parks and other common areas of the municipality.

It is also the case that Luis Alberto has technical training in the area of construction. He has the necessary knowledge to be able to set up his own private business. In order to do that he needs resources to be able to acquire work tools. In this way he can improve his earnings and provide better living conditions to his family. He lives in the house of his in-laws, and in the future he aspires to have a small plot of land on which he can build his own house.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies in order to offer masonry and basic construction services to generate income for his family.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 56 years old and married with eight children. For the past six years, she has been a rice farmer and she also earns additional income from running a general store. 

Nenita is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is 32 years old and married with one child who is in school.

Lorie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Lorie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lorie has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jenevy

texts.en:
Jenevy is 27 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenevy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jenevy has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a bicycle taxi.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Teresita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more rice to sell.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 38 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Ann has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bendia 27 (2) Group

texts.fr: Bendia 27 (2) vient de finir son 1er prêt kiva. Le remboursement a été fait normalement. Haoua, membre représentatif remercie tout le personnel et les prêteurs de kiva pour le soutien. Avec le prêt, Haoua avait pu payer la matière première pour fabrication de son savon afin de vendre. Elle a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de payer des habits pour ses enfants, de faire quelques dépenses pour sa famille et surtout d'augmenter son activité. Haoua a encore besoin de prêt pour continuer son activité. A l'issue de ses ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Bendia 27 (2) Group has just finished its first Kiva loan term. The reimbursement was made normally. Haoua, the featured member, thanks all the staff and lenders of Kiva for their support.

With her share of the loan, Haoua was able to buy raw materials to make the soap she sells. She made a profit that permitted her to buy clothing for her children, make some other expenditures for the family, and especially to grow her business.

Haoua needs another loan to continue her business. After her sales, her profit will permit her to continue her activity.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials to make soap, totaling 150,000 FCFA.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 32 years old and married with a three-year-old daughter. For the past four years, he has owned a motorcycle that he drives to earn a living. This is known as “habal-habal” by the locals. Ruel also raises pigs.

Ruel is requesting a loan to buy feed for his pigs and spare parts for his motorcycle to help maintain it in good condition. His goal in life is to enhance his family’s livelihood so they will have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 68 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice and sugarcane in the Philippines. Betty is borrowing 24,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Betty has been farming rice and sugarcane for 19 years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and general store businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
María, de 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos que asisten a la escuela, pero actualmente están de vacaciones, su esposo trabaja como agricultor, sembrando maíz y frijoles. 

María, es muy trabajadora, tiene una pequeña venta de reliquias y artesanías religiosas, ella hace escapularios, camandulas y comercializa estatuillas de santos; tiene aproximadamente 5 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de estos productos, actualmente lo vende en las ferias de los pueblos cercanos y también les está enseñando a sus hijos como poder elaborarlos para tener un poco de ayuda. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales como hilo, piedras de colores, decoraciones religiosas, etc para la elaboración de sus productos y también para pagar el transporte de su tarima de venta hasta la feria donde venderá sus productos. 

Los sueños de María son, poder hacer crecer su negocio para establecerlo en un local propio dentro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Maria, 46, is married with four children who attend school, although right now they are on vacation. Her husband works as a farmer, planting corn and beans.

Maria is very hardworking, she has a little stand selling relics and religious crafts. She makes scapulars, rosaries, and sells statuettes of saints. She has been making these products for about five years, and sells them in fairs in nearby towns. She is also teaching her children how to make them, to have a little help. Maria needs the loan to purchase materials such as thread, colored stones, religious decorations etc. to make the products, and also to pay the cost of transporting her sales stand to the fair where she will sell her products. Maria's dreams are to see her business grow and establish it in a fixed location in the city.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread, colored stones, and religious decorations and to pay the cost of transporting her sales stand to the fair.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en: Tha’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Tha makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en:
Phoeurn is a 53 year old man who lives with his wife in Kampong Basrov village. Both he and his wife are pictured standing in front of their house. Phoeurn has spent many days and time raising his children and now he wants to have a comfortable life. Currently, he is continuing to farm and he also gets some support from his children who have their own families. Phoeurn and his wife use a battery for home energy. Living alone with his wife and having an over 50-year-old body, he has difficulty recharging his battery every week.  

Phoeurn is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a solar home energy system. He believes that solar home energy will enhance his lifestyle in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system

location.town: Kampong Basrov Village, Chhulsa Commune, Chhulkiri

loans.name: Luxon

texts.fr: Luxon a 36 ans. Il est marié et père de deux enfants qui sont régulièrement scolarisés. Ne pouvant pas trouver un emploi, il a décidé de créer sa propre activité pour générer des revenus pour prendre soin de sa famille. Il travaille sans relâche pour faire avancer cette activité. Avec ce prêt, il va acheter un stock de riz et de spaghettis.
texts.en:
Luxon is 36 years old. He is married and the father of two children who are regularly enrolled in school. Unable to find a job, he decided to create his own business to generate income to support his family. He works without cease to improve his business.

With this loan, Luxon is going to buy a stock of rice and spaghetti.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice and spaghetti.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Sokha is a 53-year-old married mother of four children. Planting rubber trees has been the only main source of her family income for 35 years, and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 50,000 Cambodia Riel (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 25,000 KHR each day for the future needs.

Sokha has been with VisionFund for four cycles. The past loans have helped Sokha better support her family members. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan.

Sokha, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and to use a portion of it to pay for labor. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rubber fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Eleni

texts.en: Eleni is a 42-year-old single woman with one child. To earn a living, she makes and sells ice cakes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Eleni needs a loan to buy cordial, a bag of sugar, a new freezer, plastic cups, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. Eleni has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy cordial, a bag of sugar, a new freezer, plastic cups, etc.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: María cuenta con un local en el centro de su municipio en el cual vende diferentes tipos de comida, entre ellos pupusas, platos de comida, tortas mexicanas y panes rellenos, dicha actividad le permite a María sostener a su familia. Ella tiene 47 años de edad y vive en casa de su propiedad junto a sus dos hijas como madre soltera. María desea invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de los diferentes productos que vende, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tomates, panes, pollo, embutidos, bebidas, entre otros productos para su comedor.
texts.en: María has a restaurant in the center of her municipality where she sells different kinds of food, including stuffed tortillas, entrees, Mexican cakes and stuffed breads. The business allows María to support her family. She is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her two daughters as a single parent. María wants to invest in raw materials to make the different products she sells, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase tomatoes, bread, chicken, cold cuts, and beverages, among other products for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, breads, chicken, cold cuts, and drinks, among other products, for her restaurant.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras - Tinyari Group

texts.es: Delma es una socia antigua. Ella desde muy joven se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura. Con estas actividades a la que se dedica ayuda con los gastos económicos en su hogar. Delma desea mucho llegar a lograr ser una micro empresaria. Pertenecer al banquito "Las Emprendedoras de Tinyari" le ha ayudado mucho a mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y de su familia. Se siente muy agradecida con las personas que pertenecen a kiva por creer en ella. Delma es la segunda de la mano derecha y viste una chompa guinda con su manta encima negro.
texts.en:
Delma is a repeat borrower. From a young age, she has worked in farming and cattle-raising. This, along with other work, has helped to cover household costs.

Delma would really like to be an entrepreneur. Being a member of the Las Emprendedoras de Tinyari communal bank has helped her to improve her and her family's quality of life. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for believing in her.

In the photo, Delma is second from the right, wearing a cherry top with a black blanket on top.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with two children, 2 and 8 years old, who lives in Baybay, Leyte. She and her husband earn a living by selling food to the city. They sell “popcorn” and fruit shake. Alma wishes to improve her business in the future. She wants to add another food stall.

She requests a loan to buy more stocks of “popcorn” and fruit shake ingredients (fruit, condensed milk, and cream). She will be able to improve her sales and augment her profit.

loans.use: to buy popcorn, fruit, condensed milk, and cream.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is a 38-year-old woman with six children - two in senior high school, one in junior high school, and three in elementary school. Her husband passed away two years ago, so she has to look after and provide a living and education for her children. She is the breadwinner for her children.

To make money, she sells various cooking spices at the market. She has been doing this well for three years. The current business allows her to cover her family’s life expenses. Even so, she has been thinking of enhancing her stock, such as purchasing coriander nutmeg, sesame, turmeric, etc.

After a neighbor informed her of the loan products provided by Kiva (through TLM), she applied for a 2,500,000 IDR loan. She is expecting that the loan will benefit her business.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell, such as coriander nutmeg, sesame, turmeric, etc.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a Sari-sari store owner from Ormoc City. She has one dependent child who is 15 years old.

Merlyn works hard to financially support her husband (a driver). However, she lacks the fund to improve her business. Merlyn is asking for a loan to buy bottled water, soft drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee, and biscuits.

Merlyn believes that if she will be provided with financial support through a loan, she can finally purchase the necessary stock for her business.

In the future, Merlyn believes that through this opportunity she can improve and expand the range and scale of her business, which would eventually give her a larger income. She hopes that she can continually send her child to school to gain a higher level of learning for a better life.

loans.use: to buy  bottled water, soft drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee, and biscuits.

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en:
Moeurn is village chief in Kleng Por village where he lives with his wife and five children. He and his wife appear in this picture, standing in front of their house. As a village chief, Moeurn has a lot of paperwork which sometimes he needs to do at nighttime. Moreover, beside village chief work, Moeurn also is a farmer who raises pigs to earn extra money for his family. His house does not have a reliable source of energy and he must charge his battery once or twice a week. Since Moeurn supports a family with a lot of members, he wants a reliable energy source that can reduce his utility costs. 

Moeurn is requesting a loan to buy a solar home energy system. He believes this system will help his family reduce its utility costs and improve his ability to work at night.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system

location.town: Kleng Por Village, Prey Moul Commune, Rolea Pe Ear

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Samorn, a retired government official and also a farmer, lives in Chor village with his wife and one child. Having spent much time raising children, now he wants to have a comfortable life. Currently he is still farming and helps with his children's business.

As someone who is over 50 years old, Samorn has difficulty in using a battery for home energy. He needs to recharge the battery every week. Seeing the difficulty of using a car battery, Samorn decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home energy system. He believes solar home energy can enhance his lifestyle and give him comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar energy system.

location.town: Chor Village, Pro Snoeb Commune, Rolea Pe Ear Dist

loans.name: Sochhen

texts.en: Sochhen is a teacher in Pro Snoeb Village and lives with his wife and child. Beside teaching, he helps his wife operate a grocery shop. Sochhen and his wife both need a reliable and efficient  source of energy. Sochhen needs bright light at night to correct students' homework and his wife needs bright light in the early morning and late night to run her grocery shop. They currently use a car battery which is not reliable. It has short life span and is easily damaged. Sometime the car battery runs out during the night. A neighbor recommended  a solar home system, so Sochhen decided to apply for KIVA loan to buy a solar home system. He believes this decision will improve his business and also save on utility fees.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system.

location.town: Pro Snoeb Village, Pro Snoeb Commune, Rolea Pe Ear

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda, 20, was an outstanding student when he was in high school. Currently, he is studying at the university to pursue a bachelor's degree business management. He is from Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. His father is a construction worker and his mother grows rice.

Chanda is applying for a 3,200 USD to pay for his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year. When he finishes his bachelor's degree, he plans to have a proper job with a decent salary so that he will be able to save enough money to build his own house and educate his future children.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Teu

texts.en:
Teu is a 24-year-old single woman with one child. For the past two years, she has made and sold BBQ in her community to earn a living. Teu has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

Teu is requesting a loan to buy a bag of flour, sugar, chicken legs, soy sauce, tomato sauce, and other ingredients. She plans to use the profit from her loan to extend her business and to financially support her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, chicken legs, soy sauce, tomato sauce, and other ingredients

loans.name: Launiusaelua

texts.en:
Launiusaelua is a 45-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has run a sewing business sewing and sold clothes for 3 years.

Launiusaelua has requested a loan to buy an electric sewing machine, needles, and thread. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine, needles, and threads.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 35-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. Her husband has been driving a Moto Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw) for 15 years. This rickshaw is being driven over local roads for short distances. Its body is polyester and is not strong enough to bear bad road conditions. It's engine does not work. This is the reason her husband wants to buy a new Moto Rickshaw.

Sadia requested a loan so that her husband can buy a rickshaw. Sadia thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn was 18 years old when she became involved with business. She is now 32 years old and is married with one child. Her husband used to be a welder, but now he drives a tricycle. Analyn wakes up early in the morning to prepare her child for school. After that, she goes to the market to prepare goods to sell.

With the goal of increasing sales and income, she is seeking capital to buy 20,000 pieces of balot, as well as 1,000 red eggs and quail eggs. She is hoping that, with this financial assistance, she can obtain better sales and income for her family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy 20,000 pieces of balot, as well as 1,000 red eggs and quail eggs, to sell.

loans.name: Vantha

texts.en:
Vantha lives with his wife and five children in Kmpong Basrov village. He and his wife appear in this picture standing in front of their house. Vantha has been a farmer for over 20 years. He is a hardworking farmer who always gets up early to prepare his equipment for farming. Vantha puts all his effort into improving his family’s living conditions. However, his current power source doesn’t help him achieve his goal as it is money and time consuming. Vantha has to charge his battery every two or three days. 

Vantha is requesting a Kiva loan to pay for a good quality solar home energy system. After learning about solar energy, he believes this system will reduce his burden and help him achieve his goal of improving his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system

location.town: Kampong Basrov Village, Chhulsa Commune, Chhulkiri

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn is a village chief in Pro Kroch village, living with his wife and children. Beside doing village chief work, he does farming and raises pigs with his wife (both are in the picture, standing in front of their house). Moreover, he is also a house builder in his village.

As a village chief and also businessman, he needs to do a lot of paper work which sometimes can keep him busy into the night. Moreover, he wants to have a good rest after a full day's hard work, however, his house doesn’t have reliable energy. He has to go to charge the battery one or two times per week.

Seeing the difficulty of using a battery, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan. He believes a solar home energy system can help his family reduce utility costs and improve his working hours at night.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system.

location.town: Pro Kroch Village, Prey Moul Commune, Rolea Pe Ear

loans.name: Khyoeurn

texts.en:
Khyoeurn has worked as a village chief for over 30 years, living in Chor Village with his wife. After spending day and night raising children, now he and his wife live peacefully. Even though they have reached retirement age, they still keep farming.

Over 60 years old, Khyoeurn and his wife have difficulty in charging a car battery every two or three days. After getting a recommendation from their children to buy a solar home system, Khyoern decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. He believes he will have enough energy for his family usage and also reduce his burden of going to charge the battery often.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system.

location.town: Chor Village, Pro Snoeb Commune, Rolea Pe Ear Dist

loans.name: Palatina

texts.en:
Palatina is a 31-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has run a small business selling coconuts for 2 years.

Paltina has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, knives, and a spade. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Palatina will support her family financially and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, knives, and spades.

loans.name: Sisi

texts.en:
Sisi is a 57-year-old married woman with 7 children. She has sold tomatoes and cucumbers for 3 years.

Sisi has requested a loan to buy a spade, chemicals, and a weed sprayer. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital.

Sisi hopes to improve her family's living.

loans.use: to buy a spade, chemicals, a rake, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.en:
Bunafsha is a very kind and responsible woman with three children.

She started raising livestock one month ago and wants to enlarge her new business. Her husband and children help her in the business. She wants to buy sheep and cows and hopes to get a good profit.

She wants to see her children married. She is asking for a loan of 1500 Somoni to buy sheep and cows to develop this new business. She hopes to reach her goal with your help.

loans.use: to buy a sheep and cows.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Mylyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Mylyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries like soft drinks, canned good, personal care products, and other miscellaneous items to sell.

Mylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like soft drinks, canned goods, personal care products, and other miscellaneous items to sell.

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Cerela works hard to support her family. She works buying and selling bananas in the Philippines and also earns additional income from operating a bicycle taxi. Cerela has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.

Cerela is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell to customers

loans.name: Kultuma

texts.en:
Kultuma is a married mother of two children, all of whom attends school. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business by running a wholesale in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes; dheras,dresses, skirts e.t.c for resale.
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes; dheras, dresses, skirts etc for resale.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband operates a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, and sells to relatives as well. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. 

Due to good relations, Shazia's husband's sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Shazia requested a loan for her husband from BRAC Pakistan, which he will use to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Shazia hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way and that this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergent, and biscuits for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Chhan's Group

texts.en:
Chhan is a 43-year-old married woman with three dependent school-aged children. She lives in Kampong Cham province. She has grown cassava for 25 years. She earns about 11 USD per day and can save about 9 USD each day.

This is the first loan for Chhan with VisionFund and she leads a two-member group. She is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve farmland and to pay for labor fees.

She hopes that she can increase the yield, improve her living conditions, and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Chamka Leu district

loans.name: Jamilu

texts.en:
Jamilu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Jamilu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 
Traditionally, Jamilu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Jamilu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Jamilu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Luatupu

texts.en:
Luatupu is a 55-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has sikd tomatoes and cucumbers for 3 years.

Luatupu has requested a loan to buy a spade, chemicals,and a weed sprayer. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. Luatupu hopes to extend her business and to support her family's living.

loans.use: to buy a spade, chemicals, a rake, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 38-year-old married woman with 1 child. She has run a small business selling ice cakes and pop corn for 2 years.

Ana has requested a loan to buy cordial, plastic cups, sugar, and tang. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. Ana will save for unexpected emergencies and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups, sugar, and items for her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 15 years old, while her youngest child is 6 years old. Angelina lives a simple life in the city of Baybay, Leyte. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband financially by selling food (snacks) to the community. In addition to this, she makes mats to sell. Angelina has been doing this for 15 years.

She is requesting a loan to buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, sugar, and fruit. She will also buy raw materials to make mats, such as “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) leaves and dye. Angelina’s goal in life is to own a stall for her food-selling business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, sugar, and fruit, as well as raw materials to make mats

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo lives in Ormoc with his wife. Together, they work hard for their needs since they don’t have children to depend on when they are old. Alfredo raise hogs while his wife sells banana cue (deep-fried banana in caramelized sugar).
