He is asking a loan to buy new ingredients so they can introduce a new snacks to sell. He will use it to buy cassava, more bananas, and vegetables so they can start selling meal food. Alfredo is determined to make the business work so they can earn a better profit to secure his life and that of his wife.

loans.use: to buy cassava, bananas, and vegetables.

loans.name: Paula Raquel

texts.es:
Paula, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora y con deseos de salir adelante, es madre soltera de 3 niños menores de edad, ella vive en casa de su madre con sus tres hijos y trabaja sola para mantenerlos y poder darles lo necesario. 
 
Paula, se dedica a la venta de medicinas y vitaminas naturales desde hace 6 años y ya es muy reconocida por este trabajo que desempeña y gracias a ello ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos. 

Paula, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos medicinales y vitaminados para poder continuar con su negocio.

Los sueños de Paula, son poder continuar con su trabajo y asi darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paula is 32 years old, and is a hardworking woman with a desire to succeed. She is the single mother of three young children. She lives in her mother's home with her three children, and works so that she can provide for them and give them what they need.
 
For the past 6 years Paula has made a living selling medicinal products and vitamins, and is well-known for her work, which has allowed her to get ahead with her children.

Paula needs a loan to buy more medicinal products and vitamins to continue her business.

Paula dreams of being able to continue to grow her business and thus provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy more medicinal products and vitamins to continue growing her business.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en:
Sayohat cares for her four children and provides for their well-being. She began a jewelry business 10 years ago. She wants her children to be educated and study in a good school and university.

She wants a loan to pay for her children's school fees. She is asking for a loan of 7,500.

loans.use: To pay for the school fee of her children

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year old Alejandra owns and manages a furniture shop. She makes doors, windows and dining tables made of wood. She is married and has four children, three of whom are still attending school.

Her husband is a carpenter. Together with her family, she lives in the town of Sikatuna.

Alejandra has requested a loan to purchase wood and varnish. These are very essential in order to produce more finished products and able to cope with demand. In this way, she will be able to gain higher earnings and continue to improve her livelihood.

For the future, she is hoping to have a sustainable livelihood and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase wood and varnish

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is 32 years old, married, and has two children. The lives in Alburquerque. He operates a sari-sari (variety) store. which he has been doing for three years, selling goods such as candies, chips, snack foods, lollipops, coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap, cooking oil, eggs, and chocolates. 

Benjie requested a loan, which he will use to purchase canned goods and assorted groceries. These items will fill his store with additional goods to offer to his respective customers. He could then start to improve his earnings and slowly gain a profit. In the future, he hopesg that he could expand his current source of income to support the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and assorted groceries

loans.name: Chuchi

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Chuchi works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Chuchi is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell for her charcoal retailing business.

Chuchi has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
NAZIA is a 32-year-old married woman who has four children. She lives in a populated area, and her husband knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruits from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers.

NAZIA's husband chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruits every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of fruits. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he could sell the maximum amount of fruits till evening and get the maximum reward for his efforts.

NAZIA applied for a loan so her husband can purchase more fruits and thus increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Asliddin

texts.en:
Asliddin is a freshman in the European Studies Program at AUCA. Asliddin is one of the active international students at this university. He is a member of the Green Campus Club, where twice a month they collect plastic bottles and paper for recycling. He participates in arm wrestling competitions and has received many certificates of honor.

Asliddin needs money to cover part of his tuition fee. Considering the present-day financial status of his family and the overall crisis encountered by his home country Tajikistan, supplemented by the recent drastic cutoff of the migrants’ remittances, the financial aid is the only opportunity available for him to continue his studies at AUCA - one of the most reputable educational institutions in Central Asia.

Asliddin came to study at AUCA from Tajikistan, where he has a father, a mother, younger sister and younger brother. His father is an accountant and his mother is a school-teacher. His younger brother studies at one of the universities of Russia on a budgetary basis. However he has to pay for his accommodations and live by himself. He has to have a part-time job, as the education cost in Russia is much higher than in Tajikistan. Asliddin’s younger sister is also a student at the local university in his home town and his parents totally cover her tuition. Asliddin’s parents’ income is about 200 USD per month, which covers subsistence expenditures.

Kiva's loan will be a great help for him and his family to raise the next well-educated person in his family. Each will be competitive in the modern job market in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education at AUCA

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Luz is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.fr: Célestin a 35 ans. Il est marié et a trois enfants. Sans emploi, il na pas voulu rester sans rien faire. Il a commencé à vendre de l’huile par gallon. Avec l’aide du crédit, il a développé cette petite activité. Il continue à demander des prêts car cela lui permet d’éviter des ruptures de stock.
texts.en: Celestin is 35 years old. He is a married father to three children. When he found himself unemployed, he didn't want to sit around doing nothing. As a result, he started to sell oil by the gallon. With the help of loans, he has been able to develop his business. He continues to request financial assistance as this allow him to avoid shortages in stock.

loans.use: to increase his stock.

loans.name: Hatesa

texts.en:
Hatesa is a 33-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has run a business selling printed clothes for 2 years.

Hatesa has requested a loan to buy a printing board, a sponge, paints, a paint brush, and material. She plans to use her profits to to support her family and to pay for her children's education.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a printing board, a sponge, paints, a paint brush, and material.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
ABIDA is a 47-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She requests a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband has sold vegetables for many years and wants to offer fish as well. He has been using a four wheel manually-operated cart to carry his inventories from one place to another. He is a poor person who finds it difficult to meet his family's needs.

Abida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to buy fish. He hopes to earn more profit and educate his children.

ABIDA thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Raul Roberto

texts.en:
Raul is a 28-year-old farmer. He learned this activity when he was a child. He's married and has a 5-year-old son. He lives in his parents-in-law's house.

Raul finished secondary school but he couldn't continue his studies at university because of money. He has continued working as a farmer and nowadays he is the owner of a small orange tree plot placed near to his parents-in-law's house located in Lita, a northern Ecuador town. His dream is to save money to build his own house.

He needs this loan so he can purchase fertilizers and pay for all the labor. Summer was hard this year and he had to put more vitamins on his crops. Raul will appreciate your support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for all the labor for his orange tree business

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 41 years old, with six children. With five children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Angeles runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

Angeles has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products  and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria Roxana

texts.es: Maria de 43 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la peca artesanal, comercializa el pescado en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razon esta solicitando un credito para la compra de cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para poder tener una mjeor vivienda.
texts.en:
For many years, forty-three year-old María has worked in the traditional fishing industry. She sells fish in the different markets that are near her house. She has been able to make it on what she obtains from her sales.

She wants to improve her home by plastering the walls, but with what she earns from her sales, she doesn't have enough to do so. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand and pay for labor so that she can have a better place to live.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Berta

texts.es: Berta tiene una tienda de productos básicos con la cual logra sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 1 año, por lo que se ha logrado hacer de una gran cantidad de clientes. Ella habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su hija de 29 años de edad, a la que ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Berta desea construir una pila en su vivienda, además construirá una galera que le permita proteger el área de baño y pila, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y lámina para construir la pila y colocar techo al área del lavadero de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Berta has a store where she sells basic necessities that allows her to move ahead with her family.  She has run the store for a year, so she has been able to bring in a large amount of customers.  She lives in a home on her own property with her 29-year-old daughter, who she was able to move ahead through hard work.   

Berta wants to install a sink in her home and build a galley to protect the area around the bath tub and sink, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, bricks, and sheet metal to install the sink and put a roof over the washing room of her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and sheet metal to install a sink and put a roof on the washing room of her home.

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en: Yaw is an organic oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 51 years old and married with four children. Two of his children are in high school and the other two are in primary school. Yaw believes organic oil palm farming is profitable and helps protect the environment. Because of this, he wants to secure a Kiva loan so that he can purchase a harvesting knife to help him harvest and prune his oil palm fields.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku is an Organic and Fair trade certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 60 years old and married with six children. Two of his children are receiving a senior high school education while the others are receiving tertiary and basic educations.

Kwaku believes organic oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan to purchase a knife for the harvesting and pruning of palm oil and cocoa.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Nana K.

texts.en:
Nana is an Organic and Fairtrade certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim - Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa.

He is 45 years old and married with three children. Two of his children are receiving a basic education, while the others are receiving a senior high school education.

Nana believes organic oil palm oil is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife for harvesting and the maintenance of his farm crops.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is an Organic and Fair Trade certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa.

He is 47 years old and married with a son, who is receiving his tertiary education. Daniel believes organic palm oil is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects.

In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so that he can purchase a harvesting/pruning knife to help him prune and harvest his palm oil fruit.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Salomay

texts.en:
Salomay is an organic and fairtrade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Ntronang near Akim Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. She is 46 years old and married with five children, two of which are still receiving their senior high school education and others having basic education.

Salomay is interested in organic oil palm because it’s sustainable and has helped develop her community. In this regard, she wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan so that she can buy a knife from pruning and harvesting of her oil palm and cocoa.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting and pruning knife.

loans.name: Boakye Kwadwo

texts.en:
Boakye is an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 76 years old and married with ten children. All his children have completed school.

Boakye is interested in organic oil palm because it’s profitable and has helped protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan to purchase a harvesting knife for harvesting and pruning oil palm fields.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi is an organic and fair-trade certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 47 years old and married with a son, who is having his tertiary education.

Kofi believes organic palm oil is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair-trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva microloan so that he can purchase a Malaysian knife to help him prune and harvest his palm oil fruits.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Kwabena Agyekum

texts.en: Kwabena is an organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the eastern region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 49 years old and married with six children, two of whom are still getting their basic education. Kwabena believes that organic oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. Due to this, he wants to secure a Kiva microloan to buy a Malaysian knife to help prune and harvest his oil palm fruits.

loans.use: To pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is an Organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 47 years old and married with five children who are still having Basic, Senior High School and Tertiary Education School.

Samuel believes organic oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so that he can purchase a Malaysian knife to help him prune and harvest his oil palm fruit.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en:
Kwadwo is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa.

He is 42 years old and married with 2 children. His children are still involved in their Basic School education.

Kwadwo believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects.

In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can purchase a Malaysian knife to aid in the pruning and harvesting of his oil palm and cocoa.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Kwasi

texts.en: Kwasi is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 50 years old and married with three children, two of which are still having Junior High School education and others at the basic level of education. Kwasi believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can purchase a Malaysian knife for harvesting and pruning of cocoa and oil palm.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is an Organic and Fair trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa.

He is 69 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in Senior High School.

Joshua believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects.

In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can buy a pruning and harvesting knife to help him in the harvesting and maintenance of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Prince

texts.en:
Prince is an organic and Fair Trade-certified palm oil farmer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem district of the eastern region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 46 years old and married with six children. His children are still having their basic school education and senior high school education.

Prince believes organic palm oil is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. I

n this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so that he can purchase a knife for the pruning and harvesting of oil palm and cocoa.

loans.use: to pay for a knife to do harvesting/pruning

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 49 years old and married with 2 children who are have their basic education. Samuel believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a knife for harvesting and pruning of his oil palm fields.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is an organic and Fair Trade-certified palm oil farmer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem district of the eastern region of Ghana, West Africa. She is 55 years old and married with six children, three of whom are still having a senior high school education and others in tertiary school education.

Mary believes organic palm oil is profitable and helps protect the environment.

In this regard, she wants to secure a Kiva micro loan to buy a knife to aid in the pruning and harvesting of palm oil.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Beach

texts.en:
Beach is an organic and Fair Trade-certified palm oil farmer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem district of the eastern region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 72 years old and married with 5 children. All his children have completed school.

Beach believes organic palm oil is profitable and helps protect the environment.

n this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife to aid in the harvesting and pruning of his palm oil field for more yield.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abodom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 53 years old and married. He has three children, two of whom are still in senior high school and the other is at the tertiary level.

Felix believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can purchase a knife for the harvesting and pruning of oil palm.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a Field Officer at an organic and fair trade certified Oil Palm company (Serendipalm) who lives in Kade in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He also farms oil palms. He is 46 years old and single. George believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can buy a knife for harvesting and pruning of his oil palms.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Seidu

texts.en:
Seidu is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abodom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 51 years old and married. He has four children. Two of his children have completed senior high school while the others are having basic education.

Seidu believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can buy a pruning and harvesting knife so that he can harvest and maintain his farm well.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Samuel Amoako

texts.en: Samuel is an Organic and Fair trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abodom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 54 years old and married with six children, three of his children are having Senior High School education with the others having Basic education. Samuel believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a pruning knife to help him in maintenance of his palm and cocoa farm.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

He is 50 years old and married with four children. Two of his children are having tertiary education and others having Senior high and Basic Education. Edward believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can purchase a Malaysian knife to help him prune and harvest his oil palm fruits.

Kwadwo believes organic palm oil is profitable and helps protect the environment.

In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan to buy a Malaysian knife for the harvesting of his pam oil fruits.

Kwame believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can purchase a knife for harvesting and pruning of oil palm.

He is 51 years old and married with 2 children, both of whom have completed school. Stephen believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so he can buy a pruning and harvesting knife so that he can harvest and maintain his farm well.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

He is 41 years old and married with 3 children, all of which are receiving their basic education. Samuel believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He is 69 years old and married with three children, two of which are still completing senior high school and tertiary education. Sampson believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so that he can purchase a harvesting knife for harvesting and the maintenance of his farm.

Kofi is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 47 years old and married with 6 children. Three of his children are seeking basic education, and the others are seeking their senior high school education.
Kofi believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife for harvesting and for the maintenance of his farm.

texts.en: Noah is an Organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 47 years old and married with three children; one has completed senior high school education and the others have tertiary education. Noah believes organic oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so that he can buy a knife for harvesting and pruning of his oil palms.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

He is 37 years old and married with three children who all have a basic education. Kwaku believes organic oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. For this reason, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a knife to help harvest and prune his oil palm farm.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting/pruning knife.

texts.en: Emmanuel is an Organic and Fairtrade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 47 years old and married with two children; one has senior high school education and the other has basic education. Emmanuel believes organic oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so that he can buy a knife for harvesting and pruning of his oil palm.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

He is 43 years old and married with 7 children; two of his children have senior high school education and the others have basic education. William believes organic oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so that he can buy a knife for harvesting and pruning of his oil palm fields.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Frimpong

texts.en: Frimpong is an Organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 63 years old and married with four children; two of his children have senior high school education and others have tertiary and basic education. Frimpong believes organic oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so that he can purchase a pruning/harvesting knife to help him in his work.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is an Organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. She is 60 years old and married with six children. Her children have senior high school education and basic education. Comfort believes organic oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. She wants to secure a Kiva micro loan to purchase a knife to aid in pruning and harvesting of her oil palm.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Op. Yaw

texts.en: Yaw is an Organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 68 years old, married with 5 children. All his children have completed school. Yaw believes organic oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife to aid in harvesting and pruning of his oil palm field for more yield.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is an organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim–Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. She is 45 years old and married with 5 children. Three of her children have a basic education and others have a Senior High School education.

Doris believes organic oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. For this reason, she wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife for harvesting and maintenance of her farm.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is an organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Pramkese near the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. She is 39 years old and married with 4 children who have their Senior High School education and basic education. Esther is interested in organic oil palm because it’s sustainable. For this reason, she wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that she can buy a knife to help prune and harvest her cocoa and oil palm fruits.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is an organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. She is a 68-year-old widower with eight children.  Some of her children are having tertiary education. 

Yaa believes organic oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. For this reason, she wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a harvesting/pruning knife to help prune and harvest her cocoa and oil palm.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Concepcion de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos desde hace 7 años con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda mas segura para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Concepcion is 58 years old and lives in her own home with her two children.  She has made a living raising and selling pigs for 7 years.  She uses her earnings to pay for some of her household expenses.

She wants to improve her home by changing the roof, but she doesn't have enough money to do so, so she is requesting a loan to buy sheet metal and poles and pay for the labor so that she and her children can have a more secure home.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and poles and pay for labor.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su nieto, el se dedica a la albañileria desde hace varios años y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de cemento y arena y asi poder tener una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguel is 51 years old and lives in his own home with his son and his grandson.  He has made a living doing construction for many years and he uses his earnings to pay for some of the household expenses.  

He wants to improve his home by plastering the walls, but he doesn't have enough money to do so, so he is requesting a loan to buy cement and sand so that he can have a better home.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Diana Del Carmen

texts.es: Diana a sus 34 años de edad presta sus servicios en una sala de belleza, que se encuentra en otro municipio, actividad que le permite salir adelante junto a su familia, además cuando le solicitan  realiza trabajos a sus vecinos. Ella es madre soltera y vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su hijo de 8 años de edad, al que apoya para que estudie y tenga una mejor calidad de vida. Diana desea contar las herramientas adecuadas y de excelente calidad para prestar sus servicios a tiempo completo en su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: plancha para cabello, secadora, espejos, peines, ganchos, colas, entre otros accesorios necesarios para su salón de belleza que instalará en su vivienda, y de esta manera cuidar más de cerca a su hijo.
texts.en:
Diana is 34 years old and offers her services in a beauty salon, which is located in a different municipality. This work allows her to progress and move forward alongside her family. Additionally, she provides services to her neighbors when asked.

She is a single mother and lives in a home of her own with her 8-year old son, whom she supports so that he can study and have a better quality of life.

Diana wishes to own sufficient resources of excellent quality in order to offer her services on a full-time basis in her home. She therefore seeks a loan through FUSAI to buy: a hair straightener, a hair dryer, mirrors, combs, pins, and hair ties, among other needed accessories for the beauty salon she will set up in her home. 

Through the new business setup, she hopes to take care of her son more closely.

loans.use: to buy a hair straighter, a hair dryer, mirrors, combs, pins, and hair ties, among other necessary accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 48 years old and married with five children.

Jenelyn works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Jenelyn has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Jenelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rubia Morena

texts.es:
Rubia, de 38 años de edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una tienda y ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar y sus hijos estudian. 

Rubia, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, pero también tiene su propio negocio en casa, ella tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, ella vende alimentos, verduras y golosinas y su esposo le ayuda a atener la tienda.  

Rubia, necesita el préstamo para comprar comprar sodas, pan, golosinas entre otros productos para la tienda, ella quiere aprovechar la temporada de navidad para vender, pues en estas fechas se vende más para los preparativos de las fiestas. 

Los sueños de Rubia, son seguir adelante y alcanzar una mejor condicion de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Rubia is 38 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and their three children.  Her husband is an employee in a store, she is a homemaker, and her children study.  

Rubia dedicates her time to housework, but she also has her own business in her home.  She has a store where she sells basic necessities.  She sells food, vegetables, and sweets and her husband helps her look after the store.  

Rubia needs the loan to buy soft drinks, bread, and candy, among other products for the store.  She wants to take advantage of the Christmas season, since she sells more during the season because people are preparing for the festivities.  

Rubia's dreams are to continue forwards and achieve a better standard of living for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread, and candy, among other products for her store.

loans.name: Evelyn Marisol

texts.es:
Evelyn es una persona dedicada a vender ropa usada y nueva, ella vive con dos hijos, es casada pero su esposo vive fuera del país y le apoya con los gastos del hogar; para tener su propio negocio recibió asesoría de amistades, inicio con poca mercadería, posteriormente ha ido aumentando su inventario y a tendiendo a más clientes, cuenta con más de 6 años de experiencia.
Para ella el crédito le  será de mucha ayuda, ya que podrá comprar ropa usada y nueva como: faldas, camisas, vestidos, pantalones, chores,  etc., de esta manera su negocio será más competitivo y atraerá a nuevos clientes, la esperanza de Evelyn es mantener el flujo de ventas y generar más ingresos para disminuir las necesidades de su grupo familiar.
La Sra.: Evelyn está muy optimista en seguir trabajando para tener recursos económicos con los que remodelara su vivienda, ofrecer nueva mercadería a sus clientes y dará a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a person who makes a living selling used and new clothing. She lives with two children and is married, but her husband lives outside of the country and helps her with household expenses. To have her own business, she took advice from her friends and began with little merchandise. Later, she has increased her inventory and has been tending to more clients. She has more than 6 years of experience.

For her, the loan will be of much help, because she will be able to buy used and new clothing such as: skirts, shirts, dresses, pants, shorts, etc., so that her business will be more competitive and attract new clients. Evelyn's hope is to maintain the sales pipeline and generate more income to reduce the needs of her family.

Ms. Evelyn is very optimistic about continuing to work to have economic resources with which she could remodel her home, offer new merchandise to her clients, and give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy used and new clothing such as: skirts, shirts, dresses, pants, shorts, etc., so that her business will be more competitive and attract new clients

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 49-year-old married mother of two. Two years ago, she started selling linens to cover the needs and expenses of her family. She became her family's only breadwinner after her husband become ill. She is working hard to develop her business but still her income not enough to cover all the expenses of her family.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a medical bed and medicines for her husband, as she wants to increase her merchandise with more linens.
Khadija hopes to keep on expanding her business to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a medical bed and medicines for her husband and increase her merchandise with more linens

loans.name: Mirian Concepcion

texts.es:
María ha quedado viuda y al frente de su hogar, convive con sus 4 hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, ella se dedica a elaborar tortillas para vender, el oficio lo aprendió con ayuda de sus amistades y trabajando como ayudante, con el paso del tiempo y mucha experiencia adquirida decidió establecer su propio negocio, tiene más de 22 años de tener su puesto en el mercado municipal.
Con el financiamiento mejorara el inventario de su negocio, comprara maíz, leña, bolsas, cal y una plancha tortillera, podrá mantener el negocio surtido con todo lo necesario y dar un buen servicio, de esta manera estará preparada para trasladarse al nuevo mercado y espera generar más ingresos para salir adelante con su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son incorporar la venta de nuevos productos en su negocio, tener estabilidad económica, reparar su hogar y darles a sus hijos mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María has ended up a widow and the head of her household.  She lives with her 4 children and she is able to count on the support of her family.  She makes a living making tortillas to sell.  She learned the business through the help of her friends and by working as an assistant.  After the passage of time and a lot of accumulated experience, she decided to start her own business.  She has had her own place at the town market for more than 22 years.  

She will use the loan to improve the inventory of her business.  She will buy corn, firewood, bags, lime, and a tortilla pan, so that she can keep her business well-stocked with everything that she needs to provide good service.  This will allow her to prepare to move to a new market, and she hopes to generate more income to move her family forwards.  

Her goals are to incorporate new products into her business, have economic stability, repair her home, and give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, bags, lime, and a tortilla pan, so that she can keep her business well-stocked with what she needs to provide good service.

loans.name: Vanessa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vanessa, de 25 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres, está soltera y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta bachillerato y no continuo con sus estudios por falta de recursos economicos. 

Vanessa, actualmente se dedica a ayudarle a sus padres con los quehaceres de la casa, pero tiene muchos deseos de tener su propio negocio, ella quiere colocar una tienda en casa, con productos de primera necesidad. 

Vanessa, necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, pan, frijoles y también colocará una vitrina  con pulseras, aretes, collares y accesorios para el cabello. 

Los sueños de Vanessa son, que su negocio sea éxitoso y asi poder pagar sus estudios y graduarse se una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Vanessa, 25 years old, is a very hardworking youth. She lives in her parents' home, is single, and has no children. She studied until her baccalaureate degree and did not continue with her studies for lack of economic resources. 

Vanessa currently helps her parents with housework, but she has many hopes of having her own business. She wants to place a store at home, with products of primary necessity. 

Vanessa needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, bread, beans, and also to place a display case with bracelets, earrings, necklaces, and hair accessories.

Vanessa's dreams are for her business to be successful and in this way to be able to pay for her studies and graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bread, beans, and also to place a display case with bracelets, earrings, necklaces, and hair accessories

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 60 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She lives in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district where crop farming a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, rice farming has been her family’s main source of income for 40 years and her husband works as a construction worker. 
Chea has never been with VisionFund before, this is her first cycle. She is going to use her portion to buy construction supplies for supporting her husband’s business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to buy enough construction materials for her husband.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for supporting her husband’s business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Khatija

texts.en:
Khatija, age 35, is a mother of three children. She runs a tailoring business from her house, which is a source of help to the income for the family.She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the business including threads, needles, cloth etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult.

Therefore Khatija, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of completing her orders. She purchase the needed things with the help of the loan. Khatija is feeling happy that she will be able to help her family with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her tailoring services business.

loans.name: Kwarpo

texts.en:
Kwarpo is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Kwarpo has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Kwarpo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Kwarpo can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Kwarpo will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Kwarpo is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run is a 38-year-old widowed factory worker with four children in her care and she lives in a village in the province of Takeo Province, Cambodia. For the past one years, she has worked in the factory. Two of her children attend school. Run can make approximately $8 per day.

She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With the loan, she will be able to improve the family’s finances. For her future plans, Run is going to buy more cows to breed, build a new proper house and support all of her children to earn high school.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a married woman, with 4 children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, soda,rice, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and her primary customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. \

She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of bread,soda, rice, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to have a bigger enterprise within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards..

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread,soda, rice, sugar and other items

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is married and has four children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a restaurant, which he has been doing for seven years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

Tom requested his second loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank for 70,000 KES, which he will use to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children to university level. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en:
Surriya is a 51 years old, a married woman and mother of five children. Her son is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, she has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

SURRIYA gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son in repairing his rickshaw's engine and for purchasing new tires so he can continue his transportation services. .

loans.name: Samat

texts.en:
Samat is an 18-year-old freshman in the Journalism and Mass Communications Program at AUCA. He chose to enroll in this university not only because it is one of the best universities in Central Asia, but also because his elder sibling studies there as a sophomore (giving him firsthand insight into the life and the quality of education). To become a freshman, Samat had to take extra English classes and improve his math knowledge, as AUCA selects only the best and most diligent students.

Samat’s family lives in the neighboring country of Kazakhstan. There are 3 other people in his family: his father, mother, and elder brother, who also studies at AUCA. At present, Samat’s mother is unemployed. His father doesn’t have a permanent job, so he does everything he can to earn money and support his family. Thanks to diligence, last year, Samat’s brother was blessed to get the donor’s full scholarship to study at AUCA, decreasing the financial expenses of his family. Of course, Samat’s parents are happy to see their sons enroll in the best university, where they will be well-educated and will have a better life than their parents. However, the current economic and political situation in their country doesn't warm their attitude. After joining the Customs Union of the Eurasian Economic Community, Kazakhstan has faced some economic problems.

In spite all of these circumstances, Samat hopes that Kiva lenders will support him and change his life for the better. Samat believes that AUCA is the right place for future leaders, as it helps students build leadership skills and prepare for modern life.

Through three years of collaboration between AUCA and Kiva, Kiva lenders have assisted more than 330 students in getting their bachelor degrees and have made a great impact in raising the future champions of democracy in Kyrgyzstan.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 30 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Gina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mohana

texts.en:
Mohana is a 41-year-old married mother of two. Five years ago, she started working as a hairdresser to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She has a good reputation in her region and has her loyal customers.

She is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate her business and allow her to move to her customers' houses easily.

Mohana hopes to keep on expanding her business to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car which will facilitate her business and allow her to move to her customers' houses easily.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
La señora Mariana estudio para chef, es emprendedora de 30 años de edad, tiene una hija de 4 años, que depende de ella. Hace más de un año que la señora Mariana realizo capacitaciones en el rubro de preparación de pastas y postres. Ahora que conoce mejor el rubro desea invertir en la puesta en marcha negocio de pastas italianas, dándole a su negocio un enfoque empresarial, dado que preparaba sus productos de manera más artesanal y ha pedido.  
La señora Mariana cuenta con buenas expectativas ya que a ella lo que más le motiva es salir adelante y con varias metas por realizar, quiere llegar a formar un capital de trabajo que le pueda brindar una mayor estabilidad económica.
La señora Mariana ve que su negocio de pastas puede crecer y ampliar a nuevos mercados en otras localidades de la región, y así tener una visión de emprendimiento y alcanzar los objetivos que ella misma se traza a lo largo de su carrera.
texts.en:
Mariana studied to be a chef. She is a 30-year-old entrepreneur with a 4-year-old daughter who depends on her. Over a year ago, Mariana completed training in the preparation of pastas and desserts. Now that she knows this line of work a bit better, she wants to invest in starting up an Italian pasta business, giving it a business focus since she prepared her products in the artisanal way and orders have been placed.

Mariana has good prospects since what most motivates her is to succeed. With various goals to achieve, she wants to get to form a working capital that will give her better economic stability.

Mariana sees that her pasta business can grow and expand to new markets in other localities in the region, and so, have a business focus and achieve the objectives that she herself has outlined throughout her career.

loans.use: to pay for implementation and supplies for a pizza shop, so she can better sell her products to the public and generate income for her daughter.

loans.name: Ritchie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ritchie works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Ritchie is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

Ritchie has sustained her business through 13 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 57 years old and has four children. She is a married woman.

Juanita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Juanita has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juanita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sreyneang is a 26-year-old married mother of two children who are dependent on her and still in school. Cassava growing has been the main source of her family’s income for eight years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 40,000KHR per day to meet family’s needs and manage to save about 35,000KHR each day for the future needs.

Sreyneng has been with VisionFund for three cycles. The past loans have helped her better support her family members. Now she is seeking for a loan to buy seeds and pesticides for supporting her cassava and use some of it to spend on plowing the field for growing. With this loan, she hopes to grow her cassava fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides for supporting her cassava

loans.name: Boony

texts.en:
Boony has five children, three of whom attend school. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a cocoa plantation where he earns a living and supports his family. He is a hardworking and determined man who aims at promoting his business to a level of sustaining itself without using borrowed funds. He also buys and sells cocoa to earn additional income. He faces a challenge of limited funds to finance his business

Boony requested a loan, which he will use to buy cocoa and sell it to cocoa companies.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa and sell to cocoa companies.

loans.name: Bert

texts.en:
Bert is an administrator with the district local govt. and in addition he grows cabbages. He is married with 4 kids and 6 dependents. He would like to expand his cabbage farm by opening up more farm land.

He applied for a loan of 1000,000=/ from Ugafode to finance his cause. He will use it to clear the land, buy seeds and mulch for it.

loans.use: to expand his farming land.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamimis 50-years old married woman. She lives with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this since 2005 and now she has gotten enough experience to know the clothing business very well. She wants to use her experience and wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take out a loan due to her poor financial conditions. Due to the upcoming winter season, she expects that the demand for clothing will increase.

This is the reason Shamim showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of clothes at cheap prices, to sell. She hopes that she will use this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothes for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes at cheap prices in large quantities to resell in her community.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 39 years old and he lives with his family in Dilijan city of Tavush region. Arman has higher economical education and for several years he works in banking system. He has a nice wife and a beautiful daughter and she attends kindergarden. Arman' s wife is unemployed and she takes care of their child and their house.

Arman greatly needs this Kiva loan as he has some problems with his teeth which cause him great discomfort in his everyday contact with people, with the regular clients of the bank. This loan Arman urgently needs to solve his dental problems. His thanks and greetings to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: he urgently needsthis loan in order  to solve his dental problems

loans.name: Hermocilla

texts.en:
Hermocilla is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Hermocilla dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Cheer

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Thom province, Cheer, 53, is a married mother of five dependent children, three of whom are still in school. She makes a living through growing rice and working for others for a fee. Earning around USD11 per day, Cheer can manage to save around USD5 each day for future needs. Getting lower yields and drop of rice price are challenges to rice growing business.

In her first cycle, Cheer is now applying for a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fees in IT for her son. She hopes that this loan will enable her son to study at university and she hopes to see her son has a bright future after graduating.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees in IT for her son, which will enable her son to pursue his studying.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice both a primary school teacher and farmer in kajara ntungamo married with one child. She is also a small scale agriculturalist growing crops and rearing animals.

In a bid to realise her dream of a fully furnished house for her family, she applied for a loan of UGX1,200,000=/ to enable her acquire materials like cement and sand from Ugafode. She is happy that very soon her house will be complete and this will raise her family's status in the community.

loans.use: to complete her house

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is the age of 30, an old married woman living with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods. He provides services to his clients for the maintenance of electric goods also.

For the growth of his business and the desire to generate maximum profit for his family, he wants to buy more electrical goods. Therefore, Farhat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy bulbs, tubes and energy savers, switches, bulb holders, sockets, etc. to offer to his customers. She is thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Farhat hopes that her husband will be able to grow his business soon.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods such as bulbs, tubes and energy savers, switches, bulb holders, sockets, etc. for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Nissondia Group

texts.fr: Mamine est une femme marié, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 4 enfants tous vivants résidant au Mali, les enfants sont âgés de 7 à 14 ans dont 1 est scolarisé. Elle est ménagère chez son mari et mené d’autre activité comme élevage de moutons. C’est elle qui tient la corde du mouton sur la photo. Elle est dans l’élevage de moutons il y’a 6 ans de cela et  s’associé à un groupe pour adhérer à la caisse en 2012. Maminé  achète dans les marchés hebdomadaire de ( N’Togonasso, Toto )et revend a Korè et à N’Togonasso pour tirer profits de ses ventes.  Dans l’élevage elle a réalisé des bénéfices qui la permirent de payer 2 moutons qui sont en famille.   Dans son histoire avec la caisse, elle rembourse toujours à la date prévue la totalité de son prêt. Elle est à son 9eme cycle à la caisse. Maminè souhaite de continuer avec la caisse pour augmenter son fond et réalisé des bénéfices qui va la permettre de payer des bœufs pour l’avenir de ces enfants.
texts.en:
Mamine is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of four children, all living in Mali. The children are aged from 7 to 14 years old, of whom one is in school. She is a housewife in her husband's home and is involved in other activities such as raising sheep. She is the woman holding the sheep on the rope in the photo. 

She got involved in raising sheep six years ago and joined the credit union in 2012. Mamine buys at weekly markets (N’Togonasso and Toto) and resells in Korè and in N’Togonasso to make a profit on her purchases.Through farming she has gained income that allows her to pay for two sheep for her family. 

Throughout her history with the credit union, she has always paid back the entirety of her loan on the planned date. She is on her ninth loan cycle. Marmine hopes to continue with the credit union to increase her funds and generate income that will allow her to pay for cattle for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Angela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ángela comparte su vida con sus dos hijos y una hermana, comenta que el padre de sus hijos le ayuda con la manutención de los mismos, su fuente de ingresos principal es la venta de gas licuado, inicio su negocio hace un poco más de un años, atiende a sus clientes de lunes a viernes con un horario de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, aprendió el oficio como empleada en el negocio de una amiga, posteriormente logro fundar su propio negocio.
Para mejorar su negocio se acerca a Padecomsm para solicitar un financiamiento con el que comprara gas licuado y accesorios femeninos como pulseras, aretes, anillos, etc., su finalidad es aprovechar la temporada de graduaciones estudiantiles y la fiestas navideñas, pues así sus clientes podrán apreciar nueva mercadería que les servirá para lucir mejor en dichas ocasiones.
Sus sueños son fortalecer su negocio, ayudar más a su familia para salir adelante y ser un cliente con buena calificación en crediticia en Padecomsm.
texts.en:
Angela shares her life with her two children and sister, and says that the father of her children helps support them. Her main source of income is selling liquefied gas; a business she started a little over a year ago. She serves her customers from Monday to Friday between the hours of 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. She learned the trade while working for her friend's business, before starting her own business.

To grow her business she is requesting a loan from PADECOMSM which she will use to buy the liquefied gas, as well as feminine accessories including bracelets, earrings, rings, etc. Her goal is to take advantage of the upcoming student graduations and holidays, so that her customers may see new merchandise that will help them to dress up for such occasions.

Her dreams are to strengthen her business, further help her family to succeed, and to have a good credit rating with PADECOMSM.

loans.use: to buy liquefied gas, as well as feminine accessories including bracelets, earrings, rings, etc. to take advantage of the upcoming student graduations and holidays.

loans.name: Margareth

texts.fr: Margareth, 41 ans, est divorcée. Elle est est pharmacienne de formation. Mais elle n’a jamais pu trouver du travail dans ce domaine. Elle a donc ouvert sa propre petite pharmacie. Elle la gère très bien et elle gagne assez de revenus pour s’occuper de ses deux enfants. Elle demande ce prêt pour acheter un nouveau stock de médicaments.
texts.en:
Margareth is a 41-year-old divorcee. She is a trained pharmacist but was never been able to find work in this field. She therefore opened her own small pharmacy. She runs the pharmacy very well and she takes in enough income to take care of her two children. 

She is requesting this loan to buy new medicine stocks.

loans.use: to buy new medicine stocks.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is an organic and Fair Trade certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 57 years old and married with four children, two of whom are still getting a senior high school education, one who is at the tertiary level, and one who getting their basic level of education. Alexander believes that organic palm oil is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural Fair Trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva microloan so that he can purchase a knife for harvesting and pruning of palm oil.

loans.use: To pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 47 years old and married with eight children who are still having Basic, Senior High School and Tertiary Education School.

Samuel believes organic oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so that he can purchase a Malaysian knife to help him prune and harvest his oil palm fruit.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth is an Organic and Fair Trade certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa.

He is 50 years old and married with five children, two of whom are still receiving a basic education, while the others receive a senior high school education.

Seth believes organic palm oil is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife to help him prune and harvest his palm oil and cocoa crops.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.
